Star Trek: Phoenix
Communal Zone / canteen
SI'. w'DI. Cherow 28-Mar-21 04:28 PM
[D] The replicators here were nowhere near as good as what you might find aboard a Starfleet vessel. They appeared to be programmed to set menus best designed to keep different species alive. It automatically populated with a person's species as soon as they interacted with the replicator, built for efficiency but not variation. It seemed like the crew were going to have to get used to having the same meal days on end. Tables had been set up here and there but were all poorly maintained with wobbling legs - quite a number of people had taken to sitting on the floor instead. Iconian guards prowled back and forth making sure there were no altercations.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:20 PM
Maggie sighed as she entered. Moving over to a replicator and grabbing whatever meal it would end up giving her. She hadn’t eaten since before the drill, so she needed anything to eat. No matter how bad it actually tasted. Seeing as how she appeared to be the first here, ending up taking a seat near the centre of the room. Having to balance her weight on the tables. She sighed as she began eating.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 03:23 PM
Cas entered the mess hall, at the moment less concerned with food and more thinking of scanning for familiar faces. She looked around for a moment, before she saw what was really the first very good thing in a while- Maggie’s trademark silver hair. “Maggie!” She cried, picking up speed as she ran/walked/limped over to the other woman. “Are you okay?”
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:24 PM
Maggie stood up and practically ran over. Hugging Cas very tightly as she approached. Maggie of course still had the faint smell of blood on her. “I’m fine! I’m fine! How are you? How are the others in your cell?”￼
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 03:26 PM
Karta entered soon after Cas and looked briefly about intently. Finding the food replicators he rushed to one and found that he could only get some sort of weird grey stew which looked completely inedible but he was too hungry to care and turned around to see both ladies chatting in the main area, he moved over to a seat and sat at one of the tables.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 03:27 PM
“I’m fine, I’m- I’m okay.” She said, nodding as she hugged Maggie back. “Everyone in my cell is okay. We’re all fine, at least physically. Who have you seen?”
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 03:28 PM
He whinced now and then as certain areas in his jaw was still sore as he chewed a mouthful.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:29 PM
Maggie sighed as she pushed back a bit from Cas’s ￼embrace. “Oskar, Lieutenant Mera, Captain Enga, and uh Kniel. ￼Where are you assigned?”￼
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 03:30 PM
“Processing.” She replied, pulling back and looking up at Maggie. “I don’t really know what it means, or where I’m supposed to go, but I don’t know what’s worse- asking a guard or trying to find it myself. What’s your job?”
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 03:32 PM
Ramat felt his heart warm, recognizing the many people now filling the canteen - of particular note the Bajoran who he cared for more than anything in the world. Of course he waited to hug her while she talked to her friend. The old assistant Tactical department head. Right...? Wasn't that who she was?
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 03:32 PM
Karta swallowed and then took another mouthful of the mostly unappetizing goo. He smiled to himself slightly hearing the name of the ACOO he had met in the hub back on Phoenix, feeling relieved at least someone he used to work with was alive
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 29-Mar-21 03:32 PM
He got some kind of nutrient paste from the replicators and sat down at an empty table.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:33 PM
Maggie looked at Cas with a sigh as she watched the other members of the crew began coming in. “I’m a uh, scrapper. On the high level, and they haven’t done a good job explaining that either. All I know is that I’m probably taking apart ships for supplies￼. So...￼Phoenix.”
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 29-Mar-21 03:36 PM
S‘Kiv entered, got himself something to eat and sat down at a free table.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 03:37 PM
“Yeah, someone in my cell explained what the pit was.” She neglected to mention the ‘dying on the high level’ part, both for her own sake and Maggie’s. “I can’t believe... this just doesn’t feel real.”
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 03:38 PM
"Yardi...?" Ramat edged closer, not too close considering she was still in a conversation. Icy blue eyes drifted to her leg. A sigh of relief escaped his lips upon seeing that it had improved somewhat.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:41 PM
Maggie looked at Cas with a nod. Before seeing Ramat begin approaching. “It doesn’t. Now I’ll let you two have some time.” She said as she walked back to her meal and started eating. Thinking of Shar while she did, looking at Cas and Ramat.
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 03:43 PM
She entered, made a beeline to the replicator, and got whatever "food" it spat out. After that, she sat at a table and began to eat, barely caring about how terrible the food was.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 03:43 PM
Amanda walked into the canteen and approached one of the replicators, getting some kind of nutrient shake. "Oh good, borg food..." She took a sip, not entirely hideous, and walked around a bit. She spied Maggie and walked up, tapping her on the shoulder. "Hey pretty lady, this seat taken?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:44 PM
Maggie immediately jumped to her feet to hug Amanda. Sighing softly. “Oh Amanda. Thank god. Thank god your okay. How are you, where are you assigned, how is everyone else in your cell?”￼￼￼
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 03:46 PM
"Hmm-?" She turned to see Ramat looking at her. Prophets, it was Ramat. She clasped a hand over her mouth. "Ramat!" She exclaimed, moving towards him as fast as her legs would take her.
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 29-Mar-21 03:46 PM
Talor'etan watched the two, perplexed.
1
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 03:47 PM
Amanda hugged Maggie tight. "God it's good to see you. I'm OK for the most part, stuck in high security and I'm a mechanic. I have Ga'Hatz, S'Skiv, a Jem'Hadar from another ship and a couple others and we're all OK. How are you?"
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 03:48 PM
Karta finished the gruel and took the bowl to the reclamator. Then stood around wondering what he was supposed to be doing from there. The room had filled and he scanned the room for a familiar face, mebbe the ACOO that was mentioned before.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:49 PM
Maggie sighed as she looked at Amanda as she returned the tightness of the hug. “I’m fine, I’m fine. How are the, senior staff? Have you seen any? I have Oskar, Captain Enga from the Inglis is here, and Lieutenant Mera. Lieutenant Kniel as well. Where are you assigned?”￼￼
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 03:50 PM
Rams smiled slightly and scooped her into his arms as soon as she was within reaching distance. Nothing big - not yet anyway. "Your leg." His first concern was that - and her general safety and wellbeing. "Does it still hurt?"
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 03:50 PM
Seeing Cas be happy at seeing Rams made her heart sink. She started to wish Kniel was there, but, given how poorly she had treated him yesterday, it was unlikely he would want to even look at her. In fact, she had gone unnoticed so far. Never in her life had she felt as alone than now, in mess, eating.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 03:51 PM
"I'm a mechanic, so I think I can go wherever. I've talked with T'Svai already and Lieutenant Mera. I was hoping to see Itesh and the rest, but it seems like everyone is ok who was captured. I...haven't seen Mattie, have you?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:52 PM
“No..no I haven’t. And I definitely haven’t seen the Captain either. I’m going up to the scrap yards I think, on the highest level. Which should be fun..”
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 03:52 PM
Amanda frowned and looked away for a moment.* "Maggie...I'm so sorry...the Captain went down with the ship. T'Svai told me that she probably didn't make it."
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 03:53 PM
"It's- it's fine. Nothing I can't handle." She murmered into his shoulder, before pulling back. slightly. "What about you? Are you okay? Did you get fixed up?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 03:54 PM
Maggie looked at Amanda in stunned silence for a few moments. Her body shaking for a second. Before she centered herself. “Oh...oh god. I’m...we just...fuck. T’Svai’s our leader then, and she’s only been in command for like...two months. That’s...awful.”￼
3
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 03:54 PM
Karta noticed that Ota had made it to the canteen and was sitting there on her own. He moved over to where she was eating. "Want some company?" He enquired of her
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 03:55 PM
She looked up, and noticed that it was Karta, from her cell. She nodded in response, continuing to eat.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 03:57 PM
"I did." He murmured to himself - though the spot still burned with pain somewhat. He pulled her slightly away from him, icy blue eye looking into hers - and grinned. "You, Cas Yardi, are the single stupidest, bravest Bajoran I know. I heard you bristle in the face of that Herald."
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 03:58 PM
Kic slid onto the bench opposite. He frowned at her a moment trying to gauge how she was doing. "How are you feeling? You look like theres alot going on in there," he said, tapping his index finger to his temple. "I sure everything will be fine. Look, alot of us are around here."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 03:58 PM
Kniel dragged himself into the mess hall at last, looking for Ota. Come on, it shouldn't have been that hard... yep. There she was. Prophets rue the day he allowed things to come to a close without first talking it through with her. So he made his way over to her side. "Virol." He sounded hoarse. Parched.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 03:59 PM
"At the moment there is no command chain, just...us. We'll just have to lay low for the time being."
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:00 PM
Karta jumped as suddenly someone arrived at the table
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:00 PM
She couldn't help but grin in return. "I've got a voice. Seems only fair I put it to good use." She replied, before fixing him with a curious eyebrow. "What job were you assigned?" (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 04:00 PM
Maggie nodded with a small look at Amanda. Before hugging her tightly again. “Right. I should get to work soon. If you see uh, Sara or any tactical personnel really. Tell them that I’m ￼okay please? Especially Maleb.”
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 04:00 PM
"Absolutely. If you see Mattie somehow just....yeah."
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 04:01 PM
"Not good at all," she mumbled in response, a gross underestimation. She felt miserable. ...and then Kniel came in and sat next to her. At least he wasn't completely hurt from yesterday. "Kniel," she responded, looking at him sadly, and then hugging him. "I'm so sorry for yesterday..." she started, her voice shuddering slightly, tears welling up. (edited)
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:02 PM
"Medic. What I do best." He murmured. "Let's... find a seat. Where we can talk and... things." He surveyed the grim-looking room for one such spot - eventually finding an isolated table enough for two. "How about there?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 04:03 PM
Maggie nodded as she gave one more hug to Amanda. Before rushing over to consume the rest of her meal. Before moving over to whisper into Amanda’s ear as well. “I’ll keep an eye out for anything that can help us later￼. A ￼Chekhov's gun of sorts.”
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 04:04 PM
"Okay, okay. Come here." Kniel bit back tears. He took her into his arms and hugged back just as tightly, burying his nose in the top of her head. She was traumatized, he could tell, emotional, broken even he might say - but she was alive, by the good graces of the Prophets. Thank goodness. "It's alright." (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:04 PM
She nodded. "That's as good as any of the tables in here, I think." She remarked. The room really was very sad. "But we probably shouldn't linger too long either. I'd rather not be late for working in the incinerator."
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:04 PM
Kic abruptly felt like the proverbial fifth wheel. He watched the two Bajorans embrace and smiled briefly. Noting that Ota's demeanor had suddenly changed. He took the moment to scan the room again to try and find the ACOO that he heard mentioned earlier, but still absent.
1
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:05 PM
"Oh, of course." Rams released her and reached for her hand, folding his own gently over and squeezing solidly once. A show of firm support come what may. "I hardly know what the medics do until needed..." (edited)
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 04:07 PM
"No, Kniel, it's not alright," she replied, as she looked up and looked him in the eyes with her own brown ones. "Look at us. We're prisoners," she added, emphasizing the last bit.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:08 PM
She sighed. "Hopefully you won't have much to do at all." She said, voice lowering as she walked over to the table. "Though something tells me that won't be the case. Maybe you just wander in case someone needs something."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:09 PM
"What'd be the use of that? No, I don't think so." He settled down at the table with her directly across from him. Oh, by the Founders, she looked... awful. Downtrodden. Everyone did. "If I were the Iconians I'd keep me locked up until needed. They think I'm high security. Damn right I am."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 04:11 PM
"So?" Kniel squeezed her hand. "We'll get out of here. Somehow. It'll be okay, I believe. All is as the Prophets will it, Virol." Kniel met her eyes firmly, glancing once and smiling at the other Bajoran at the table. "They will shield us. All of us, Bajoran or not. But we must first play our own parts and not lose hope..."
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:12 PM
A small smile graced her face at that as she sat. "They've certainly covered all their bases. Who's in your group?"
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 04:13 PM
It was when he said that that, for the first time since arriving at the prison, she smiled, though a small bit. "I hope they'll protect us," she replied, feeling a small amount of regret for not walking with the Prophets.
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:13 PM
Kic returned to the two reunited lovebirds and smiled again. It was good to see some beauty and positivity in this dank place and to see the change in his cellmate was refreshing also relieving.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:13 PM
"The first officer. Some... insect... thing. I don't know. A Xahean I've never met before. Another Vulcan who I've never met. She was fretting about her bondmate and being trapped here." Seeing her smile lifted his spirit. At least they still had each other in this difficult time.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 04:14 PM
"They will. Trust me." He then turned his attention to the other. "Don't think I've seen you round the ship. When I was told that there were several Bajorans on board, well..." (edited)
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:18 PM
Kic nodded and smiled at the Lt. "Ensign Karta Kictor, Operations. I was mostly found in the Ops hub and quite a few of the hallways onboard Phoenix. I managed most of the Duty teams." (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:19 PM
She let out a sigh of relief upon hearing T'Svai was still alive. At least someone with some kind of Command experience was there. "I've got Ota, Karta-" She gestured over to the table where those two specifically lingered. "Dubrumal, someone named Mattie, and another prisoner from somewhere else. Maggie said she saw Kniel, and some others- Oskar, Mera, and a 'Captain Enga'. So many people still here has to be some kind of good sign."
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 04:23 PM
Seeing the crew be happy made her smile a bit more, and made her heart un-sink. Yesterday, she was so miserable that she didn't even bother to notice them, but now... at least there were people she knew, as well as her friends from the Phoenix, which, she concluded, was likely destroyed, judging from the ruined state of the ship as she saw it through the escape craft's viewports. She continued to hold Kniel's hand as he spoke to Karta.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:24 PM
"Of course. They need us to do their work for them. They'll have to keep us alive somehow." He reckoned dryly. "It will be well, Yardi, I'm sure of it. But we must be careful about how we proceed. Keep things low. When we get back, and no, we will get back somehow - I'll bring you to the holodeck for something nice. Wherever we end up. Okay?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 04:26 PM
Maggie soon after whispering in Amanda’s ear, quickly cleaned up her food and waved good bye to Cas. She needed to go to work. So she left.￼

Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:28 PM

Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:28 PM
She nodded. "Right. Keep things low. We'll be okay." She replied, halfway to him and halfway to herself. "I'd... honestly, wherever. We can go literally anywhere after this and I think I would have the time of my life."
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 04:29 PM
She shook her head. "I don't know who either of them are. Sorry."
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 04:29 PM
"Ah." Kniel managed a tiny smile. "I see. Don't worry. By the grace of the Prophets we will make it through this ordeal. All of us. I'm sure of it."
Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 04:31 PM
Mattie entered the area, again, keeping his eyes low, but he spotted something out of the corner of his eye. Some metal that caught the light just right, his eyes watering as he looked upon his girlfriend. Still breathing. Still alive. And he didn’t... he didn’t know if that was worse. That she was here too.
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 04:31 PM
She looked back at Kniel, smiling a bit more now. She wanted to kiss him now, but she didn't know how their captors would react to such a PDA.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:31 PM
"The planet my ship crashed on." He offered. The verdant green of the forest, the little fauna that lived there and the glowing plants that came into bloom just as daylight faded from the sky. It would be perfect. "I'll pack a picnic basket. Or... something. Whatever. We can sit and talk and anything else you like. Hm?"
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 29-Mar-21 04:33 PM
S‘Kiv left after finishing his meal.
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:34 PM
Kic nodded in response to Kniel, it was so good to hear a believer speak of the Prophets and there Will here. Kic felt reassured that his faith in them was manifesting in those around him. He looked at Ota a moment then back to Kniel. "You found each other it would seems. I was worried for her. She looked in a bad way last night and so lost in herself. I'm glad the Prophets lead you both back together and that they have kept you both safe." (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:35 PM
"You have no idea how good that sounds." She replied, sighing. She glanced around the room at the guards, watching their every move. "I should probably get moving soon. I don't like the way they're looking at us- and Tilson said they don't look kindly at tardiness."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 04:35 PM
Capri entered the canteen and looked around slowly, freezing as he saw the crowd. He made his way slowly to the replicators and paused, unsure what it would present him with considering his weird mix. "Uh..." The tray appeared and he flinched. Cool, Betazoid diet. That was fine. Oh uncool.....there's meat. He wasn't exactly in a position to protest though, so he grabbed the tray and found a spot on the floor, using one of the chairs as a table instead.
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:36 PM
Kic took in a short breath and looked about again. "Well, I've been given the role of Mechanic, not entirely sure why, but that's the Iconians problem I feel. Would help if someone would let me know where and what I'm spose to be doing." He chuckled.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:37 PM
"Maybe I could trail you to work." He reckoned thoughtfully. "There has to be a medic on standby. I'll be right behind you with a medical kit.'
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:41 PM
At first that offer sounded incredible, but then thought of having him almost wasting his time while she wasn’t hurt, and the Iconians somehow finding out that they were together- who knows what they do with that kind of information. “I- I really don’t want to say this, but it might be better to stay separated while we work. At least for now- we get a better idea of the prison that way, if we’re both in different spots. Besides, wouldn’t want you spending all that medical kit on me when I don’t even need it.” There was an attempt on the last part to make it sound light. Whether it fell flat or not was unclear to Cas.
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 04:43 PM
The hybrid walked into the canteen and looked around, taking the time to observe his surroundings, noticing the large crowd gathered inside the room. Rubbing his eyes, he walked over to the replicators, where he looked at the menus- noticing the different species that it catered to. He selected the "Human" diet and was offered whatever meal it could give him. After that, he took his tray and stood by for a bit, noticing the poor condition the tables were in. So he walked around until he noticed Capri sitting down on the floor. In which he said. "Mind if one more joins you?" He spoke, trying to be polite and not unwelcome.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:45 PM
Rams considered that idea. More information would help, certainly - in their escape when it inevitably came. "I'll see you for dinner I suppose. Somehow." He offered gently.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 04:46 PM
Capri looked up as a pair of legs came into view, tensing at first then relaxing again. They were from the Phoenix, thank goodness! "I dont mind at all. The tables seemed questionable." He said off hand and motioned to the chair next to his. "You'll have to forgive me but, who are you?"
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 04:46 PM
She smiled in response to Karta's comment that the Prophets had lead both her and Kniel back together. In the process, she leaned closer to Kniel.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 04:47 PM
"The Prophets will all things, Kictor, friend. I think there's a purpose in us being here and I think we'll all emerge stronger for it. Mmm?" He offered quietly but also firmly.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:47 PM
She reached across the table and squeezed his hand, then pushed back from the table. “We’ll see each other then. We will.” She said, then whispered softly to him as she stood. “Love you.”
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 04:49 PM
"I love you too." Hopefully that went unheard by his fellow countryman (do Jem'hadar have the concept of countrymen if they don't have a common home planet?) in the corner. "You are more precious to me than you know, Yardi. Remember that. Go on, don't get in trouble."
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 04:49 PM
"I agree, I couldn't trust them with in the condition they're in. And my name is Dayton Finn, I'm- well, I was a Science officer from the Phoenix.. but not we're here." He sighed a bit, before sitting down next to the man. "So, who are you?" He asked, before he began eating his meal.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 04:50 PM
She gave him a soft farewell smile as she walked away. “I won’t, I promise. Stay safe for me.” And then she was gone.
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:50 PM
"Completely agree, I see their will manifesting even now in the crew of the Phoenix. Surely we will make it but I'm thinking smarts are needed more than just brawn." He nodded and acknowledgement of his statement. (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 04:54 PM
"Oh, of course. We'll need a lot of smarts to outfox these... whatever they are. I'm not sure if they're even alive." He remarked. What were the Heralds exactly? Energy beings? Constructs? Flesh and blood? All three? It was perplexing to consider. "Let's start gathering information. Hmm? We'll share what we know at lunch."
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn "I agree, I couldn't trust them with in the condition they're in. And my name is Dayton Finn, I'm- well, I was a Science officer from the Phoenix.. but not we're here." He sighed a bit, before sitting down next to the man. "So, who are you?" He asked, before he began eating his meal.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 04:56 PM
Capri paused, tempted to fall back to his old rude from when he first came to the Phoenix. "I'm D--sorry, Capri. I used to be one of the Intelligence officers on board." He said quietly and picked up a piece of meat, hesitating. He looked back to Dayton and leaned in close, just in case. "If anyone asks though, my name is Dacre, okay?" There was a vague sense of paranoia in his tone.
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 04:59 PM
"Agree. Apparently I've been tasked as a Mechanic and I hear they are able to go all over the prison. That may be of some help in planning stuff," *he whispered leaning into the Ora and Kniel, before standing again and patting his chest. "Til lunch I should find out where to go get geared up. Be safe you two, and congratulations on finding one another." *He wandered away from the table.
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 05:00 PM
"Okay then, you don't have worry. I'll cover for you." Dayton said in a quiet tone, ticking his head in slight confusion at Capri's plea, but shrugged it off. After all, he didn't blame him if he didn't want his identity to be revealed. He understood secrecy and all that... stuff. "What occupation did they assign you? What group you were placed in?" He asked, still continuing his meal.
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 05:00 PM
She nodded in agreement with Kniel's and Karta's statements. "We'll stay safe," she replied, before looking back at Kniel. After a few brief moments, she said to Kniel, her smile fading a slight bit, "'Til lunchtime, I guess."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 05:03 PM
"Group eight, low security. Thay was kind of shocking, I figured they'd want to place the Intel agents in high security or solitary. And they've got me down in slavage processing, what about you?"
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 05:06 PM
"I was given the same assignment, in Processing. I was placed in Group Twelve, Low Security." He said, as he continued to eat his meal before sighing a bit. "This all seems, so unreal, you know? I know it's real, but accepting it is hard." The last part he said was in quieter tone.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 29-Mar-21 05:07 PM
"Yeah. Stay strong." His hand squeezed hers before he departed the canteen.
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 05:11 PM
She felt him squeeze her hand as he left, longing to be with him for longer. This reminded her of an old Earth book she had read back in grade school, 1984. This whole situation was like that book. Finishing up her pathetic excuse for a meal, she headed out as well.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 05:11 PM
"No kidding. I guess they figured that Betazoids weren't very threatening. I mean, I guess we arent.....oh gods...." He picked up the meat again and cringed. He really didn't want to eat meat but he put it in his mouth anyway, crining as he swallowed it down. "Ugh, thats horrid..."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 05:12 PM
Well, what to do now. Rams scanned the canteen for any further familiar faces - but the one he settled on was probably the most shocking. A fellow Jem'hadar. What the hell was that doing here? He'd never met the man but it still put shock on his face. He got up from his seat, crossed the room and tapped on the table at which the other sat. "Why are you here?"
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 29-Mar-21 05:15 PM
Talor'etan eyed the other Jem'hadar incredulously. "My fighter was captured in the Idran Anomaly. Why are you here, and with Starfleet?"
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 05:17 PM
"I suppose we're not that threatening..." He trailed off, noticing the man cringing at the piece of meat. "Are you okay? You didn't seem to like eating that... I get that the food could be... lackluster, but what can we do about it?" He shrugged, continuing his meal.
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 05:17 PM
Karta walked out slightly disappointed to not have found his superiors.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 05:19 PM
"I owe them my life." He stated flatly. He decided not to add 'I am also an exile at the Founders' behest'. Best keep that to himself. "Our ship was captured by an Iaidon-class dreadnought. Where is the rest of your company? Where is your Vorta field supervisor?" (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 05:19 PM
"Oh no, I'll be fine. And I'll deal with it. I'm a vegetarian but in this situation we don't have a choice." He chuckled and took a few more bites of food, saving the meat for last.
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 29-Mar-21 05:23 PM
"Ha. The Vorta is likely stuck on Deep Space Nine with the rest of the battle cruiser's crew." He commented. "The Founders let you work with these solids? Are you a Founder yourself?" (edited)
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 05:23 PM
"Yeah... and after this we're going to be toiling in Processing, doing whatever the job demands of us. Speaking of which, they didn't even tell us properly. But I guess we'll find out soon enough." He mumbled, taking another bite of his meal.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 05:24 PM
"No." Rams sounded incredulous. "Yes, they do. What of it."
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 29-Mar-21 05:25 PM
"I wish to know how. And why."
Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 05:26 PM
Mattie didn’t know if she had seen him... or if she was even looking. But food could wait. This couldn’t. He stepped up behind her, one hand grasping her arm, lightly tugging her to stand, words lost in his throat.
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn "Yeah... and after this we're going to be toiling in Processing, doing whatever the job demands of us. Speaking of which, they didn't even tell us properly. But I guess we'll find out soon enough." He mumbled, taking another bite of his meal.

Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 05:27 PM

Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 29-Mar-21 05:27 PM

Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 05:31 PM

Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 06:49 PM

Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 06:51 PM

Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 06:53 PM

Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 06:55 PM

Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 06:57 PM
"Well enjoy the prison smoothie then." She took a forkful of his food and shoved it in her mouth, swallowing almost immediately to not get the taste too much on her tongue. Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 07:01 PM

Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Mar-21 07:01 PM
They entered the canteen, replicating what looked to be a weird mix of Andorian and Orion native food. The tastes would clash, they just knew it- damn Iconians. They took a solemn seat and began to eat.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 07:03 PM

Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 07:05 PM

Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 07:07 PM

Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 07:10 PM
He nodded his head, a raised eyebrow at her request, “So I’m allowed to informally address you? In front of other people? All it took was being kidnapped by insane creatures.”
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 07:12 PM

Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 07:13 PM

Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 07:17 PM
"I believe the correct color is chartreuse." She finished her food and looked at the large clock. "I should probably get to work, whatever that is. I'm a mechanic too, so I'm sure I'll see you. Keep looking for ways out of here, but don't cause any trouble ok?"
Ensign Matthew Skye 29-Mar-21 07:18 PM

Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 29-Mar-21 07:19 PM

Commander T'Svai 29-Mar-21 07:36 PM
She sat at a table and looked around.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Mar-21 07:45 PM
Nev watched as Commander T'Svai entered- oh, finally. Surely she would have more information on the status of... everything. They stood and approached her table, sliding to sit down with a tired 'hmph'. "T'Svai. It's good to see you." They didn't even bother with formalities.
Commander T'Svai 29-Mar-21 07:46 PM
"Rineva. It is agreeable to see you as well." T'Svai replied with a small nod. "Have any other officers informed you of our plan to gather information?"
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Mar-21 07:48 PM
A single eyebrow raised curiously. "No, I can't say they have. I had a rather nice talk with a Gorn from the KDF ship, and Kareem helped me out-" They carefully gestured to the jacket edge poking out of their jumpsuit neck. "But you're the first of the senior staff I've seen. What's this plan?"
Commander T'Svai 29-Mar-21 07:51 PM
T'Svai frowned minutely. "Ah. The grapevine grows more slowly here than I expected." She said semi-poetically. "Inform your colleagues and cellmates to observe guard shifts, gaps in security, and so on, then report it to the highest ranking person in their cell and/or work group. I will attempt to gather the senior staff for a meeting based on that intelligence. Refrain from participating in unnecessary conflict. We do not wish to draw attention in the meantime." (edited)
Ensign Sovin T'Pruk 29-Mar-21 08:03 PM
T'Pruk sat down next to them, nodding quietly. What T'Svai proposed made sense. She'd remember to try her best and assumed the highest ranking person in her cell would be T'Svai herself.
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Mar-21 08:04 PM
They nodded succintly. "Right. I've been watching as much as I can so far, but nothing yet. I had no plans to engage with them yet- I'm far more worried about the rest of the crew." They replied. "How many do you know of that are here? I'm aware of what happened with the Captain- and may she move on peacefully- but I haven't heard much else." Their voice dropped a bit near the end.
Commander T'Svai 29-Mar-21 08:07 PM
"I personally removed Commander Itesh and Lieutenant King from the bridge." T'Svai recalled dryly. "Of the senior staff Amanda, Xeya, Sara, Itesh, and Blanche are confirmed safe." She added. "I do not know the total number of crew rescued, but would estimate around one hundred survivors."
Lieutenant Rineva Sh'zhyvin 29-Mar-21 08:16 PM
"That's... that's good. I was with Commander Parlac when we evacuated, and as far as I know nothing has happened to him." They relayed, stirring around the food on the plate. It was incredibly unappetizing in just about every way. "Where are you assigned to work?"
Ensign Sovin T'Pruk 29-Mar-21 08:22 PM

Commander T'Svai 29-Mar-21 08:48 PM

Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 08:50 PM

Commander T'Svai 29-Mar-21 08:51 PM
"I am afraid I do not know. I have no authority in this prison." She admitted. "However, it is logical to assume medics are stationed near the work areas, particularly high risk areas such as the higher levels of the pit and the incinerator."
Ensign Karta Kictor 29-Mar-21 08:55 PM

Ensign Nedras 29-Mar-21 10:23 PM
Nedras entered the canteen. He walked up to one of the replicators and perused the meager options, trying to figure out which one was likely to have the most interesting texture. (edited)
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 10:26 PM
[D] Ota had reentered after her shift, which was... well, not fun. Working as a scrapper was nothing like working as a warp core specialist back on the Phoenix. After getting the same crappy meal, she sat and ate.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 10:28 PM
She halfway trudged halfway limped into the mess hall, haphazardly blowing a piece of sweaty hair out of her face. She sighed and looked around for a familiar face- and saw one. "Nedras?" It came out a lot less enthusiastic than when she had greeted Maggie and Ramat'iklan.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 10:32 PM
Maggie walked into the canteen, and locked eyes on Nedras with a smile. She soon grabbed a meal from the replicators and sat down close to him. Before wrapping him in a large hug. “Nedras! It’s so good to see you.” Nedras couldn’t be letting the power go to his head, right? So she treated him like normal, like a really close son friend.
5
3
Ensign Nedras 29-Mar-21 10:44 PM
Ah. That wasn't consistent with his plan at all. He wanted to return the hug, possibly more than he ever had wanted anything else in his life, and he wanted to ask Cas if she was alright, but he'd committed to a plan, and by the Link he was going to stick to it. He stayed stock still, and did not move his gaze from the replicator menu. "Lieutenant, I'd appreciate if you let go of me." He said with a polite neutrality that, in its unusual impersonal sense, was in fact rather rude.
2
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 10:45 PM
Did he just ignore her? And refuse a Maggie Hug? She moved closer to him, giving a small, tired smile to Maggie before looking at him. "Is something wrong Nedras?"
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 10:47 PM
The hybrid walked into the canteen, looking at the environment before walking to the replicator to get his food, requesting a "Human" diet- which got him a soup-like meal. He sighed and took his tray, before noticing the three officers gathering around each other. What could be going on there..?
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 10:47 PM
Maggie stood back with a sigh. Well, that was slightly annoying. Sure, Nedras had his reasons she was sure. But if he was straight up refusing. She was unsure. “Right, uh. How has overseer work been?”
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 10:52 PM
Capri had removed his EV suit before entering the canteen. He stretched a little and was suddenly thankful Sara had shown him how to braid his hair because it was way easier to maintain this way. He fanned the back of his neck as he walked up to the replicator, hopeful for something without meat. Ah! Vulcan diet! Thank goodness! He picked up the tray and looked around finding a spot on the floor with a chair he could set his tray on.
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 10:55 PM
She saw a new person walk in; maybe she could meet new people, even in this harsh situation. She put on a small smile and waved at the man, hoping he would notice her and sit at her table... which had shit chairs. Fun.
Ensign Nedras 29-Mar-21 10:55 PM
Nedras looked between Cas and Maggie and carefully, with monumental effort, kept his face neutral. He kept track of the ever-present guards out of the corner of his eye. "I hadn't realized you'd heard about that. It's been eventful. One mere day, and already there have been two offenses to report. In another lifetime I'd have had half a mind to suggest that the Iconians ally with the Dominion. It seems they could benefit from more Vorta." He said evenly.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 10:56 PM
Capri looked around as he took a seat on the floor, noticing the wave. He pointed at himself for a second and then waved back to Ota.
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 10:56 PM
She waved harder, and then gestured for him to come sit at her table.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 10:58 PM
She didn't even know where to start with that. "Two offenses? What- wait. Wait." She paused, took a breath, and continued, her tone more even now. She wasn't going to accuse him of anything, but someone sure sent that guard down to the incinerator. "What 'offenses' exactly? I sure hope no one got into any trouble on the first day."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 10:59 PM
Capri blinked and then stood up, carrying his tray over to the table. "Youre brave to trust these tables."
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 10:59 PM
She nodded. "It's better than sitting on the floor, at least."
Ensign Nedras 29-Mar-21 11:02 PM
Steady. "Contraband in cell fourteen, and some kind of tampering near the incinerator." He knew what to say, clear and simple as if there was a script in front of him, but he couldn't get the words out for a moment. After a second of silence, he continued, a little more sharply. "Seeing as it was within your line of sight, going by the camera footage I saw, if you see any such behavior in the future, I expect you to report it." His intent was to stress the existence of camera feeds where he worked, but he knew there was a chance it wouldn't be taken that way. (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 11:05 PM
There it was. “Report what, exactly?” She challenged, tone rising a bit in both volume and venom. She couldn’t help it- he was acting like this, after his cushy day sending guards after their own crew members, and now he was instructing her to do the same? “I don’t know what you think you saw, but we did nothing wrong- and that guard could have killed one of us!”
Ensign Nedras 29-Mar-21 11:08 PM
He turned fully away from the replicator and clasped his hands behind his back, because they were in very real danger of shaking and he didn't need that kind of minor detail to be witnessed. "One: I don't believe for a moment that your colleague did nothing wrong. Two: Suspicious behavior, Yardi. What else could I possibly be referring to?"
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 11:12 PM
She took in a breath, and reached into her pocket. The metal was still there, but never in a million years was she going to take it out now. As much as she was seething, she would never stab Nedras. But... “It’s Cas.” She hissed, sparing a glance at Maggie before looking back at him. “And you weren’t there. I don’t like the assumption that me or anyone else has been doing anything suspicious.”
Ensign Nedras 29-Mar-21 11:17 PM
"You don't, do you?" He took a shallow breath, imperceptible in. He took a shallow, imperceptible breath out. He stepped forward, getting right into Cas's personal space. He was only six inches taller than her, but he did his utmost to loom. When he next spoke, it was in his best field supervisor voice, and almost certainly loud enough for any nearby guards -or, for that matter, anyone else - to hear. "Then empty. Your. Pockets."
8
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 29-Mar-21 11:25 PM
Dayton was just eating his soup when he heard Nedras speak in a loud voice, where he saw the Vorta and Cas. His curiosity was somewhat raised, but he didn't feel like he should intervene right now. Considering that everything seemed to be calm, for now, at least. So while he may not do anything, he would still tune into the conversation that is currently transpiring between the two.
Ensign Cas Yardi 29-Mar-21 11:27 PM
Her own breath hitched, but she didn't move. She stared right into his eyes- and found that she didn't even recognize him in that moment. That voice wasn't Ensign Nedras- that was Nedras 3, Dominion Supervisor, and the implications of that terrified her deep to her core. For a moment she sympathized with him- maybe he was just doing what he could to get along, to survive, but then she ran her hand over the scrap in her pocket and was reminded of everything she'd been through already that day. No, he wasn't going to get anything out of her. "Fine." She snapped, slowly removing her hand from her pocket and pulling out the metal. She threw it to the floor at his feet where it landed with a clatter, no doubt able to be heard by anyone nearby. She knew the implications of that move, but it was too late now and she was past the point of thoughts that were fringed with anger and pure exhaustion. "There. Happy now? You caught me." She was doing her best to match his tone, but it was, at this point, failing miserably. Fear was creeping in. (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 29-Mar-21 11:30 PM
Capri turned his head to watch the group. He could just make won't what they were saying but their energy said so much more.
Ensign Virol Ota 29-Mar-21 11:49 PM
She watched the group talk as well. Something about 'contraband'. Were they already planning an escape? It was impossible to determine.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 29-Mar-21 11:57 PM
Well. Nedras would’ve been able to hear a slight change in the wind. Probably nothing all that different from what would normally happen. People moving around. ￼What he probably didn’t expect however, was a punch from behind him. Coming straight for his face and more specifically his glasses. That was the fist of Maggie, an ￼exceptionally fit woman that could go toe to toe with a XB and that was the face of Nedras. A slight mutter under her breath would likely be heard by Nedras￼ during the arc of the punch. “I don’t even care, but don’t you dare try to stop me from getting to my family.”￼

9
9
9
9
9
7
Ensign Nedras 30-Mar-21 12:08 AM
Nedras had expected a punch, but he'd expected it, at best, from Cas. What he distinctly didn't expect was the approximate sensation of a truck hitting him right in the face, a nice clean blow that shattered the left lens of his glasses, taking the bridge with it - thankfully none of the pieces went into his eye - and sent him straight into the floor. His ears rang. Bright violet blood was starting to stream from his nose, and already he could taste the metallic tang of it dripping back into his throat. He was starting to suspect some damage to his eye socket, the inside, towards his nose, or sinuses. He reached up to delicately remove the heavily damaged glasses from his face, which he subsequently put in his pocket, minus the glass. He reminded himself that this was a good thing. He stood again, because that was the only thing he could do to project strength without attacking back, swaying back and forth slightly simply because his sense of balance was off, and stared Maggie down. "You'll find what you've just done won't improve your chances." He said in a tone that almost suggested negotiation.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 30-Mar-21 12:09 AM
Maggie cracked her neck with a small smile. “Yeah, but maybe you should consider who you end up being more loyal to. Because guess what. Just like the founders. They don’t give two shits about you.”
Ensign Nedras 30-Mar-21 12:10 AM
"Like the Founders, they don't need to." He wiped his nose, smearing his left hand and arm with blood. "Can I get a guard and a medic, please?"
Ensign Cas Yardi 30-Mar-21 12:11 AM
Her mouth was wide open. Part of her screamed that he deserved it- and part of her was so, so conflicted. What the hell was going on? She swooped down the pick up the metal again now that he was gone, before gesturing widely. "She's- argh, Nedras!" She exclaimed. "Shit, I don't even know you anymore!" (edited)
Prison Guard BOT 30-Mar-21 12:11 AM
Nedras didn't need to call for a guard, because almost as soon as Maggie had finished speaking, Maggie's feet left the ground. The guard had lifted her by her upper arm, so, she was dangling to one side slightly. It then all but threw her into one of the nearby tables. She was alive but badly injured. She had better hope there was a medic nearby. (edited)

Ensign Cas Yardi 30-Mar-21 12:13 AM

Ensign Nedras 30-Mar-21 12:13 AM
No, damn it, no. He needed Maggie. She was strong, she could have helped. He just barely managed to suppress a flinch as she was thrown, instead casually following her arc through the air and subsequent fall with his eyes. "Make that two medics." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 30-Mar-21 12:14 AM

Before looking Nedras in the eyes with all but a rebellious smile. Even if her arm was very hurt. “Nedras. I’m glad you’ve gone from one evil dictatorship, to a nice government￼ with people who care about you. To guess what, another evil dictatorship. Glad you seem to love increasingly toxic relationships. Also! Buddy boy! Try a bit harder! I’ve known Cardassian’s who were literally on their deathbed that ￼hit harder then that...” She collapsed back onto her knees from the pain. (edited)

Prison Guard BOT 30-Mar-21 12:16 AM

Ensign Cas Yardi 30-Mar-21 12:18 AM
She swiped for the piece unsuccessfully, still glaring at Nedras. The guard's appendage felt strange on her arm, but she didn't move. This was happening. Prophets, this was happening.
Ensign Nedras 30-Mar-21 12:18 AM
Nedras momentarily feared that he'd drastically overestimated his colleagues' ability to plan in the long term and recognize the plans of others. Either that, or they were exceptionally good actors. He turned his head to the side, letting the momentum of the slap move it easily, then took the scrap from the guard when directed, slightly bewildered. Was it really so easy? Were they just giving it to him? How long until he could get larger weapons? He looked the scrap over carefully and placed it in his pocket. "I'd be delighted." He said flatly, exiting the canteen. (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 30-Mar-21 12:19 AM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 30-Mar-21 12:20 AM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 30-Mar-21 12:24 AM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 12:27 AM

Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 30-Mar-21 12:30 AM
Dayton, who was just finishing his soup in peace whilst watching everything unfold, became wide-eyed in shock when he saw Maggie punch Nedras. And needless to say, he was super concerned for Maggie's well-being. And when he saw them screaming for a medic, he had an idea. So once he finished his meal, he rushed over to the group and said. Ensign Nedras 30-Mar-21 01:16 AM
He was rendered speechless. It had been one day, could she really think him so capable of genuine malice? He was, but he'd genuinely chosen not to exercise any. Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 30-Mar-21 01:34 AM
"Eli.." She whispered, but she knew it would do little good. She grimaced softly and watched as he walked away. What a terrible ending..but she knew it had been for the greater good, even as much as it stung to yell at them like that.
Ensign Nedras 30-Mar-21 01:35 AM
That would mean all of this was for nothing. He closed his eyes, took a deep breath, and exhaled. "Very well. Thank you. I will return to my cell." He left again.
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 30-Mar-21 01:35 AM
The hybrid sighed to himself in disappointment. He wasn't even taking sides to begin with, he just told Nedras to leave because he didn't want another event to start again because of a few bickering. But he proceeded to exit the canteen and head back to his cell.
Ensign Cas Yardi 30-Mar-21 01:37 AM
She looked between Sara and the guard, before frowning. Nedras was gone, but so was Maggie, and she was safe now. Her shoulders slumped. “So I can just go?” She asked the guard, hands in her pockets. There was nothing left in them of course, but it reminded her of what used to be. She so wished there was something there at the moment.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 30-Mar-21 01:37 AM
Sara shook her head and headed over to Cas, she feeling only barely held together at this point. "Are you alright?"
Ensign Virol Ota "Our ship..." she replied, and then she realized: at some point she would have to take apart her own ship, the very ship she had called home for the past 5 months. Not helping was the realization that her belongings, or, rather, what was left of them, would be among the wreckage. Her vase of flowers, her prized decoration - destroyed along with the ship itself. Along with her sadness at this realization, she felt something she hadn't felt since she was a child: hatred, and it was towards the Iconians. This didn't show, however, as she replied, "I haven't found anything from it yet." She then added, "Oh, god..." as tears started welling up.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 01:38 AM
Capri sprang to his feet and came to her side of the table, pulling her into a hug whether she wanted it or not. "It'll be okay. It's going to be alright. We'll all have to go through it....it'll be okay..."
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 01:40 AM
She nodded in response, trying hard to hold back the tears while wiping her face with her dirty hands.
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 01:42 AM
Karta noticed that Ota wasnt coping, but recognized the crewmate he saw at the Incinerator earlier and returned to going about his work
Prison Guard BOT 30-Mar-21 01:43 AM
"Do not cause any more trouble." The guard said to Cas, effectively dismissing her.
Ensign Cas Yardi 30-Mar-21 01:47 AM
She hmphed, then turned to Sara. She was loosing steam and fast, but now she just felt guilty. And angry. And way too many emotions for her to process at the current moment. "I'm-" Her voice faltered, and she stopped. She just shook her head in a quiet attempt to finish her sentence.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 30-Mar-21 01:48 AM
Sara nodded, looking to Cas, and then the door, silently asking to leave. She was emotionally in shambles and staying in the canteen was not helping. She'd just ruined her friendship with Eli over this.. "Let's go."
Ensign Cas Yardi 30-Mar-21 01:51 AM
She sniffed and nodded, walking with Sara to the door. She didn't know if she needed a hug or to be far, far away from everyone else at that moment, but just having a familiar face was a good in between.
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 01:55 AM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 30-Mar-21 01:55 AM

Ensign Lena Farkas 30-Mar-21 02:05 AM
Lena walked into the canteen, almost dragging his feet as he walked. Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 02:17 AM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 02:23 AM

Ensign Lena Farkas 30-Mar-21 03:47 AM
As Lena looked around, he began looking more and more concerned, as if he was fighting something, and losing, or worse, fighting himself. "I see. Tell the other officers when yo-" Lena's face bunched up for a second, then he quickly moved back, as if realizing something. The concerned look was gone, replaced by one of clear paranoia. "-I shouldn't have told you shit. I- I- I can't trust you, or anyone else." From the clear look on his face, to those who knew of what he had spent the last year doing, something could be discerned of his expression. That conditioning which had held him together during the battle, and for unreasonably long afterwards, was now turning him inside out. With that, he quickly finished his food, stepping up from the table, and making a move to leave.

Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 05:12 AM

Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 05:15 AM
"Dude,.....shit......" He didnt know how to continue, he searched internally to find something to help. "That may be true but it was you doing your best to try and help in the fight right?" He asked, trying to help.
Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 05:19 AM
“Yeah....” He couldn’t even look at Karta due to the shame. How could he had fucked up so badly ? “I was on the Chimera when it all went down. We got caught in their tractor beam. I worked with my bare hands with Ned and a few of the other crew to modify the torpedoes on board on the spot. I worked till my hands were nothing but bone with some strands of muscle attached. But it was not enough......” He felt the tears well up again. “How I have been so stupid ? If I had done better, the Phoenix wouldn’t have gone down and we wouldn’t have ended up here.” (edited)
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 05:24 AM
"Its done, no use living in that mistake though." Even though Joe wasnt looking at him, he frowned briefly. "Was it entirely your fault tho? I mean.....what happened at the time when you and the others were working on it?" (edited)
Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 05:27 AM
“I don’t know.... All I could think about at the time was that our lives depended on those torps. I was working so furiously that I refused medical help from Ned when he saw my hands. But he did give me some treatment a bit later. We fired volley after volley at them. Although it did weaken them, it did not stop them.” (edited)
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 05:35 AM

Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 05:50 AM
He nodded. “You’re right. If we ever get out of here, I’ll need to consult my father over the designs.” He leaned in close to his ear to make sure no one could hear him. “I work down in the lower levels of the deconstruction pit. I’m memorized the routines and patrol patterns of the few guards that are there. I’ll try memorizing the placement of the cameras and their blind spots next shift.”
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 05:58 AM

Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 06:05 AM

Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 06:18 AM

They’re shaped like a cone and if you find an intact torpedo, just unscrew the top of it and give it to me. Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 03:41 PM

Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 03:46 PM

Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 03:49 PM
Karta had shoved the spoon in his mouth with a cringe when Ota joined him. He quickly swallowed the gruel, or more appropriately, forced it into his stomach with a wince. He then half-smiled at her. "Virol Ota, it's good to see you up again. How are you.......feeling?" he enquired
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 03:51 PM

"Ok, I really hate it.......I would kill someone for even one Hasperat.....it doesnt even have to have homemade sauce on it. Even just a bite would be heaven right now."
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 03:57 PM
"If we ever get out" she replied sadly, trying desperately not to gag. She would kill for even a sandwich; anything that wasn't prison food.
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:01 PM

They brought Kniel back to ya. That's something right and he'll with us soon again hopefully this morning" He tried to cheer her up, hoping it was working.
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:05 PM
It did indeed work; she was actually thankful she and Kniel found their way back together, whether it was the Prophets' doing or not. She put on a soft smile after he said that.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:06 PM
Who better to walk through the door next than Kniel? Poor Kniel looked exhausted and his face was covered in sweat but hey, he was alive and unhurt at least save a bruised ego and confidence. He ordered whatever the hell it was from the replicator and joined his two fellow Bajorans at their table with a sigh.
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:06 PM
"Oop, I saw a smile, better hide that the guards might take it off ya." he said
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:07 PM
Her eyes lit up upon seeing Kniel. "Kniel!" she exclaimed with noticeable excitement, sitting by his side and hugging him tightly.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:09 PM
Kniel chuckled softly, taking her into his arms and returning the hug with just as much vigor. Maybe a little less due to tiredness. "Hey there, beautiful. I'm so glad you're okay..." (edited)
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:11 PM
Karta turned to look at Kniel as he sat down. "You look like hoe I feel. Did they work you that hard yesterday?" he asked, concern in his voice.
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:12 PM
She looked up at him with a wide smile - perhaps not as much as their previous meets back on the Phoenix due to their situation - and pulled him in for a kiss. It may not have been the brightest idea, but goddamnit all that mattered to her was that he was here and by her side.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:16 PM
"No stranger to har-" Oh, screw it. Kniel gave her a quick but deep kiss before pulling away and patting her on the arm. "-no stranger to hard work! Day at work for me, all it is." (edited)
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:18 PM
After the kiss, she leaned against him, wrapping his arms around him, not wanting to be separated from her lover again; she watched as he and Karta conversed.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 04:18 PM
Capri walked into the canteen with a yawn, grabbing his tray of Vulcan food and looking for somewhere to sit.
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:19 PM
Karta blinked, then realized he'd failed to introduce himself yesterday. He nodded. "Yeh, they'll get theres, Prophets will it. Oh by the way, Ensi....Karta Kictor." he gave a short bow once he announced that (edited)
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:19 PM
"Drevas Kniel. Tactical officer. Oh, Prophets. I hurt all over." He squeezed her hand tight.
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:20 PM
He noted the individual that was at the Incinerator yesterday, which seemed to take as much interest in the goings-on there as he did. He returned his gaze to Kniel and Ota.
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:21 PM
Seeing Capri walk in, she waved at him, hoping to catch his attention, while squeezing Kniel's hand in return and hugging him harder. "I'm Virol Ota," she introduced herself; she was aware that both men already knew who she was, but eh, wouldn't hurt to introduce herself again, right?
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 04:21 PM
Capri saw Virol wave and slowly came to their table and paused, "May I join you?" He asked in Bajoran. He'd be lying if he said he didn't enjoy flexing his linguistic muscles properly. (edited)
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:22 PM
Nodding, she replied, also in Bajoran, "Sure!" while smiling at him speaking the language.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:24 PM
"Please." Kniel smiled warmly. "Your Bajoran is superb."
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:26 PM
He was impressed suddenly by the newcomer to the table. Although not Bajoran, he spoke near perfect dialect. Kic had to find out who he was and what he found out yesterday. He smiled at Capri back in Bajoran. "Karta Kictor, friend. The Prophets ever guide your path. "
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 04:29 PM
"I would hope so. I've been speaking it for four years. Also I'd be a shoddy linguist otherwise." He smiled and set the tray down, nodding at them. "King," he smiled and offered Kictor his hand. "It's nice to meet you properly. I'm glad to see you made it out alright too," He directed the last part at Kniel, having last seen them during the boarding.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:31 PM
"Glad to see you too. You amaze me, King. Damn." Kniel chuckled. "Who taught you? Or are you self taught?"
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:31 PM
He smiled at the levity this King brought. He shook his hand.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 04:33 PM
"Self taught. I learned it at the academy," He nodded and pulled his hair back into a braid.
Lieutenant Shilen Alaya BOT 30-Mar-21 04:34 PM
Slowly wandering across from the side of the room, where she had been watching, the Bajoran slid down on to the edge of the bench. "Been a fair while since I seen this many Bajorans in the same place."
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 04:36 PM
He listened to King, inspecting his mannerism. There was another level to him, something behind the mask, but he wasnt sure what it was. This could be interesting he had thought to himself
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:37 PM
Having sat there watching the conversation unfold, she was surprised by another Bajoran showing up; regardless, she gave her a quick glance and a smile, and then continued listening to the conversation.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 04:38 PM
He looked over at Shilen and nodded, subtly tugging his ears. He needed to lip read but actually hearing what they said could be wise here.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:39 PM
Kniel hummed with approval. No accent, perfectly fluent yet self taught. This young man was a genius in his own right. He nodded to acknowledge the other who'd just joined them. "Phew! Guess we all came together today, huh. All that's missing is commander Ytesh and ensign Cas..." (edited)

The Phoenix's mess hall, where real food was served? She didn't remember, but now she was really hoping she would join them, especially since she hadn't given even a passing nod to Cas since coming here.

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 04:52 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 04:53 PM

"Honestly I'd rather go hungry but if I do..." Kniel paused there, thought... and tapped out in Morse, "Can't Escape."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 04:56 PM
Capri watched Kniels fingers and signed the word escape after he tapped it out. He signed back, Need a plan a plan while mouthing the words before tapping it out again.
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 04:56 PM
"Looks like we're gonna have to eat this," she replied, noticing Kniel tap on the table. It seemed too rhythmic for it to just be tapping; could it be an attempt at communication? Maybe Morse code? She knew very little of that code, though, so she just sat quiet and forced down another spoonful of the "food".
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 05:00 PM
He smiled, then his expression changed to a slight frown as he tried to decipher what Kniel was doing. "So anyone been down to the shoreline? They have those fancy drinks served in those treenuts from Earth. It's fantastic." (edited)
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 05:01 PM
She looked at Karta and furrowed her brow, slightly confused.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 05:01 PM
"They're pretty good if you like coconut, though a little bit sweet." *He paused and signed while mouthing the word 'Ideas?'*.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 05:02 PM
Yes. "Treenuts from Earth? Which kind? Earth has plenty of species. Have you tasted cashews? Mmm. Especially when dusted with a little cayenne pepper." Blind spots?
Ensign Karta Kictor 30-Mar-21 05:03 PM
* He looked at Kniel.* "You know, the big ones they like."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 05:06 PM
"Its a specific one called a coconut. They're not necessarily a nut, and they have liquid inside them. It great mixed in with some berries, ice, and tajin." *He said and nodding, signing/mouthing again, 'Not as heavy guards in Sorting.'
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 05:08 PM
"Ohhh, coconuts! Ho, yeah, they make excellent drinks. Have you drunk out of one with a straw before?" Really. Why you think?* "Delicious. Perfectly sweet and refreshing."
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 05:11 PM
It was then that she finally caught on to what they were doing. "I've had coconut water once, it wasn't great," *she replied, while tapping out in Morse code: "Low-level deconstruction's lightly guarded."*
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 05:14 PM
'I notice. Have to time just right.' He nodded and shrugged a bit, "Coconut isn't everyone's favourite flavour. But regular coconut water can taste loke pond water if its not flavoured. Throw some pomegranate or pineapple in there? It's pretty great." (edited)
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 05:16 PM

Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 05:19 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 05:20 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 06:13 PM

He was caught off guard by the blast and it grazed his arm. He grit his teeth to avoid making noise and nodded at the guard, "Thank you, Sir." (edited)
Ensign Lena Farkas 30-Mar-21 06:14 PM
Lena walked into the canteen, intentionally avoiding the group of 'traitors'. He sat down on the opposite side of the canteen, not even looking at them. However, he had heard some of the music they were singing, and it almost amused him. At least it got him into a better mood than he had spent the last few days in. When he sat down, he thought back on what he spent time on the Phoenix doing. Listening to music came up, and that thought comforted him. It was one of the things he could do without being surrounded by the traitors he once called friends. He slowly began to hum, quietly and discreetly at first, though as his thoughts waved around in his head, he slowly became louder.
Prison Guard BOT 30-Mar-21 06:16 PM
The guard thought that was a weird fucking thing to say. It drifted off, resuming regular patrol.

Ensign Alanna Hensley BOT 30-Mar-21 06:30 PM

Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 06:32 PM

Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 06:32 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 06:34 PM

Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 06:34 PM

Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 06:34 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 06:36 PM
"I can try to teach you guys some sign language if we get the chance but we'll have to be subtle. Eventually they'll catch on if we keep using Morse Code and next time we may not be so lucky." He replied quietly. (edited)
Ensign Lena Farkas 30-Mar-21 06:36 PM
Slowly Lena was getting more and more relaxed, and something weird was happening. As he became more relaxed, more comfortable, he began to feel worse and worse on the inside. That suppression of stress could be controlled, it just took feeling relaxed. He began to reason more, but struggled with the outflow of emotions from the last few days, before he shut himself off completely again, the emotions too much for him. He, however, didn't stop humming, it was a comfort, something to pad out the sadness. Alongside the humming, eventually came a bit of tapping the table to the beat he remembered, and shaking himself back and forth.
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 06:37 PM
She, again, nodded in agreement with Capri's statement.
Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 06:38 PM
He nodded and whispered. “Indeed.”
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 06:39 PM
"But for now we need to get to work. Keep your eyes and ears peeled. We can talk again later, yeah?"
Ensign Joseph Tan 30-Mar-21 06:41 PM
“I’ll try to memorize the cameras’ blind spots today and see if I can find any useful scrap.” He whispered as he left for the door. “That was some good practice guys but I think Let’s call it quits for now. I’ll see you all around.”
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 06:42 PM
He nodded in response and looked at Virol, giving her a thumbs up. "Come on, let's head out."
Ensign Virol Ota 30-Mar-21 06:44 PM
She nodded, and recycled her tray, proceeding to head out.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 30-Mar-21 06:45 PM
Kniel headed out with them.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 30-Mar-21 06:47 PM
Capri recycled his tray and left as well.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 30-Mar-21 07:38 PM
Sara stepped into the canteen and headed for the replicator, finding the choices to be absolutely abysmal, but settled for a bowl of porridge. No milk, no fresh fruit. Just porridge. Supposed she'd have to get used to that. Though the sudden ache for all of her plants wreaked havoc on her once more as she took her small bowl and a spoon, and went to one of the tables. She noted with some disdain that the table they'd laid Maggie on last night still had smears of dark, red blood across it- should have figured there were no cleaning devices to go behind them.
3
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 08:48 PM
Hesria walked across the canteen in a daze, hardly aware of anything around her. She hardly paid any attention to what she replicated, taking a tray to a table and sitting down to eat. Dried blood flaked off her skin as she moved-- she supposed she would need to address that at some point. It felt like the scrape across her head wasn't bleeding much anymore, so at least there was that.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 08:59 PM
Alyx entered the canteen, thankful to have found it, but anxiety continuing to spike every time they were near or even saw a guard. They kept their head down, not wanting to make eye contact with them or any prisoners that might end up getting in a fight with them just from looking at them the wrong way. They looked up briefly to try and find wherever the food came from, and managed to identify the replicators. They went over and got the least unappetising-looking thing on the menu, before going and trying to find a quiet seat. They walked in Hesria’s direction, entirely unaware she was even there until the last minute, at which they had to actually do a double-take, eyes widening and starting to get rather wet as they stared at the woman in front of them.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 09:02 PM
Hesria didn't notice Alyx; she stared at the table in front of her with eyes glazed over and a blank expression on her face. In her mind, she was still trying to piece together what had happened. She felt sure the clicks that Nedras had made meant something but she couldn't work out what.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 09:05 PM
After continuing to just stare for another few seconds they quickly noticed Hesria’s head injury which only filled them with worry. They moved over to her table and put their tray of ‘food’ down on it in the hopes it would get her attention, all the while tears kept building up in their eyes. “H-Hesria?” They asked shakily, almost at a whisper.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 09:09 PM
Startled, she looked up to see who was addressing her-- and broke into a wide smile. "Alyx! Oh, thank the creator, you're alright!!" She stood and immediately enveloped them in a hug. "I didn't realize we'd be able to see each other again here, I assumed, when we were separated-- I thought they took you somewhere else. I'm so happy to see you." All thoughts of her personal injuries had vanished, replaced only with a warm feeling of hope.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 09:14 PM
“I didn’t either!” They responded as they wrapped their arms around Hesria, tears now streaming from their eyes as they started smiling. “This has made everything bearable.” They said, continuing to hug her and frankly not wanting to stop. After a moment, however, they did look up at her. “Are you okay? Is your head okay? Do you need medical attention? Can I do anything to help? Is there anything you need?” They asked in quick succession, an obvious tone of concern and care in their voice.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 09:24 PM
She squeezed them tightly before releasing and stepping back a moment. "I'm fine, it was... just an accident. Head wounds tend to bleed a lot even if they're shallow-- just my body being over dramatic," she said, with as much cheerfulness as she could manage, "I'm not very good at the scrapping work, I'm a bit too clumsy. I fell twice on shift." She neglected to mention why she'd fallen, preferring to maintain a cheerful and positive face for Alyx's benefit. "How are you doing? Are you alright, all things considered?" (edited)
2
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 09:31 PM
They nodded a little in response, looking into her eyes as they spoke. “I’ve been... Okay, I guess... Actually, no, I’d by lying if I said that...” They admitted quietly, looking down a little. “The guards terrify me, the layout of this place confuses me, I only know one person in my cell as far as I know, and just— Everything is horrible. I just wanna go home...” They said, a less-than-positive expression rapidly spreading across their face as they did as their tears turned to that of upset instead.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 09:51 PM
"I know, I know, I'm so sorry, Alyx," She pulled them back into a hug, forcing herself to be strong for their benefit. This was reason enough not to cry: she would be strong for Alyx. "We're gonna get out of here, okay? Everyone is working on a plan, so just keep your head down and stay safe for now. Don't draw attention to yourself. Come on, sit down and eat some of whatever the hell this is with me, okay? I haven't eaten since we got here and I'm starving," she laughed, "Maybe that's why I kept falling down."
2
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 09:58 PM
They happily accepted the hug, wrapping their arms back around Hesria as they did. They slowly calmed down, at least a little, and nodded in agreement with what she said. “Their organisation system isn’t half bad... I mean apart from it using slave labour.” They commented quietly before pulling out of the hug and sitting down. They looked down at the food, a look of distaste spreading across their face. “This better be vegan...” They muttered.
