Commander T'Svai 30-Mar-21 09:59 PM
[D] Visually, the gruel was not verifiably vegan nor non-vegan. It was, however, technically edible. You're welcome. (edited)
5
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 10:02 PM
She chuckled again, somewhat more genuinely this time. "Probably best not to think about it too hard, you know? I'm certainly not going to," she said, spooning some of the goo into her mouth. "It's disgusting!" she said brightly, "Wow, I didn't know you could make food this bad! Congrats to the Iconians, I guess. At least they're good at organization-- which is high praise, coming from you."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 10:17 PM
They genuinely chuckled at her comments about the food, before taking a spoonful and hesitantly eating some themselves. “Oh God yeah that’s not... That ain’t good. At least it isn’t poisonous, though. It would be ‘inefficient’ for them to hurt their workers like that. At least I hope it would...” They commented grimly, before looking back up at Hesria. “When I walked into the storage facility it... It felt like home, in a way. It felt like my cargo bay.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 10:25 PM
"I'm glad. That sounds much better than the awful scrap sorting line I'm working. I was going to steal some wires and try to rig a connector, maybe get access to a terminal, but I got caught," Again, she neglected to mention by whom or how. "I'll need to be more careful next time. Anyway, it's hot and miserable and dirty. Also the guards took our cell's toilet away yesterday, so I've been avoiding going back to the cell. Wish I could sneak off to the storage facility with you."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 10:33 PM
“Oh that’s awful! They shouldn’t be able to do that! Then again, they shouldn’t be able to do anything they’re doing, so I guess it’s only up to par with that...” They said with a slight sigh. “You shouldn’t do anything that could get you in trouble. I don’t want you getting hurt, or tortured, or anything else that I don’t even dare think about. It would be best if you kept your head down as well.” They said quietly. “I wish we weren’t separated like this, but at least it isn’t as bad as either of us expected. I mean, we still get to see eachother at meal times.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 10:37 PM
"I want to keep my head down, but at the same time--" She glanced around, looking for nearby guards, and leaned in closer. "I can't do nothing. I want to make sure you get out of here, and I'm not going to just sit on my hands and let what happens, happen. I have the necessary skills to help us-- if I can just get access to something."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 10:48 PM
They leaned in a little closer before responding. “But I don’t want get out of here without you... I want to get out of here with you, and preferably with you intact.” They said, emphasising the last word. “Look, I just... I know you want to help, I do too, but I just think it’s better if we don’t rush into anything and regret it, that’s all...”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 10:57 PM
"I know, but..." She sighed and put her head in her hands. "You're right. I'll try to just be quiet for now. I think that's what Nedras was trying to tell me, too. I hate being so helpless. I just want to do something, I want to fix it and make it all better."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 11:02 PM
They carefully reached out across the table and gently put their hands on her wrists. "So do I... I know how you feel, Hesria, but I also know everyone else will be feeling the same way. We just have to trust them to be on the same page, and sooner or later something positive will happen. I just know it." They said softly and quietly while slowly rubbing their thumbs against the backs of her hands. "We can't get out of this if we're dead."
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 11:13 PM
She tried not to picture anything happening to Alyx and bit back the hot sting of tears again. 'No,' she told herself, 'No, you will not.' "Okay. You're right. But when the time comes, I'm going to do whatever it takes to help get as many people out of here safely as possible, okay? I will get you out of here, and I will keep you safe."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 11:19 PM
“As long as you’re one of the people you get out safely.” They responded quietly, holding back a few tears again as they did. “I trust you to do the right thing. And I promise to keep you safe as well.” They added. “I’ve done it twice, I’ll do it a million times more.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 11:36 PM
"That's the plan," she smiled warmly, attempting to convey as much care as she could in her tone and expression. The best she could do right now was what she was good at: be the ray of sunshine that brightens everything around her. She rotated her hands so she could hold theirs and squeezed gently. "It wouldn't do me any good to get you out of here safely if I'm not with you."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 30-Mar-21 11:46 PM
“I’m glad to hear it.” They responded with a rare smile. It was the smile they only gave when they actually felt relaxed enough, even if only for a second. “I just wonder if anyone knows about what happened yet... I mean surely someone would be looking for us by now, right?”
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 30-Mar-21 11:55 PM
Parlac entered the canteen and acquired some 'food' from the replicators before sitting down at a table in the corner to eat.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 30-Mar-21 11:57 PM
"I mean, I hope someone knows! I'm sure the captain sent out a distress signal, right? Besides, there are other Starfleet officers here from other ships, so there must be others that have gone down like the Phoenix, so logically Starfleet must be aware something is wrong. I'm sure they're looking for us!" She was trying to convince herself as much as Alyx, but she couldn't conceive of a way in which Starfleet wouldn't be looking for them, truly.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 31-Mar-21 12:07 AM
“They’ll find us... Eventually. They can’t not. They have to.” They said, also trying to convince themselves. “We should probably eat this... stuff, though. It probably has some degree of nutritional value, otherwise this place wouldn’t be running very well.” They commented simply, still holding Hesria’s hands as they did. Truth be told they didn’t want to let go.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 31-Mar-21 12:13 AM
She let go of them with one hand, so she could follow their suggestion that they eat something, but continued holding their hand with her other. "You're right, it's awful but it must be worth something." Truly, the gruel was disgusting, but Hesria choked it down and smiled and hoped it would be enough. She looked around the room for a camera and, finding one, fixed it with a brilliant smile. She didn't know if Nedras was watching, but if he was, she wanted him to know she was okay. It wasn't particularly subtle, but... She didn't care. Turning back to Alyx, she said: "Who are you rooming with? I have Commander Itesh and Lieutenant Maleb in my cell, and Lieutenant Lola as well. There are more, but I don't know everyone's names yet."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 31-Mar-21 12:19 AM
They took their free hand and used it to slowly eat some of the ‘food’ themselves. “Uhhh.... I don’t really know. I didn’t check, to be honest. The only person I actively acknowledge, and as a matter of fact even spoke to, was Lieutenant Keats. She gives really nice hugs...” They admitted with a slight smile, before eating another mouthful of the gruel.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 31-Mar-21 12:39 AM
"Oh! I met her on the Chimera, she had a baby with her." A frown wrinkled Hesria's forehead as she considered this. "I hope the baby is okay. I'm glad Lieutenant Keats is alright though-- and that you have someone comforting in your cell to give you hugs. Hugs are very important, especially now." She said this last part in all seriousness-- typically, Hesria was not fond of excessive physical touch, but under present circumstances, she felt much more inclined to engage in hugging. It was important to make sure everyone felt comforted, as far as she was concerned.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 31-Mar-21 12:48 AM
“It will have been taken wherever all the other kids went, wouldn’t it? I just hope these people know how to look after infants...” They said quietly. “But yes, hugs are important. I don’t really like lots of physical contact with people I barely know, but honestly... Sometimes you just have to let yourself be hugged, be comforted.” They said softly, before taking another spoonful of the ‘food’ and eating it. “You know... it’s not really the flavour. It’s really more the texture that’s off-putting.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 31-Mar-21 12:53 AM
"I feel the same way-- about both, actually," she laughed, "I'm not normally very touchy-feely, but it's... necessary, right now, I think. For connection. As for the food, well. I'm trying not to think about what it reminds me of, or I'll completely put myself off eating it!" A shudder wracked her frame as she pushed away the mental image of what the gruel brought to mind. "Gotta keep myself distracted or I won't eat it and then I'll be too weak to do anything."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 31-Mar-21 01:09 AM
They nodded in agreement. “Yeah... I think it’s best to have company right now, especially at meal times. Talking to someone is certainly distraction enough from what you’re eating.” They said with a slight smile. “Especially when that someone makes you feel completely comfortable and safe at all times.” They added honestly. “I’m always better around people I know won’t judge me, or upset me, or stab me in the back.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 31-Mar-21 04:12 AM
Wow! Had she really dissociated through her entire shift? She blinked out of what felt like a stasis daze and looked down to her food. Cold as ice. Would she still eat it? Yeah. Was it good? No. But somehow she gulped down the remainder of her breakfast, despite it being well past dinner and got up from the table to throw out her bowl and begin to explore. She'd already missed her shift, what harm was there in it?
Ensign Lena Farkas 31-Mar-21 06:45 AM
An hour or two after Lena finished his food, it was time for his shift. He recycled the tray, leaving into the hallway.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 02:08 PM
Maggie entered into the canteen and sat down with a sigh. Grabbing the pure prison food, she hated it. But she needed to eat for her next shift. So she sat down on the floor and started to eat, watching the guard rotation.
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 02:36 PM
Nedras walked into the canteen. Seeing Maggie, he picked a food option at random and sat down at the far side of the same table, a little scared to get too close but still wanting to display he was open to conversation. He started eating.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 02:37 PM
Maggie looked over to Nedras, taking a deep breath as she looked at him. She still felt disgusted about her actions, now knowing that he was on her side. So she looked at him and spoke with regret in her voice. “Hello, Nedras...”
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 02:52 PM
Nedras braced himself. "Lieutenant." He replied coolly, putting his spoon down so he could have both hands free. "I'd like to eat if at all possible. I haven't since the drill. Is that going to be a problem, or am I going to need to call someone over?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 02:53 PM
Maggie sighed as she looked at him, still regretful with everything. She spoke lightly again. “No no I’ll let you eat. And I’m sorry about punching you, ￼genuinely I’m sorry...” She said as she dug into her meal.
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 03:07 PM
He hunched over and glanced around, looking for witnesses. "You should be. Standing up for your friends, demonstrating your inability to accept things as they are - it's very Starfleet." He said disdainfully, digging into the nutrient paste. What he meant, of course, was that he understood. He kept fumbling with his spoon, movements weak and a little shaky despite his effort to appear composed and slightly pompous. "I trust the pit has availed you of your rebellious streak?" He suddenly remembered Maggie was at the highest level, which worried him.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 03:14 PM
Maggie sighed as she listened to Nedras. Struggling very hard not to punch him again. She kept reminding herself of the current state of things. Nedras was on her side, he was just acting. “It is very Starfleet, I assume you’ve already done something awful to one of our crew mates today.” *She sighed, she hated saying that to him. She hoped he would pick up the regret in her time. She hated everything about this. Of course, she was still worried he might turn. She trusted him, and didn’t want to lose him. “In terms of the pit. It’s been awful quite honestly, but I wouldn’t say it’s broken me yet. Since I have people I can rely on still.” She coughed in a mock cough, course it still hurt. Considering her ribs and spleen weren’t fully heeled, she tapped in code quickly as she coughed. LIKE YOU.￼
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 03:21 PM
He tapped SORRY right back, almost too quickly and quietly to be deciphered. At this point the gesture was working it's way into the rhythm of his nervous twiddling too. "As a matter of fact, I have. I confiscated some scrap from Hesria. I believe she was attempting to make some sort of... wire tool. Fortunately for me, while I'm on duty I now have the tools to call a guard, medic, or mechanic whenever I want - she received a blow to the head for her troubles." That hurt to say, and his face twisted, but he kept his arrogance. The PADD, that was important. "I also informed Lieutenant King that his ideas will get him nowhere."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 03:24 PM
Maggie laughed softly as she returned the tapping while she laughed. SORRY TOO. She looked to Nedras with a soft hum. “Oh that’s lovely. I’m so glad you’ve found a way to turn on all your friends, I’m glad neither of them required surgery through. That would’ve been very unfortunate.” (edited)
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 03:34 PM
SORRY again, this time in the nutrient paste. Three short stabs, three leisurely drags of his spoon, and so on, all dispersed slowly in between bites and parts of sentences as he replied. It was hardly even a conscious effort at this point. "Vorta don't have friends. How, by the way, has your surgery been treating you? Can you work? I keep getting the mental image of you fainting and falling down all the levels of the pit, and if you do feel a little woozy I'd like to know so I'm not on a field shift when that particular image makes it's way to the camera feeds. You understand." That was very possibly pushing it, even as an implied 'how are you', but he couldn't think of anything better.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 03:40 PM
Maggie eyes suddenly became very wet from that image of Nedras enjoying her brutal death. She let out a sigh as she looked at Nedras. “Beyond the shame of having surgery in the middle of a dirty prison canteen with everyone watching. I’d say I’m recovering fine. A bit of pain here and there, but nothing I can’t work with.” ￼￼￼
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 03:42 PM
"I'll try to contain my disappointment." He said, relieved. Another SORRY, near silent, now in the staccato tap of his boots under the table "You're certain?"
2
2
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 03:50 PM
Maggie visibly cringed at the first sentence. Before this time letting out a very ￼real cough. “I’m fine Nedras. Honestly. I won’t be falling down any pits today..”￼￼
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 03:52 PM
He sighed dramatically. Actually, intentionally overdramatically. "Fine, fine. If you're sure. What about your cellmates? Your friends?" SORRY one more time, entirely unconscious, in blinks. (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 04:11 PM
“What about them? My cellmates are fine.” She paused for a moment before speaking. “We are however missing someone. A captain by the name of Enga has gone missing, given how she has intelligence I’m sure your new overlords have something to do with it.” She tapped on the table as she let out a real cough. TRY, FIND.
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 04:17 PM
"Enga. I dont know the name Enga. Describe her - wherever she is, someone should keep an eye on her." He said, rolling his eyes and leaning back in his chair. He was trying not to eat too ravenously. It was a relief to finally be able to, and it helped, he felt, that he couldn't taste it. "What kind of name is that? Human? Tellarite?" He guessed.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 04:23 PM
Maggie sighed as she looked at Nedras. “She’s a Tellarite. Short, still wearing a Starfleet uniform last I checked. Very hurt when we saw her. I hope she doesn’t get hurt too badly...”￼
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 04:27 PM
"She's a Starfleet Captain. If she's withholding intelligence she deserves whatever happens. That might be fun to watch. I hope they let me." Truthfully, he wasn't very optimistic about that description.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 04:31 PM
Maggie looked towards Nedras with a sigh. She had to admit. He was very good at making her want to punch him. “She’s a Starfleet captain doing her job, one you have been failing at since we got here. Nedras. And to think, I honestly really cared for you and your well-being.”
2
2
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 04:39 PM
"That isn't my job. This is my job. I'm doing my job." He explained, as if to a child, staring fixedly at what remained of his food. "You were wrong to care. Always."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 04:42 PM
“Not your job? Nedras. I considered you a son. And now your doing this? Turning on everyone that cared about you, disgusting.” She tapped quickly as she said the last word. Using her foot. SORRY.
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 04:57 PM
The SORRYs were stating to sound mocking to his ears. He wasn't sure whether it was because he was tired or because Maggie truly didn't believe in his good intentions anymore, but he was quickly growing bitter. "Son?" He clenched his jaw for a moment, then smiled. "How old is my line? What was my first assignment? Why did I join starfleet?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 05:08 PM
Maggie glared at him, not wanting to get into an actual augment with him. She sighed as she looked at him. “You are the third Nedras, and you’ve bought up serving in the first war. So you are older then 2410. I’d say sometime in the...2360’s or 70’s. It depends on which version of you for assignment. If we are talking about Nedras 3. A dominion ship with a group of Jem’s. In terms of why you joined Starfleet. And you joined Starfleet through, as would be normal a letter of recommendation. In terms of why? I’d think maybe you wanted to learn something or try something new. Maybe you were just bored, don’t start acting like I don’t care about you.”
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 05:14 PM
"Wrong on all counts. Well, no, "a dominion ship" is right, but maddeningly vague." He shook his head."You're only thirty years old. Your first assignment was the USS Toronto. You joined Starfleet because your parents were Starfleet officers." He listed. "You were born on Earth. Where was I activated? All of me, we're all from the same place, where is it?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 05:26 PM
Maggie just looked at him with a sigh. Looking completely and utterly dejected￼ as she ate her meal in silence, tears forming in her eyes.
6
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 05:29 PM
Nedras's tone took on a desperate quality. "What do you know about me?"
7
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 05:34 PM
“That I care about you, want you to live your live. Want you to succeed, want you to live your life. That you are one of the best tactical officers I’ve ever seen. That I’m sorry for how I treated you in the meeting in Itesh’s room. That I’m sorry for punching you, and breaking your glasses. That I want you to get the hell out of this place even if I don’t. That I’m sorry for every time I’ve messed up in front of you. And I care for you. That I’m beyond proud of what you did, leaving the ￼ dominion. And I’m sorry for not knowing more about you.”
6
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 06:03 PM
"If the only way you can describe me is through a set of apologies, then-" Nedras stopped talking. He'd slipped too far, started looking for weak points again, and if he said something like 'then either I'm a poor son or you're a poor mother' then there was no going back from that point, particularly with Maggie's history. Besides, it was unfair and incorrect. He clenched his free hand into a fist, then unclenched it. He took another slow, measured bite of his food. He was still smiling. Couldn't seem to stop. "You don't know me at all. You shouldn't be surprised that I've turned, as you call it. I was a turncoat from the very start." He leaned forwards. "Just for fun, I'll answer one of the questions you couldn't answer. I joined Starfleet because the Founders asked me to." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 06:14 PM
Maggie simply looked down at her food, her heart beating a mile a minute (which probably wasn’t exactly￼ healthy given her condition) and just started whisper sobbing into her food. “Right..”
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 06:22 PM
Nedras reasoned with himself - Maggie was very busy. Under a great deal of stress. She couldn't possibly remember everything, and so maybe it also wasn't reasonable to demand she know... well, anything. His smile faded to a small, polite one. "Then there is no need to change the understanding we currently have of one another. Excellent." He stabbed at the nutrient paste irritably with his spoon.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 06:25 PM
Maggie simply held her head in shame as she sat. Not paying him any mind as she eat. Tears still rolling down her face. She was clearly mumbling stupid under her breath, seemingly at herself.
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 06:40 PM
Nedras had excellent hearing. The whispers at that distance may as well have been shouts. He forced himself not to say anything as he finished his food and stood to leave.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 31-Mar-21 06:43 PM
Maggie looked as he left and stood to leave as well. Looking completely dejected as she recycled her tray, and continued muttering as she went.￼￼￼
Ensign Nedras 31-Mar-21 06:43 PM
Nedras left the canteen and headed to his cell.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 31-Mar-21 07:13 PM
Sara finally left the canteen.
Ensign Karta Kictor 01-Apr-21 12:22 PM
Karta walked into the canteen and shuffled to the replicators and grabbed a bowl of the breakfast gruel. He turned slowly and went over to the table and sat himself down, the bowl appeared and he looked down to stare at it a moment. The gruel looked so unappetizing, so not good for you, and the taste....Prophets, there was none.
He sighed briefly, grabbed the spoon provided and began swirling it aimlessly in the bowl.
He then raised to spoon to his mouth, and force himself to eat it. He then lowered it back into the spoon and sat it there for a moment
Ensign Karta Kictor 01-Apr-21 12:40 PM
Karta repeated this a few more times, mostly because his body needed something so he would be able to get thru the day. He rose to his feet, even tho he hadn't finished the contents, he'd had enough of it. He then picked it up and disposed it in the reclaimer, he left out into the hallway beyond.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 01-Apr-21 04:12 PM
Maggie entered into the canteen and sat down with a small sigh. Looking at the guards move around before starting to eat. Hopefully, she would run into Qicum soon.

Qicun slipped a suspicious material into the man's pocket, and in return, Qicun received a piece of paper. The bird nodded and the man, a betazoid it seemed, left.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 01-Apr-21 04:28 PM

Qicun BOT 01-Apr-21 04:41 PM
"Well, I'm not stopping you from saying sorry so of course you can say it. Go on then." He said, joking a little bit. The bird kept himself hidden in the un lit part of the corner, the only visible portion of himself were his eyes, peaking through the shadows.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 01-Apr-21 04:43 PM

Qicun BOT 01-Apr-21 04:53 PM
"My help comes with a price... But let's hear what you have to say first.." He squared, shuffling his wings in the corner to ease some tension.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 01-Apr-21 04:56 PM
Maggie looked at him with a small nod before crossing her arms and whispering. “We are trying to do something. And by we I mean Starfleet. We don’t have a full plan yet, but. Do you think. We could and try and get the help of the prison with our project.”
Qicun BOT 01-Apr-21 05:14 PM
" If you are planning on escaping then you better stop before your ahead. Those Coney's kill you on the spot I have experienced that first hand I'll tell you that much." He said with a scowl. Most new birds try to escape early, which is their own downfall. They don't stay long enough to find out what prison is all about. Sometimes, when they try to escape early, they will never find out. Qicun lost that drive to escape, long ago. He was hesitant to attempt to lend that hand Maggie asked for.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 01-Apr-21 05:14 PM

4
Qicun BOT 01-Apr-21 05:45 PM
"Staying here the rest of my life is better than dying in attempt to get an ounce of freedom. I can't speak for everyone in this damned shit pit. But one thing is for certain, most of these blokes tried to escape but failed." He said, looking at the girl before walking out of the shadows to shake his wings. The feathers falling off, withered to the bone. Metal shrapnel stuck in parts of his bones. His back was patchy, covered in weird mechanical objects that would hiss at certain intervals. With ever hiss, the Avian sighed in relief. "You don't want to end up looking like this do you? I know that Xi-...." He paused and shook his head. "Never mind."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 01-Apr-21 05:49 PM
Maggie sighed as she looked at the bird. Not flinching at his disfigurement. Looking at him with a sad expression. “But if we all work together we can get free. Please. I would take looking like that for the rest of my life if it meant seeing my wife again, if it meant getting my family home. Please, we could really use your help. We can get you out, and even if one person escapes. That means we can get help from Starfleet, free everyone here in this shit pit. If we work together!” She whisper shouted.
Qicun BOT 01-Apr-21 05:58 PM
The bird looked around for a moment, listening to the girls voice which had become louder with every word. Soon he snapped, grabbing Maggie's face, pinching her two cheeks softly with two points of his claws and dragging her into the shadows. "Quiet kid, your going to get us both into solitary for this.. I know you want your wife back, I'm glad for ya that you have one still... but this prison was built to stay, if you escape the inside, you get shot outside. If you fail to even leave this place, you will be executed on the spot. How do I known this? Well, you try coping with the fact that your wife was shot in the head three times by scrawny little buggers with bow staffs! All the while they force you to watch as her lifeless body hits the ground. But you can't do nothing at all you just sit there and watch, pinned down by 3 brawns with shit for brains" The bird said, letting go of his grip on her face. Escape was a sensitive topic for Qicun, as one could probably tell. He sighed for a moment, before drawing the random girl in for a hug, the man probably had scared her half to death. But he never meant for it to be it that way. "I'm sorry junior, I'll consider it, but don't get your hopes up... its for the best that you don't." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 01-Apr-21 06:59 PM
Maggie, almost immediately after he pinched her face. Broke from him with a small sigh. “Please never grab my face again. I’m very sorry though. About your wife, I know I’d probably be feeling just the same as you are if I was you. We need to leave through. Everyone in here deserves to leave, including you. I’m not asking you to make a decision yet just... please consider it. We could really use you.”￼￼￼￼
Qicun BOT 01-Apr-21 07:28 PM
He watched her closely, looking behind her to catch a look at the guards passing by. "You know kid, you have heart. I'll give you that much. Say, Meet me by the storage facility tomorrow eh? I got someone you might want to meet." He said, with no expressions crossing his face. He was more into the guards patrolling behind them.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 01-Apr-21 07:34 PM
Maggie smiled as she gave him a hug, before ￼releasing after a few moments. Whispering. “Thank you.” Before releasing and smiling at him. “Well then. I guess I’ll see you down in the pits soon then.”
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Apr-21 10:02 PM
The chief entered the canteen, retrieved a bowl of sustenance, and sat down heavily at one of the tables, exhausted and sore.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 01-Apr-21 10:23 PM
It was then that Blanche entered, her gaze devoid of its usual warmth as it gave the space a rudimentary once-over. Upon doing so, the woman almost misplaced her medkit, suffering an impulse to unhand it then and there. Where her carriage had been slack, expression vague, the sight of Parlac sitting down to eat seemed to revitalise Blanche entirely; apologising along the way, the brunette weaved hurriedly through the general surge of inmates, stopping just short of the Cardassian's table in some suspended state of disbelief. Even with all the implications of his harrowed appearance, it was inevitable that joy would become her dominant emotion; the latter was reflected in features that had long since displayed such a phenomenon, restoring a sliver of normality to the doctor's unusually unkempt appearance. "Rekat!"
6
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Apr-21 10:27 PM
He heard his name-- his first name-- and immediately snapped to alertness, looking for the source of the voice. By the time his brain had processed the voice belonged to Blanche, he was already standing and had pulled her into a massive hug. "Blanche! I'm so glad to see you. Commander T'Svai told me you had made it, but... It still brings me joy to actually see you. Are you alright?" The Cardassian was practically trembling; first Mera, and now Blanche. Whatever grace the Hebitian gods might extend to an unbeliever, he sent a prayer of gratitude up.
6
Commander Blanche Carlisle 01-Apr-21 10:40 PM
"Oh, my god," arms were flung about the CoS just as quickly, as though Blanche required material proof that he were actually there. Finding that Parlac was, in fact, tangible, she relinquished her grip somewhat, even if only to look him in the eyes with unbridled delight. In fairness, she hadn't known of his status, but was hardly looking to justify her affection. He had made it. "I'm alright, I'm fine," she established hastily, the default response owed somewhat to her field of work. "What about you — gosh, I knew deep down you'd make it," the hand unoccupied with her medkit came to Parlac's cheek, cradling it in a fond, subconscious continuation of Blanche's clarifying that this was actually happening. "But I . . well, I suppose I didn't even want to consider the alternative. You can't imagine how delighted I am to see you, darlin'."
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Apr-21 10:46 PM
He closed his eyes for a moment and allowed the warmth of her hand to soothe his cheek. It reminded him of the way his ada would cradle his face to give comfort, although lacking the pressing of their foreheads together. Still, it was comforting and warm and real-- and that was the weight of it, that she was there, solidly in front of him, just as Mera had been. "I didn't want to consider any alternative either. We've lost so much already, I couldn't-- I'm so glad you're alright. I sustained a few wounds in the boarding of the Phoenix, but otherwise I'm fine. Dr. Drake fixed my arm up so that I can better serve our overlords by moving scrap in the pit," he said, rolling his eyes, "I thank the gods I grew up on Prime, it's provided me some modicum of strength against the oppressive heat there."
Lt. JG. Newton Eirson 01-Apr-21 10:53 PM
Finally he reached the canteen, keeping himself from sighing at the idea of no longer having someone following him and his every movements, feeling like everything he might do could be the wrong thing to. He hadn't fidget like that to keep the anxiety at bay for a long, long time, and here it was back. Anyway. Looking around to spot a familiar face, because being alone was scary, it took him some time before he finally did. And lordy, the sight filled him with relief, relief and more relief. Knowing she was alive was something, but seeing it with his own eyes? He wanted to run and hug her, and frankly, he would have if he hadn't noticed in time the person already hugging her. One of the Cardassian! An awkward sandwich hug wouldn't do, so if his original plan changed a little, it didn't keep him from speeding towards them as he shouted, relieved. "Mom!!!" He stopped in front of her, clutching or more like hugging his medkit, instead, and grinning from ear to ear. Remembering that being polite was important, he added as an afterthought , "Ah, huh, hello to you too, sir!" (edited)
6
Commander Blanche Carlisle 01-Apr-21 11:11 PM
Oh, god. She had thought herself just about capable of handling a reunion with Parlac. Just about. Blanche's composure was waning as it was, and the sound of Newton's voice sent her into a stunned silence. Poised to reply to Rekat, the result was a rather gormless looking CMO, who stood frozen for a good moment before acting at all. He was alright. Her son was here, and he was alright, too — they both were. She manoeuvred herself within Parlac's embrace so as to frantically pull Newt into her own, still clutching the medkit somewhat haphazardly. The sound Blanche emitted was close enough to her original 'oh, my god', but choked enough in delivery that it failed to be discernible as such. Her actions would have to suffice, trembling in their execution, and accented by the occasional sniff that established she had, as it were, abandoned her composure. "Newton," Blanche whispered, all but burying her face in the nurse's head of hair. "Oh, sweetheart. You're alright."
5
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Apr-21 11:17 PM
Hurriedly, Parlac backed away to allow the reunion enough room for a proper embrace. It was-- what was the Terran phrase? Heartworming, yes. He wasn't sure why worms in hearts were a good thing, but this must be a fine example of it. He smiled and pretended he wasn't getting misty-eyed by forcing himself to eat more of the disgusting slop in his bowl. (edited)
5
5
Lt. JG. Newton Eirson 01-Apr-21 11:30 PM
He felt kinda bad at breaking the lovers' hug, but he couldn't help but sink into the comfort of the embrace. "Y-Yeah, yes. Yes. And you are! I was so, so worried! But then Sara, she's in my cell and thank god she's ok too, 'cept for that cut but it wasn't bad and it's all good now- and she told me she saw you and you looked ok, or as ok as one can be y'know, so it wasn't as bad then! But still, I was- I was- I'm ramblin', ain't I?" he chuckled, and if it sounded a little wet, well there wasn't anything wrong about it. After some time, trying to lighten the mood, he added-whispered to her, "Just to be sure, is that- is that one of the cardassians?"
6
Commander Blanche Carlisle 01-Apr-21 11:46 PM
Parlac was, amidst all the chaos of coinciding reunions, spared a teary, apologetic sort of smile from Blanche. Of course, she didn't doubt for a moment his understanding; abrupt incarceration was simply no excuse for poor manners! As before, Blanche was certain to relinquish her grip. Not before, mind, she had pressed a kiss to the crown of Newton's head, only to pull away in bewilderment. "One of—?" Brows came to furrow as they often did in times like these; Blanche's son had disallowed her the latitude to process his earlier words. As such, her attention was drawn to those that followed, and her expression promptly fell into one of distinct mortification. "Oh, no, darlin'. Parlac is a dear friend of mine, and I was worried sick about the both of you." Was she denying the existence of other Cardassians? No. Was she prepared to question the implications of said allusion? No.
5
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 01-Apr-21 11:56 PM
Parlac could tell quiet words were being exchanged, but it was not loud enough that he could hear them, and as it was a private moment he attempted to give them some space. Whatever they were talking about, it surely was none of his business. He smiled to himself, eating more of the gruel and trying not to think about how it tasted.
3
Lt. JG. Newton Eirson 02-Apr-21 12:14 AM
"Oh." Maybe he had mistaken the person, then. Whatever, his medic-self resurfaced, "Is he ok?" A smarter part of his brain reminded him she was, in fact, also a medic, and face palmed himself with a hand he freed from holding his medkit. "I mean- ah. Huh. Yes. I guess he's not one your room- cellmate, then. Are everyone there ok? Of the Phoenix?" he asked back to a more usual volume, for Parlac but more generally as he didn't want to bring the guards' attention by whispering too much.

After a long shift, an exhausted Cassidy wandered into the canteen. She regarded the guards nearby with a snide, mocking sneer. What she wouldn’t give to be borg right about now so she could rip these machinations to shreds with her bare hands. Or... something like that. She grabbed a tray of slop from the replicator and went to find a seat somewhere.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 02-Apr-21 12:58 AM

Commander Blanche Carlisle 02-Apr-21 02:20 PM
“Yes, yes, we’re all alright.” Well, with the exception of Betty. “I’ve Lieutenants Howard and King with me, and we—.” Well. Her speech faltered, not dissimilar to the younger nurse’s; verbally running oneself into the ground appeared to be genetic. “Well, the K’Warko’s captain is in our cell, too. He’s been here three weeks, can you imagine? I suppose you’re in low security, too, aren’t you — gosh, I just want to know everyone’s safe. 1
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 02-Apr-21 02:36 PM
This was a conversation he could join. Parlac chimed in: "I'm in high sec, unfortunately. I don't know anyone in my cell, either. I mean, I recognize a few faces, but that's it. It seems they've determined security levels by race. You mentioned the K'Warko's captain-- what happened to them? I don't recall hearing about them going missing."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 02-Apr-21 02:49 PM
"I didn't either," Blanche admitted, moving to join Parlac at the table, and gesturing for Newton follow suit. Rekat's placement in high security likened the doctor's stomach to a pit, which wasn't helped much by whatever it was the Cardassian appeared to be tucking into. "He said he was captured on an away mission, and that he's been here since. I asked if there were any others; supposedly there were, but he's not confident they survived this far," she elaborated grimly, declining to mention the captain's talk of jumpsuits. Apparently, she had traumatised Newton enough as it was. (edited)
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 02-Apr-21 02:55 PM
He nodded, concern etched into his features as he listened. "Trying to find survivors in here is... depressing, to say the least. I heard Sara-- Lieutenant Bjørge survived, but haven't seen her yet. I'd like to confirm she's alright, and her ACSO as well, Lieutenant Targesh. I've seen Commander T'Svai a few times now-- although I suppose I should refer to her as acting captain now."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 02-Apr-21 03:09 PM
Slender fingers worried at the hem of her jumpsuit sleeves, and Blanche cast her gaze to the table. Testament to Parlac's claim of atmosphere, the doctor was a perfect picture of moroseness. After a moment's pause, she came to shake her head in concurrence, willing blue eyes upwards. "It's just horrible, isn't it? It's all so horrible. I saw the Commander myself, too, though only in processin'. I'll admit, it was rather heartenin' — she was very much set on us gettin' out of here."
Cadet Edward Smith 02-Apr-21 03:14 PM
Still adjusting to actual light, he looked rather sickly and pale now being mostly skin and bone at this point. He replicated some food knowing he could only eat a small portion of it without causing an issue. Edward almost wanted back in his solitary but he knew that was his mind playing tricks on him again. He found a table that was still more of less a table and sat down at it in sight of the others there. Rubbing his eyes a bit, then scratched at his four day beard and started to pick at the "food" on his tray. (edited)
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 02-Apr-21 03:27 PM
"I think we all are, Blanche," he said seriously, "But unfortunately we are limited in our options. I don't suppose being a medic gives you access to anything more interesting than the scrap I've been sorting?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 02-Apr-21 03:40 PM
Shoulders raised in a gently hapless shrug. "Nothin' besides kit equipment, which you can imagine they're rather set on monitorin'. I suppose we've more freedom to move around the place," she elaborated, brows furrowing slightly, "but even then, there's only so long you can linger before raisin' suspicion."
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 02-Apr-21 03:50 PM
He grunted and shoveled a few more spoonfuls of porridge into his mouth. What he wouldn't do for some larish pie right about now... Thoughts distracted, he recalled the last time he ate larish pie-- in his quarters, with Blanche and Mera, celebrating his promotion and posting to the Chimera. It all felt like a lifetime away now, though in reality it had only been a few months. He recalled the feeling of home, the feeling that he belonged on the Phoenix and cared for his colleagues and was cared for in return, and the loss of the ship washed over him again, waves of grief that threatened to overwhelm him. Parlac choked down a sob and ducked his head, hoping the emotions hadn't been too visible on his face. He attempted to return himself to the conversation. "Of course. It will probably come in handy at some point, but... I hope you'll be able to keep your head down and stay safe. Escaping will do us no good if we lose more officers in the attempt."
5
Commander Blanche Carlisle 02-Apr-21 04:01 PM
Unfortunately for Parlac, his internalised turmoil didn't go unnoticed. Not by Blanche, at least, who regarded her friend with woeful eyes; to say her heart ached for him would be a staggering understatement. It was no secret that Rekat was finally coming into himself on the Phoenix — with the loss of the latter, they had all been effectively uprooted. Displaced, to the most severe of degrees. How was one to find their footing now, when everything seemed so uncertain? Blanche sure as hell had no idea, and she wasn't about to do the Cardassian the disservice of pretending she did. What she hoped she could provide was some means of comfort, however feeble in the face of their current circumstances. "Hey, I'll be just fine," she assured him, promptly reaching out across the table to take Parlac's hands within her own. "And you will, too. We've made it this far, and I'm certain we'll make it further."
Lt. Cdr. Rekat Parlac 02-Apr-21 04:14 PM
He looked up, meeting her gaze with his own, and made a weak attempt at a smile. Gently, he squeezed her hands in return, grateful for the warmth. "You're right. We will get through this, I'm sure of it. Whatever it takes." He realized he'd been ignoring the young man-- Blanche's son-- who'd joined them, and turned to offer him a smile as well. "I don't believe we've officially met, but I assume you are Newton? I will have to hold your mother personally responsible for not introducing us sooner," he said, winking. It wasn't the smoothest transition, but it was an easier topic of conversation than broaching the roiling turmoil of emotions he was struggling to keep under control.
4
Cadet Edward Smith 02-Apr-21 08:28 PM
Edward finished his meal and wandered to the rec room followed by the guard.
Lt. JG. Newton Eirson 02-Apr-21 08:50 PM

He smiled at the display of support the two were having. It was always an appreciated sight in those times they were living, and if it helped his mom lived with those 'horrible' jumpsuits and the lack of proper haircare he suspected she was missing, then it was even better. 5
Commander Blanche Carlisle 02-Apr-21 09:12 PM
Subconsciously, a hand of Blanche's raised to the crown of her head. She smoothed it down the length of her hair, and subsequently resisted the urge to shudder. What state must it be in? She'd wondered since their arrival, but other concerns had duly taken precedence. Nonetheless, she witnessed Newt's smile suffer the fallout of his words, and only felt all the more inclined to put on a brave face. As such, the hand was swiftly removed, and Blanche tried for her warmest smile. "Guilty as charged. As for my hair, I suppose it's lookin' absolutely dreadful, isn't it? Don't answer that, either of you. Or do. I'm afraid I'll be quite lost in such matters now; I could always rely on Dolly to humble me with her unfailin' lack of interest."

Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:13 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 10:15 PM

Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:17 PM

Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:24 PM

Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 10:26 PM

Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:28 PM
Eli leaned his head back against the wall and closed his eyes. "You ever feel like you just...give and not get anything back? You do your job well, you go above and beyond, and you end up with just...nothing?"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 10:29 PM
"Sometimes, yeah. It's a terrible feeling." Capri responded, turning to watch Eli speak and just let him vent.
Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:30 PM
"I...I don't know how many people I've treated, between the Phoenix and here. I know it's my job. I'm happy to do my job. I just feel like..." His breath hitched. "I just want...a little something. Someone to care and say it...It's stupid but I wish, that someone cared about me like I care about everyone else."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 10:32 PM
"More than just doing your work and then going to bed, huh? I can understand that, I dont know if I have any good advice for you though unfortunately."
Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:34 PM
"There is no good advice. If we ever get out of here...and live...maybe I'll just transfer ships or something. Or go back to Starfleet Medical."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 10:43 PM
"Damn. I'll have to find a new weight lifting buddy." He said with a little smile, picking up a chunk of what was supposed to pass for Vulcan food. Suddenly it hit him and he looked over again. "Did....did it not go well with....?" He trailed off, unsure if he actually should ask about Sara.
Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:46 PM
"We...never got to anything. She was supposed to set up some time to hang out with me and she never did. We got taken...and when I was saving Lieutenant Verne's life she yelled at me like I was some petulant child because I was trying to diffuse a potentially violent situation. So...I don't think there's going to be anything anymore."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 10:50 PM
His face fell a bit and he looked down and away, shaking his head a little. "Im so sorry, Eli. Truly I am. Is....is there anything I can do to help you feel better?"
Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 10:52 PM
"I really don't know. I have a duty to the crew, so I'll keep doing it, but boy do I want to lie down and just...give up."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 10:58 PM
"We can't give up though. Not right now at least. We can only do our best in this shitty situation. In all aspects."
Lt. JG. Eli Drake 02-Apr-21 11:01 PM
"Easy to say...not easy to do. Do you know what it's like to feel completely and utterly alone all the time? Even on the Phoenix, I was utterly alone. And here? I'm always needed, but never wanted. It's shit," he said, kicking his tray a bit.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 11:04 PM
"I do, yeah. And what it's like to feel like you're a part of the crew but still an outsider. The feeling is terrible."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 02-Apr-21 11:11 PM
[Eli] "I almost wish the guards would pay attention to me. Then someone would at least. I'm... Really trying to just be ok here. Playing a quiet game of not being seen. But this place... It's getting to me. I'm not mentally strong I guess."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 11:12 PM
"Its getting to all of us, in different ways but it is definitely going to affect us all. You're doing better than others though. Some of us can't stay off the guards radar."
