1
1
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 02-Apr-21 11:25 PM
[Eli] "Are you OK? I keep venting and I'm doing the same thing people do to me. I'm sorry Capri."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 11:27 PM
"Oh yeah, I'll be fine. The worst injury I've suffered is probably my pride. But I'll be alright."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 02-Apr-21 11:29 PM
[Eli] "I'm glad. I'd hate to see you hurt since you're like the only person who talks to me now." (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 11:29 PM
"It'll take more than a few cuts and bruises to cause real hurt. I've been through way worse."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 02-Apr-21 11:31 PM
[Eli] A ghost of a smile appeared on Eli's lips. "Join Starfleet they said, see the galaxy they said. It's an easy science vessel, no big deal..."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 11:33 PM
"They casually forgot to mention possibly becoming POWs, pink goo in replicators, getting nerve pinched by your XO..."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 02-Apr-21 11:35 PM
[Eli] "Weird neurological diseases, energy beings kicking our asses. Getting chewed out by the captain for saving her life, may she rest in peace."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 11:38 PM
"Wait, you got chewed out for saving the Captain?"
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 02-Apr-21 11:40 PM
[Eli] "She chewed me out for being a doctor and telling her to do horrible things like taking her medicine. In any case... Not what I had envisioned on my whirlwind tour of the galaxy."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 02-Apr-21 11:44 PM
"I mean.....im sure she won't be your last difficult patient though. And I dont think any of us expected this in the slightest."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 02-Apr-21 11:49 PM
[Eli] "Oh of course not. Most Starfleet personnel are terrible patients. And no, I realize that. I'm sure I'll feel better soon, it's just being tired, hungry, overworked and the threat of being killed around every corner? This place is just a liiiiittle bit stressful. "
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:01 AM
"But only just a little. The sooner we can get the hell out of here, the better. Have you seen some of the other prisoners? They're so....." He looked out at a few of the prisoners who'd been there for quite some time, sighing at their defeated expressions. "They've lost their spark."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:02 AM
[Eli] "Yeah. I fear that'll happen to us sooner rather than later. I feel it myself. This place sucks the life out of you."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:10 AM
"Thats their goal. They throw us into shit conditions with horrible food and force us to do backbreaking work. If we're exhausted and burnt out, it makes it that much easier to break us. And if they can give us no reason to believe Starfleet will find us, it'll just help to break us down further."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:12 AM
[Eli] "I agree. But it seems so hopeless in the end. They beat us so easily."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:14 AM
Capri nodded then furrowed his eyebrows, "You think.....you think maybe they beat us....too easily?"
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:16 AM
[Eli] "What are you implying? We're a small science ship... Do you think we were betrayed?"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:18 AM
"What? No! Nothing like that! But....what if....." He paused, hesitating a little. He rubbed the back of his neck before looking back at Eli. "What if we were a decoy? Ya know....like....bait. we get sent out, the Iconians are busy with us while the others launch an ambush?"
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:24 AM
[Eli] "I suppose it's possible. But we don't even know what they want."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:28 AM
"Maybe they want to get as many Federation forces out of the way so they can rip through the quadrants unopposed."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:31 AM
[Eli] "They seem like they don't need to use these tactics to do it. Barely anyone can stand up to them. From what I've read, there has been no Starfleet vessels to survive an attack."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:35 AM
"But there's got to be a way to. We've beaten them before somehow."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:38 AM
[Eli] "I'll admit this was my first time encountering them. I guess once we're out of here we'll have to focus on being more of a tactical ship than science.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:46 AM
"Same here. And I guess so. So much for simple scientific exploration, huh?"
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:49 AM
[Eli] "I guess so. I was hoping to not have to go back to a tactical ship but... I suppose it is what it is."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:52 AM
"You were on a Tactical ship? You're not a big fan of the environment there, I'm guessing?"
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:53 AM
[Eli] "I was on a tactical ship for 4 years. It was fine at first. The work was hard but rewarding, and we all became close. But... I lost my best friend. He died and I couldn't help him, so I got jaded and requested a transfer."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 12:56 AM
Capri looked at him and wiped his eyes, shaking his head a little. "I'm so sorry, Eli....truly, truly sorry..."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 12:57 AM
[Eli] Eli shook his head and put his hand on the younger man's shoulder. "It's OK. I came to terms a while ago it still hurts because he's gone but I'm getting through it."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 01:02 AM
"Seems to be something we tend to excel at in Starfleet. We experience hardship, we get through it. It's a miracle we handle it so well."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 01:04 AM
[Eli] Eli nodded and decided to eat his now cold food. "Yeah. But you can see why I value friendship so much, because it can be so fleeting."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 01:05 AM
Capri took a few more bites as he watched the other inmates mill around. "Absolutely, and I understand. My friends are what keep me sane some days. And they keep us honest, you know?"
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 01:07 AM
[Eli] "Yeah exactly. Tim's memory drives me to be better and do better a sa doctor. It's just... Hard to see past this very large roadblock."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 01:08 AM
"It will be for a while, but in time the road will clear and the path will be bright."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 01:14 AM
[Eli] "You have a good outlook Capri. If appreciate you cheering me up. I'll try to be a bit more positive."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 01:16 AM
"I have no clue where it comes from." He said with a little chuckle, offering Eli his fist for a bump.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 01:25 AM
[Eli] Eli returned the fist bump and leaned back again the wall. "I think I'll hang out and rest here a bit. I'm too tired to move at the moment."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 01:28 AM
He nodded and looked at his tray with a cringe, "I'll leave you alone to rest for a bit. Let me know if you need anything alright?" He smiled and stood slowly.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 01:57 AM
[Eli] Eli gave Capri a smile and nodded. "Thanks Capri. I'll see you around." Eli went back to resting his head against the wall.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 02:00 AM
Walking inside, Sara had begun for the replicator, knowing she should eat before her shift, but was sidetracked by a large figure sitting hunched on the ground nearby. At first she thought he was injured, recognizing the figure as Eli, but soon she realized he was just.. sitting. She stopped on her way over, giving a quick internal frown. She knew what she should do.. but her own pride stung at the thought knowing that any other person would have done the same were they in her boots.. But she couldn't have Eli upset with her, or worse, thinking she was upset with him. Damn it. She walked over anyhow, her mind determined but her facial expression seemingly listless. "Eli?" She started, suddenly nervous, but swallowed the feeling that rose up to pinken her ears. It was just an apology, goodness Sara... "May I speak with you please?"
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 02:00 AM
He nodded and stood up, patting Elis shoulder. He recycled his tray but didn't go far, stopping to talk to a couple other inmates from the Phoenix.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 02:04 AM
[Eli] Eli cracked open an eye, closed it again and internally groaned. It could have been anyone else, but it had to be her. He took a deep breath before opening his eyes fully, the teal orbs focusing on her. "Of course Lieutenant, what can I do for you?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 02:08 AM
"I just." Meekness did not become her, but his gaze on her suddenly made her go a bit mute as she tried to parse her words. She should have had a line waiting, a generic apology. Short, sweet, over. But she was flying by the seat of her pants these days it seemed. "I wanted to talk to you about the night before last. If you care to."
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 02:11 AM
[Eli] He pursed his lips for a moment. "I can assure you Lieutenant that my behavior won't happen again. If you'd like to talk a out it further, I won't stop you." (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 02:19 AM
"It's not necessarily yours I'm concerned with.. it was mine." She fiddled with her fingers in front of her, keeping eye contact as best she could, but her cheeks felt hot, and she occassionally glanced down as she spoke. "I was working off a lot of adrenaline that day.. having already put myself between him and another person already. So I was geared up for another round of it.. and I was not thinking of the actual intent you had.. and I am sorry I assumed and yelled at you. I was.." She swallowed tightly, keeping her position a few steps away, but close enough she could watch his expression. "I was only doing what I thought would prevent someone else from ending up like Maggie.. but it did not make it right to yell at you like I did. ..I am sorry, Eli." (edited)
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 02:26 AM
[Eli] He considered her words carefully. She was at least speaking with him and even apologizing. He took another breath and spoke slowly. "I can understand the position you were in, under the same circumstances I might have done the same thing. That being aside, I would have hoped you would think a little more of me than just being some muscle bound brute. Just because I'm a big guy doesn't mean I solve my problems with my fists. If that's what you think of me, I can't imagine what kind of friendship you'd want to have with me."
2
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 02:31 AM
"What I assumed if you had nothing to do with your size, It had to do with the possibility of you physically defending your friend, our friend. Unfortunately, panic does not always see the clearest vision, so while I know rationally you would never, in the moment with Maggie bleeding and broken on a canteen table, it could have been a very valid reality.. One I am still sorry I assumed of you." (edited)
3
3
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 02:39 AM
[Eli] "I'm a healer and I swore an oath to do so. That's what I've been doing from the start of me getting to the Phoenix. It's all I've ever wanted to do. I was hoping you would see that. But I've realized that current circumstances and our previous talks have shown me that we... I won't be able to have what I was hoping for. So I won't torture you further. I forgive you. " He drew his knees up to his chest, looking far smaller than his 6'3" frame showed. (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 02:56 AM
"Eli.. I understand you're not pleased with me.. but you must also understand that we've met twice. And I. I like to think I have a good intuition for people, I would always love to assume the absolute best from people. But the truth is? Despite you having the oath, the doctor bedside manner, the- everything? I do not know you. And to expect me to intrinsically know your reactions, and how you might have felt in that moment? Is unfair to me. So while I appreciate your forgiveness, as you really were not obligated to do so, I think you should also reflect on what you're expecting of me." Sara bit her lower lip, feeling a bit bitter about that portion of conversation, bit maybe it was for the best. He was handsome, he was kind, but gods his expectations were high. "But if that is not something you can compromise on- I understand.. and wish you the best. No hard feelings." (edited)
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 03:03 AM
[Eli] "I think you're misunderstanding me entirely. We have only met twice, and that's what I wanted to change this entire time. I've wanted so badly to spend time with you, get to know you. I felt like maybe we could have had something more than a friendship someday. I thought above most people on the ship you understood what it was like being so far from such a large home and family. I didn't want to push you in any way, so I left the ball in your court, so to speak. Promises of time spent together that would unfortunately never happen. Your words and actions, or rather lack of them, I understand. I never had any expectations of you Sara, I just wanted to know you."
3
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 03:11 AM
"I mean, Eli, I was busy. We were on the brink of a war and I had duties and research to attend to that outweighed dates by a lot. I did what I could in-between my work but.." She shook her head, sighing. This wasn't what she'd wanted to do. She hadn't wanted to bring this portion up. " I do not mind getting to know you, I had never minded that idea, but the timing was just.. I could not agree to anything serious when, when??" She gestured vaguely around them at the canteen walls. " -this was a possible outcome." (edited)
"You are not the only one I have said not yet to, Eli. But it does not mean I do not care for you or do not want to be your friend and know you." (edited)
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 03:17 AM
[Eli] "We work for Starfleet. There's always going to be a when. It's not like we're living on idyllic Earth where nothing bad happens. We lived on a starship that could be blown up, incinerated or invaded at any moment. So there's always a when. It's what you do with the now that counts. This is my now. Is it the wrong time to talk about this? Maybe. But if I worried about the when, I'd never tell you how I felt. Right now I have this moment. You look ahead so much you miss what's right in front of you." He looked away and spent a moment composing himself, emotions thick. "If you keep worrying about the when and not living for the now, you'll always be saying no."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 03:36 AM
She had to take a moment of reflection to really consider his words. He was right in his own way, She really did look too far forwards and did not appreciate what she had in front of her in the now, but there was no way for him to know or understand where she was coming from when her best laid plans relied heavily on that future.. and now that the future was potentially bleak, if their plans did not work, if the idea of a SOS signal wasn't available.. if she got caught. All she had was the now, and even though it was staring her smack dab in the face, she still felt too deeply about her own convictions. She couldn't risk hurting someone when things were so unstable. She bowed her head defeatedly as she spoke. "I do not.. feel safe enough to pursue these things, and have not felt emotionally safe enough.. for a long time, Eli. That is what crumbled my last relationship.. and I do not want it to happen again. I am.. I am really sorry for this. For not being ready for the now." (edited)
4
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 03:43 AM
[Eli] "I get it, especially with the current circumstances. If there wasn't imminent death in front of me I wouldn't have even mentioned anything. But, I had to. Because you deserved to know how I felt and I deserved to tell you." He rose tiredly, almost slouching from his normal tall stance."The when is not certain, and your feelings are valid. Hell, the now isn't certain either. I'm willing to wait and see if the now stabilizes, and try to get to know you. But I can't guarantee the when. Tell me there might be a now someday soon and forget about the when."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 03:46 AM
"That? I can at least promise." She smiled finally, a small one, but it was a smile none the less. She offered her hand out to him gently, her palm facing upwards. "Raincheck?" (edited)
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 03:49 AM
[Eli] He regarded the hand with some scrutiny before taking it gently. "The rainiest. May I offer you a hug?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 04:02 AM
Her smile only widened as she nodded quietly, extending her arms for him to step into.
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 03-Apr-21 04:03 AM
[Eli] He took the step quickly, wrapping her in a warm hug. He would speak quietly to her. "We're all going to get out of here alive, I know it."
6
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 03-Apr-21 04:23 AM
"I had begun to falter.. but thank you for instilling some hope yet." She whispered just as quietly, squeezing her arms around his waist in the hug before pulling away, though deeply not wanting to. She hadn't realized how much she'd needed that. "I hope your night improves, Eli."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 07:51 AM
He entered scratching his scraggly beard before getting some water and sat down at a table.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 07:54 AM
S‘Kiv entered, got himself something to eat and looked around for a free table. He saw someone sitting alone at a table and so he walked over and asked. „Is this chair here still free?“
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:04 AM
He looked spooked for a moment. "N-no, it's free." He managed a nervous grin.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:14 AM
S'Kiv nodded and sat down. "I think we haven't met before. I'm S'Kiv."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:16 AM
"Edward." He introduced himself after taking a long sip of his drink.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:17 AM
"Which cell are you in?" He ate a bit from his food.
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:18 AM
"Seventeen, though I've spent more time in solitary than my cell so far." He said rubbing his eyes again and looking about.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:19 AM
"I'm in Six. What are you assigned to do?"
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:19 AM
"Scrapper. Yourself?"
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:20 AM
"High Level Scrapper."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:21 AM
"Low level. Find any good materials?" He asked.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:23 AM
"I was there only once and no, not so far. I think we won't find anything up there. The Iconians letting people die up there, with few hopes of finding anything."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:29 AM
"I managed to make a shank that didn't work too well, was gonna make more and spread them amongst everyone. Didn't get time to see it through..." Edward sighed.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:33 AM
„You mean when you stamped on your Badge when you should have given it to them?“ S‘Kiv had heard about that but he hadn’t been in the room when it had happened.
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:34 AM
"Nah, that was when we were in processing. This was a different incident." Edward shrugged taking a sip. (edited)
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:37 AM
„Want to tell me what happened? I did not know that you had a second incident.“
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:42 AM
"I made a old fashion prison shank from some scrap. They must have intense scanners in the cells because not a soul knew I made one. Guard entered insisting I had one out of no where about an hour later. I stabbed it repeatedly before being tossed in solitary." Edward explained in a hushed tone. "I am this aggressive so that the guards are distracted. While someone else formulates an actual plan... And I keep heat off them." Edward added a bit quieter.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:44 AM
S'Kiv nodded and asked even quieter. "So someone is planning something?"
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:46 AM
"I hope, if not this is all for not." Edward sighed.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 08:47 AM
"I agree, but maybe it would be good for you if you didn't do too much in the next time. I don't think they will tolerate you doing things like this often."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 08:51 AM
"That I know. Likely got one or two more misbehaves at most, before they do something. Extreme." He shrugged. "If so then it will serve as a guideline to how far others can push until punished." (edited)
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 09:13 AM
"Perhaps it would be better if other people did something as well. It won't get us anything if you get badly hurt or even killed."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 09:14 AM
"I won't ask that of anyone." Edward sighed rubbing his neck. (edited)
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 09:15 AM
"But of yourself."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 09:18 AM
"I'm young and can afford a little self sacrifice yet." He chuckled to himself.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 09:20 AM
"What if you die?" S'Kiv ate again. His voice sounded as if he was talking about next days weather.
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 09:25 AM
"In a way I'll be free." Edward replied after a few moments and finishing his drink. It was a cold hard truth. "Though, they won't get me laying down. Or without a struggle." He smiled slightly. (edited)
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 09:29 AM
„You are not afraid of death?“
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 09:40 AM
"I am but we all will face it eventually, it's an inevitability that binds us all." Edward said leaning back in his chair. "Weather we want it or not. But I reserve some confidence that as futile as it seems we will get out of here. We need just to play our part. Whatever that part may be."
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 09:42 AM
„I agree that we will get out of here and I will do whatever is necessary, even if that includes me getting hurt.“
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 09:45 AM
"Seems we are on the same page, Mr. S'Kiv." Edward said idly pulling at the collar of his jumpsuit.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 11:08 AM
„It would seem so.“ S’Kiv said. He looked curious. „With whom are you in your cell?“
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 12:10 PM
"Famke, Dei, Greg, Alexander." He replied. "Yourself?"
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 12:26 PM
"Amanda, Ga'HaTz, a Jem'Hadar and a klingon from the other ship."
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 01:13 PM
"More interesting company then." Edward shrugged.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 01:33 PM
„One could say so. More dangerous as well if someone has a problem.“
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 01:59 PM
"Also true. Well I'd like to stick around but I must be going S'Kiv. Let me know if you hear of anything interesting, and I will see you around." Edward said slowly getting to his feet with an internal groan.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 03-Apr-21 02:45 PM
„I will do so.“ He nodded to Edward and then went back to eating.
Cadet Edward Smith 03-Apr-21 02:50 PM
He left, a guard following him in escort.
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 05:35 PM
Nedras stepped into the canteen, moving quickly and quietly, almost sneaking over to one of the replicators. He took whatever mystery substance came out of said replicator to a table in one of the corners and started eating, trying to avoid attention.
5
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 05:49 PM
He was about to be unsuccessful in this endeavor. At first when she entered, she reluctantly replicated something vaguely food-shaped, content with eating by herself. She didn’t have to stay for long, and she was already heading to an empty table, when in her peripheral vision appeared a familiar pale set of Vorta ears attached to a familiar Vorta head. Nedras. She wanted nothing more than to run over to him and wrap him in a hug, but she stopped herself before she even took a step. If there was one thing she knew, it’s that he would not want that. Not right now, and certainly not from her. But a twinging in her chest pulled her to his table anyway, and she cleared her throat softly. “Nedras.” (edited)
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 05:55 PM
He looked up quickly and froze in a way that more suggested 'rabbit startled by a loud noise' than 'person happy to see a friend'. A moment later, he smiled politely and resumed eating, maybe a little faster, because by the Founders he was not going to get interrupted before he could finish his meal this time. "Ensign. Is there something I can help you with?" He asked cheerfully between bites.
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 05:58 PM
The things she felt when he called her by her title instead of her name settled deep in her bones. Any semblance of anger or reproach he might’ve picked up on had been completely wiped clean by this point, replaced with a flushed look of remorse and exhaustion. She shook her head. “Can I sit?”
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 06:00 PM
"Mhm." He said, mouth full, gesturing broadly at the many empty seats across from and generally around him. He chewed and swallowed. "How is Processing these days? It looked... chaotic, from my angle, but then my vision isn't what it used to be."
1
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 06:04 PM
She sat gingerly down across from him, stirring her food around on her plate to keep her hands busy. She knew she had to eat, but it was suddenly even more unappealing than before. “It’s hot. And hard. Very unrewarding.” She answered, without a single hint of bitterness. She took a bite- these were simply facts to her at this point. “How’s overseeing?”
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 06:11 PM
He stopped eating. His plate was empty. He'd just wolfed down his entire portion in the span of a couple of minutes, which was quite the task one-handed. He leaned back casually, as if his behavior was totally normal and not at all unusual. "As I've already said, I'm truly blessed to be able to do what the Founders in their wisdom engineered me for." He said with an appropriate amount of conviction. "I was recently assigned to speak to a Starfleet Captain the other day in one of the labs. Captain Enga. She was being uncooperative. I was called in to... help." He swallowed. "It was... a most enlightening experience."
4
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 06:48 PM
Her stomach dropped. The implications of the phrase ‘enlightening experience’ coming out of the mouth of Nedras, someone she knew had a previous reputation with his line, were frankly quite worrying. “I, um- they have labs here?” She got out, chewing hard on the inside of her mouth to keep herself quiet. She fixed Nedras with a slightly expectant stare. “I hope Enga is alright.”
1
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 07:01 PM
He hunched over the table. "She had part of her ear shot off." He shook his head quickly. "I still can't tell why." He took a sip of water. "It didn't aid in the interrogation. In fact, it just about eliminated any progress until that point." He meant that on both counts, both gathering information and sending a message that there were allies who could help get Enga out. This was rapidly reaching a point where he wasn't willing to risk mere indirect conversation again. He stared down at the table. "They're trying to make more viruses like the one in sickbay, but uncurable. They want her to help. They're killing off her crew one by one as leverage. There's only one ensign left. They're losing patience, I think." He whispered quickly. "I lost my temper towards the end, at one of the guards."
1
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 07:09 PM
An instinctive hand flew up to her mouth. Her ear? Her fucking ear? A shiver ran down her spine when she remembered how she and Maggie were threatened with interrogation just half a day earlier. She liked her ears very much. "Prophets, Nedras, I'm- that sounds terrible, I'm sorry you had to see that." Her words came out soft, genuine even- she couldn't even imagine. Her eyes flicked to his arm, and she gave a gentle not towards it. "Is that why that happened? Losing your temper?"
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 07:22 PM
"Yes." He replied, voice still as quiet as he could make it without his words being lost in the general din of the canteen. "But it served its purpose. Enga and the ensign were sent back to their cells, the interrogation was abandoned for the time being, and I haven't seen anything similar on cameras since." His tone was even, without much emotional affect. This was just a report, he reminded himself.
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 07:42 PM
"I-" She paused, watching his eyes, before looking down at her food. "That's..." She didn't want to say 'good'- nothing about this was good in any way. She trailed off, blanking out for a bit longer than she intended. "Maggie and I confirmed the Chimera isn't scrapped." She offered flatly after a moment.
4
4
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 07:52 PM
His eyes widened fractionally. He looked around to see if any guards had been alerted, then made eye contact with Cas again. He slipped awkwardly but surely back into the field supervisor persona, which was increasingly like wearing an ill-fitting coat. "Yet. I'm sure you'll see its dedication plate on the conveyor belt soon. Whatever you were planning to do, I imagine you'll soon be out of time." He said in some approximation of smugness.
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 08:36 PM
She nodded once. She knew he was acting, at least to some extent, and while that did soothe her nerves just a bit, a small part of her was still waiting for the other shoe to drop. Aside from the Chimera bit, she was walking around with contraband in her pocket. What if he innocently asked her to empty her pockets again? “Right, of course.” She replied, voice low. “There’s not much use in looking for it at all, and even then I wouldn’t know where to look.” Maybe he could give her a slight hint. (edited)
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 08:45 PM
"No use at all, unless you've somehow managed to hide a spare EV suit in your jumpsuit." He muttered scornfully. Part of him anticipated another slap any moment now, and so he was wary, and somewhat tense. He didn't know where the Chimera was specifically, but he at least knew ships yet to be scrapped were outside the main prison. "Not to mention the ability to hijack a transport - or for that matter transporter. Completely useless."
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 09:01 PM
EV suit. So clearly it wasn’t somewhere easy to access- that much she’d figured already, but it was reassuring to hear it from him. “Completely useless, yes. It’d take far too long- unless of course there was some sort of distraction, which is just wishful thinking on my part.” She prompted, softening her body language as much as possible to put him at ease.
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 09:19 PM
Nedras frowned minutely. "Let's say, hypothetically, that you, or some other would-be rebel, were able to find a distraction." He said slowly. "And let's say I walked into my next administrative control shift, in twenty-eight hours and fifteen minutes, and found out that there'd been an irritating little breach - tell me, are you certain some hypothetical saboteur would find something useful there?" (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 09:35 PM
Her eyes brightened slightly. “Oh, well- hypothetically speaking, I suppose that would be useful. But of course now I’m telling you too much of a possible plan, yes?” She said. “I guess it’ll never happen now, even if there was a hypothetical group of us ready and willing to do it.”
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 09:38 PM
"You aren't telling me of a plan, as far as I can tell. In fact, what I'm hearing is that you would specifically avoid doing something so futile." He lied smoothly, smiling. For once it was a genuine smile. "I can't imagine when one might want to do such a thing, anyway - but if one were to, just know..." He turned towards one of the cameras and looked at it, then looked back at Cas, hoping to convey he'd take that as a signal. "I'm always watching." Or twelve hours of the day, anyway. (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 09:53 PM
“You make a very good point, Nedras.” She admitted, watching him carefully but avoiding following his head turn. She sure as hell picked up on it, though. “I wouldn’t imagine doing anything you would see and potentially report. Avoiding all escape plans is the path I’m taking.”
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 10:00 PM
"Lovely." Even Cas's coded messages were so honest. It was heartwarming, frankly, and here he was certain he had no heart. "Please avoid them with haste." Okay, he was getting a little heavy-handed too, what of it? His shoulders slumped a little. "My job gets busier and busier by the day." He sighed, shaking his head as if in disappointment. "Soon I imagine the workload will be entirely impossible to manage." It was truly starting to eat away at him.
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 03-Apr-21 10:02 PM
Capri was sitting at a rickety table and staring at the wall, nit wanting to return to his cell yet.
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 10:41 PM
“I’d switch with you if I could. You can take my job any day.” It was intended as a mood-lightener, but it half came out as a plea. She was physically worn down by this point, and it was starting to show. Her face morphed into a sympathetic frown. “But you and I both know- or at least I hope you do- that nothing we do here is going to be held against us. Right?” She was pleading again now, but for a different reason. If Nedras wasn’t able to forgive himself, how could he forgive her for not trusting him? The thought of losing her friend again was entirely impossible to bear right now. “Try not to lose yourself in the work.”
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 10:52 PM
He frowned deeply. "I don't think that's true." He admitted, voice tinged with regret. He looked up again, making eye contact with Cas. "I'm very good at my job." He said quietly, hoping the myriad of implications that had would get across.
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 11:00 PM
“Nedras.” Cas leaned across the table, voice shaking slightly. “I don’t care how good you are your job. I don’t care if you are court martialed, thrown in the brig, or anything else.” The unspoken part there was that at this point, she would probably willingly follow him off a cliff if it convinced him. “I know you well enough to know that I. Trust. You.”
4
5
4
Ensign Nedras 03-Apr-21 11:19 PM
Nedras fully intended to say that he cared very much about those two possibilites, personally, thank you very much, but Cas's reply was earnest in such an unfamiliar way that it took him off-guard. He ended up merely shaking his head a few times. "If there's one thing I've had confirmed over the past few days, it's that very few people know me. They know me as I was in Starfleet, and that's all - but it's kind of you to say so." He replied flatly.
Ensign Cas Yardi 03-Apr-21 11:53 PM
She was speechless for a half a second, gaping in a way similar to a fish, before her mouth snapped shut and her head lowered. "When we get out of here, I promise you can tell me anything you'd like- if you want to." Half of her wasn't even sure she wanted to know pre-Starfleet Nedras, but it came out anyway. "I'll make the effort to listen if you make the effort to share." Her food was infinitely more mush-like than it was when she replicated it, but she continued to push it around anyway. "But I need to know, how much of the Dominion am I seeing sitting in front of me right now? Is it more than what it was three weeks ago when you were eating pie on my floor, or is it less?" It wasn't a question she enjoyed asking, but it was necessary. That's what she told herself as the words left her lips- she had to know.
Ensign Nedras 04-Apr-21 12:08 AM
He tilted his head to the side, genuinely uncertain how to answer that question. His gaze drifted off to the wall behind Cas, and he tried to think back to when he'd defected. "I think..." He started. His brow furrowed slightly, then unfurrowed as he made several comparisons. "I think the amount never really changed." He admitted. "Merely the perspective. People... see more of it." He mused, squinting, which made the remaining bruising dotting his face ache. "And I feel it more readily than I ever did when there was Starfleet to balance it." He chuckled. "I suppose you see it differently. Bajorans, humans - you see yourselves as more...changeable. It makes sense, given that you aren't intentionally engineered beings." He finished his water. "How much of Starfleet am I seeing?"
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 04-Apr-21 12:34 AM
Sara left the canteen soon afterwords.
Ensign Cas Yardi 04-Apr-21 12:55 AM
That was... a good answer. Possibly exactly the one she was expecting, and definitely better than what he could've said. "Thank you. For answering." She began, fiddling with her hands now that her food was throughly soupified. "It makes sense. Sometimes people... fall back into old habits in hard situations. Like this." She finally got out her answer, before jumping into pondering what was evidently her own question rebounded back. "In a way, that- that's part of my answer. I think I'm less Starfleet now than I was, but I also... I don't think I ever fully was in the first place. You said Bajorans, humans- that we're changeable, and in a certain way that's true, but it's also... not." She mentally slapped herself. Prophets, sentences were hard to form right now. "I'm a product of the way I was raised- which Starfleet certainly adds to- but what you're seeing now, is more similar to how I was when I... didn't really know who I was."
Lt. JG. Copernicus King 04-Apr-21 12:56 AM
Capri left the canteen after a bit.
Ensign Nedras 04-Apr-21 01:35 AM
"Then we understand one another." He said, satisfied. "The Dominion isn't evil." He blurted earnestly, if a bit self-consciously. "I really am thankful to the Founders and the Vorta who worked on my line, and I could never simply throw all of that aside. I don't care if that means I'm not really Starfleet." He decided, fiddling with his fork for no good reason. "But... this particular life is mine. That's the compromise I've made. And being that it is, I know that I can be something other than what I was made for. And so I am. Except now, I need to be who I was to ensure who I am can continue to exist." He went on. "I know it seems self-contradictory. Maybe it is. The Dominion is full of such contradictions - we, that is the Vorta, are able to accept them readily. More so than many other species." He was starting to wax needlessly poetic, he realized, more so than was strictly appropriate for his cover. "What I mean is that it's an unfair question. Surely you know that. I hope my future with all of you doesn't rely too heavily on the answer." (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 04-Apr-21 02:40 AM
'The Dominion isn't evil'- well, she didn't quite agree with him on that, but there was no part of her left with enough energy to press the issue. The rest of his statement, though... "No, no, Nedras, that makes sense. I understand." She reassured, raising her eyes to connect with his. "And no, there's not much you could say that would change how I feel about you- which is that I trust you, and I want you to stay safe. Okay? I was just... curious." Which was a bit of an understatement, but oh well. "And I'm sorry, too. For what I said after Maggie..." She trailed off and blinked. "I really am."
Ensign Nedras 04-Apr-21 03:02 AM
Privately, Nedras wondered he was unintentionally manipulating Cas into pitying and underestimating him the way he'd intended to do with the guards. He was acutely aware that he looked about as threatening as a half-drowned kitten under the circumstances, and while that was intentional, it still felt... misleading to accept Cas's apology. Wrong. Cas hadn't seen him in the laboratory. Cas didn't know what he'd been prepared to do, what even now he was still prepared to do despite knowing the Federation deemed it wrong. "There's no need for that. In fact, I'd hardly blame you if you chose to stand by your words." He said with forced cheer. "As you said, nobody can blame us for what we do here, yes? So it's alright." (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 04-Apr-21 03:38 AM
She walked right into that one. It wasn't alright, not to her- and maybe it was petty, to look for validation in the form of forgiveness, but maybe she just fine was being petty. "Right, yes. I wouldn't stand by them now, but- yes." She said, a bit less convincingly than she would've liked. Curling up into a ball was suddenly an incredibly tempting option. "There are other things to focus on- like hypothetical escape plans."
Ensign Nedras 04-Apr-21 03:46 AM
Nedras realized he was hurting a friend yet again. This time it hadn't even been intentional. He sighed heavily. "Indeed." He said a little sadly, standing. "Again. I'm always watching. Remember that when the time comes, yes? I believe I have a field shift shortly." (edited)
Ensign Cas Yardi 04-Apr-21 04:00 AM
This was going to take a lot to fix, she realized as he stood, and for minute she wondered if she even had to faculties to do that. If it was even possible, she stopped herself halfway through the thought- they would fix it. They had to. "I have a shift as well soon. I'll keep that in mind- cameras everywhere." She said, lifting her mostly eaten plate of gruel off the table as she followed him to stand. "I won't give you any reason to watch me too closely, I promise."
Ensign Nedras 04-Apr-21 04:04 AM
He did a semi-sarcastic, semi-genuine one-armed half-bow, a description which had far too many hyphens in it. "I trust you completely." He said cheerfully, before going to recycle his plate in the replicator and eventually leave.
Ensign Cas Yardi 04-Apr-21 04:19 AM
She let out a sigh after he left, lingering by the table just long enough to give space between their exits. Then she herself took the plate to be recycled before exiting the canteen.
Lieutenant Mino 04-Apr-21 05:32 PM

Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 04-Apr-21 05:40 PM

Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 04-Apr-21 05:50 PM
"Thanks." Malcolm said as he gave a slight smile and a nod as he sat down. "The name is Malcolm Parsons I am an Engineering officer or at least I was until we were capture now I am a mechanic." Malcolm said as he began to eat.
Lieutenant Mino 04-Apr-21 06:00 PM
“You are still an engineer. So I wouldn’t give up hope just yet, we still must find a way to escape. We are starfleet. Have you found any means of escape so far?”
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 04-Apr-21 06:13 PM
"I haven't given up hope, far from it. I know will make it out, cause we serve with one of the most incredible crews in the galaxy. Though currently, I am a Mechanic it is a useful job to have when a POW such as we currently are. Things break everywhere funny how that works. Gives a person a lot of freedom to move throughout the prison. I may even know a few people who are interested in clandestine adventures that accomplish said goal you speak of." Malcolm said with a smile, then leaned in closer and whispered in her ear. "The current main plan is that Starfleet will send a ship should we send a signal their way with coordinates and any information we can provide."
Lieutenant Mino 04-Apr-21 06:18 PM
Being a Ferengi she heard his whispers quite perfectly. She was one to also lower her voice. “And have you found a way to signal a ship? I had assumed that they’d intercept the signal long before it reached any ship in the federation.” (edited)
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 04-Apr-21 06:25 PM
"We are currently planning on using an alternating pattern that would bounce off the transceivers across several of the Iconian installations making it difficult to track the signal. As long as Starfleet reacts fast enough then we shouldn't have a problem. Though the backup plan, if that fails, is to steal the chimera before it is scrapped and attempt to escape that way." Malcolm whispered to her. (edited)
Lieutenant Mino 04-Apr-21 06:44 PM

Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 04-Apr-21 06:52 PM

Malcolm said as he looked at her questioning searching for what her intentions were if she would be the pilot should the other plans fail.

Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 04-Apr-21 10:10 PM

We got married a few months ago we had just got a house on Risa. Everything seemed to be going well. Now it will just be me if I make it out of this war. Which is hard, though I just focus on the task at hand and it gets easier. Just got to solve one problem at a time like a good Engineer." Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 07:10 PM
Hesria stepped in, and forced herself to get some food and water. She didn't want to eat anything, but the canteen was the best place to keep an eye out for anyone useful, and she'd look less suspicious if she was eating.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 07:20 PM
[Oskar] He walked into the canteen, and immediately over to one of the replicators. Gruel and water, his favorite. He sighed softly and sat down at a table, muttering something before he ate. He picked up the bowl and pinched his nose. He tilted his head back and downed the bowl of...whatever it was. He set the bowl back down and shuddered. He downed half the water before running a hand through his hair.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 07:38 PM
Sara walked into the canteen, fully expecting to eat a simple bowl of gritty meal and.. vitamins she guessed, if they even cared that much, and a glass of water- the water she was looking more forward to than the food for once. Heading over to the replicator, she got her tray and headed over to a table.. but she stopped dead in her tracks upon recognizing the enormous form of her best friend. Her tray was dropped with a clatter onto the table as she all but wordlessly tackled the tall German into a hug while he was still in his seat at the table.
7
7
8
To hell with being numb, as soon as she had laid eyes on him, every emotion that she had even a whisper of feeling over the past couple of weeks surged onto the front line and near gushed out of her, tears already dribbling at the waterline of her eyes. The impact of her hug most definitely made the table scrape against the floor, Her arms encircling his neck as she hid her face at his temple. "I thought you died!?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 07:50 PM
[Oskar] “Was zur Hölle?!” He said as he was tackled into the hug, not realizing who it was. He actually moved with the table, and held his arms against it to steady himself. He finally recognized the voice as Sara, one of his only friends. He placed his hands on her arms and his once stone-like posture dropped with relief as he felt her. He laughed a little, some tears of his own making their way to his eyes. “I thought I did too, for a while.” He said silently as he let out a slow exhale. All of the soreness from processing, all of the sweat, didn’t matter anymore. He had her back. “I’m sorry I haven’t found you sooner. Processing shifts are hell.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 07:55 PM
"No, no, it is okay! I should have looked harder for you, I am sorry, I am sorry." She whibbled, kissing his temple several times, almost refusing to let him escape the hug just yet. She had to make sure he was real, that he wouldn't suddenly shimmer to smoke and whisp out of her arms. But he was real, and relief had never made her feel so weary before. Gods alive, what a rush, she had him back too. "I have missed you so much, I am glad you are alive, but..I am sorry you are not well. When- when did you get assigned? Where were you on the escape pods?" She asked quietly, though her voice rushed, finally pulling her face away, but keeping her arms around his neck steadfast as she looked him over. (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 08:01 PM
He nodded. “I stayed in the hub mostly, trying to find a way into their computers. Obviously it didn’t work, and I had to escape with the pods. The Chimera had already departed by the time I had gotten to my muster station.” He said, with a hint of regret and guilt, like it was his fault. “What about you, where were you? It couldn’t have been easy anywhere.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 08:06 PM
She'd been watching the reunion with a soft, dreamy smile on her face, but the words 'trying to find a way into their computers' instantly perked her ears up. She wasn't going to interrupt, but she waited and continued to watch for an opportunity to join the conversation without interrupting.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 08:30 PM
"Escape pod two..I think. It all feels all like such a blur. I had been on the bridge when it all went down and I stayed perhaps a bit later than I should have." (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 08:32 PM
“Why is that? Did something happen up there?” He asked, moving to look up at her, a bit of worry in his eyes. “Wait. Have you seen the Captain? Do you know if she made it down?”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 08:47 PM
Oof. She hated.. she hated so dearly to be the one to say it. Obviously he hadn't spoken to anyone else who'd been on the bridge, as she thought it'd at least been common knowledge by now. She frowned deeply, bowing her head a bit as she untangled one of her arms from around his neck to cup his cheek gently. "I am sorry, Oskar.. The Captain she didn't make it down. Or off the ship." She shook her head softly, guilt wracking her suddenly for having notbtries, having not sided with Itesh or Capri.. but then T'Svai might have nerve pinched her too to get her away from the dying woman. "She was impaled, we couldn't move her."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 08:59 PM
[Oskar] Oskar looked down, breathing out slowly. “Shit. Sara, I’m sorry you had to see that.” He put an arm around her. “T’Svai is the Captain now, yeah? You guys figure something out yet?” He asked, looking up at her. “Please tell me you have something planned.” He whispered. (edited)
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 09:05 PM
That seemed like a good opportunity-- she pushed aside the wave of emotions she felt over learning of the captain's death and steeled herself. "Sorry, couldn't help but overhear-- I'm Lieutenant Hesria Valar, and uh-- I have information that I need to get to someone in Intel? Would either of you know enough to help? Or... Well, I heard you talking about trying to get into their computers..." Her tone was extremely hushed, an attempt at keeping the topic off the radar for any guards nearby.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 09:08 PM
[Oskar] Oskar looked over at Valar, then up at Sara. He looked at Valar again. “You should be more careful about what information you divulge in a public setting like this. You never know who’s listening.” He said, matching her tone. He looked around, making sure there was nothing else. “I’m Intelligence.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 09:13 PM
Sara realized with a flush of her face she was all but tangled with Oskar, quickly releasing him and stepping away, giving a nod to Hesria politely. She recognized this girl immediately, but now wasn't quite the time, not with schemes and plans on the verge of being explained... Maybe after. "I'm an overseer. We are actually working on something.. what do you have?" (edited)
Cadet Edward Smith 05-Apr-21 09:13 PM
He left the canteen in the background.

"I'm a programmer so I can probably finagle with it and make use of it, but I talked to Commander Yllescas and he recommended I get with someone in Intelligence for best results."

Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 09:26 PM
"It's an overseer's PADD, but I can probably get more access than what it comes with standard, given enough time." Finally, she felt like she was useful. This was something she was good at, skilled at, even, and she was comfortable and confident in her abilities.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 09:31 PM
“I assume you don’t have it with you. That’s smart, mitigates risk. If you can bring it to me, I can examine it for you. Make sure you won’t trip any alarms while you tamper with the device.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 09:36 PM
"It's hidden, definitely not with me." She tried not to be insulted at the idea that she would be so clumsy as to trip any alarms; obviously this officer didn't know her or her skillset. "I don't think I'll need any help not tripping alarms, but I would like some guidance-- or information on a plan-- so I know what to do once I'm in. Commander Yllescas thinks getting a signal out is top priority, so I can probably try to get comms access, but I don't have command codes or know any specific frequencies to do that. I'm an Ops officer, but I wasn't ever in or fond of communications, so that's out of my wheelhouse. Once we've gotten a signal out, I can also try to wreak some havoc, but I don't want to do anything detrimental to us."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 09:45 PM
“I can get you Intelligence communication frequencies, they’ll be sure to notice and investigate that way. I can give you my personal identification number and clearances as well. They know who I am, and if you can get Lieutenant King as well, then they’ll have to come and check it out. Two agents down is a red flag for all departments.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 09:47 PM
Hesria nodded enthusiastically, making mental notes of what Oskar told her. "Perfect. I've got a good mind for numbers, so you can tell me the codes and I'll remember them. Safer than writing anything down, I think." She glanced around again, checking for any guards in the area. Turning to Sara, she asked: "I'm sorry, I didn't catch your name. Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 09:51 PM
"Sara Bjørge, I'm one of the overseers as well..and we do not get PADD's that I am aware of..how did you happen to get yours?" The logical answer would be Nedras, but she didn't want to out her, all she'd seen them do is kiss, she could have gotten it from another source for all she knew.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 09:52 PM
"Uhm," Of course, there it is. Cheeks turned bright pink as heat flooded her face. "Nedras gave it to me, while I was on shift. He, uh, slipped it to me."
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 09:56 PM
Ahh, that's what they'd been doing..sneaky sneaky~. She desperately wanted to smile, but somehow cinched the grin into a straight line across her lips, biting them. But her gaze to Hesria told all. "Of course..guess I'll have to see how Nedras got a hold of his then. But if there is anything I can do to be of assistance in the mean time, please let me know, ja?" (edited)
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 09:58 PM
"Do you feel comfortable sharing whatever you mentioned earlier, about... working on something?" That look meant something, what did it mean? It was knowing, like she somehow saw-- oh. Oh. "By 'overseer' you wouldn't happen to mean... Like Nedras? With access to cameras?" She suddenly found the disgusting bowl of porridge in front of her absolutely fascinating.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 10:01 PM
"I do not mind- I am under guidance of Commander T'Svai, looking into the admin controls to see if there is a way to send out a message through the communications channel- but a PADD is much smaller and easier to hide. Lieutenant Hesria Valar 05-Apr-21 10:06 PM
Oh creator. Hesria put both her hands over her face and sighed. "I would accept your congratulations if I didn't know it was just a disguise for slipping a PADD into my jumpsuit without anyone noticing. I mean, not that I wanted it to be anything other than that. Of course. I mean, this isn't exactly the time or place for that sort of thing. And he's a Vorta, which means he probably can't... have feelings like that. I think. Not that I'm well-versed on Vorta physiology or... or looked it up or anything..." Trailing off, the Trill put her forehead down on the table and thunked it lightly a few times.
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 05-Apr-21 10:09 PM
"Oh honey." Sara scooted closer to the other blonde and wrapped a quick arm around her shoulders, patting her lightly on the opposing arm. A soft 'there, there' probably didn't matter much, but it was a difficult position to be in, she understood a little too well. "All it means is that we must get out of here now..so that you can see if he meant it..another way, yes? I do not think anyone would kiss anyone right now if it were not truly dire? Or if it was from deep inside...toothpaste is at a premium." (edited)

Commander Yllescas Itesh 05-Apr-21 11:27 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 05:25 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 05:41 PM

I might make some more friends." She offered with a grin, tucking a bit of her hair behind her ear as she spoke. "There's something about being in a litetal labor camp that has made me realize I need to stop being so reserved.. so it will definitely be a shore leave to remember."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 05:45 PM

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 05:52 PM
"Not much of a drinker even in the best and worst of times as you're so fond of recalling~ But? You do make for a tempting argument. I have always wanted to visit your hometown, and I do miss your Oma.. and I do love currywurst... Aaand I guessss I like spending time with you too~" Her amusement was clear in both her words and her expression, her eyes having a spark of life in them for the first time since they'd arrived, her heart beating even harder now than when they'd been captured. "It'd be awful remiss of me to turn down a private tour guide as well. It's quite a steal..but that is an awful lot you're offering. All mine for the low low price of- what?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 06:01 PM
[Oskar] Oskar paused. Well, here we are. What could he say in this moment that doesn’t make him look completely stupid? He blushed a light pink as he cleared his throat. "Well...Listen, I know you're not looking for a boyfriend right now. You’ve got things to do and trips planned that you want to take, but if you want a husband some day, you know where to find me." He said, turning his face away, as he was blushing a deeper red. (edited)
5
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 06:18 PM
It definitely..took a moment to process that. From sheer dumb confusion to a pitch of internal laughter that nearly had her heart spilling out of her chest. Her commitment issues had never felt so blindingly 24k. She had said no to a lot of men over the past year, Oskar included, but only he had come back to her with a reverence and a game plan. He had her shook to her core, face-flushed and speechless..and that's more than she could ever say than any other man who'd tried his hand. "Oskar..I" It almost sounded like another no, her hand reaching for his, gripping his palm sturdily. "I appreciate so much..the level of commitment you're willing to give me.. And it's true, I'm not looking for a boyfriend, I was very scared when I turned you down. Terrified even, of this happening, of one of us dying, anything could have happened.. But- It was only until this was over, until we survived this.. But I'd also be lying if I didn't say I'd thought..about It. Us. This. Being together. Ever since we* met. But I was happy being your friend, you know?" *She whispered. "But I don't want you to offer marriage just because you think it the only way- I want to be romanced, like normal, even if you do have an unfair advantage on it. ...But I will definitely be keeping that thought on the back burner for a future time, ja? I just want you to know for certain you're smitten with me..romantically." (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 07:02 PM
[Oskar] Oskar turned to look at her hand in his. He didn’t want to let her go. He felt the warmth of her hand, the smoothness of her skin against his rough callouses. He looked over at her. “I didn’t think marriage was the only way, you know. It’s just...” He paused, looking down at their hands together. “Ever since we got here, I’ve been thinking. About that night, when I first told you. Of course, there was chemistry before then, but in that moment I felt like that I could act on it completely instead of just dropping hints about how I felt. Sure, I had some with Momo. But I had to work for the answers I wanted. But with you, we’ve been friends so long, people already thought we were dating. Commander Parlac, for example.” He sighed a little, then looked at her. “Of course I plan to romance you, that wasn’t a question to me. Of course I’m romantically smitten with you. How else could I convince you otherwise, without explaining what I see later on down the line? If this is about Momo, you can forget her. I’m over her. I want you. You and you only.” (edited)

Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 08:28 PM
Well.. it wasn't as if it had all been about Momo.. It had definitely driven her to make her reconsider how often she allowed herself to catch feelings, but hearing him verbally assuage her fears had been the relief of burden she hadn't really realized she'd been holding so tightly. She swallowed and looked away from his intense gaze, blue eyes flitting about on the floor to find something to focus on, finally settling on Oskar's boots as she considered her words. "I always thought we had chemistry too.. but I was too shy to say it.. scared of ruining our friendship. I thought maybe.. you were out of my league.. You're more experienced than me, you're so sweet and funny and you have such firm goals in mind and." And he steadily bagged impossibly beautiful women, she had never thought for a second she could compare. "But you're right..and Commander Parlac is not the only one either.. Capri, my assistant Lokath, even Tal accused me of having feelings for you. And. I guess-" She gave a bit of a bitter huff of amusement, bringing her eyes up to his. Blue meeting hazel in a sudden spark of electricity. "Everyone saw it before we did." (edited)

Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 08:50 PM
[Oskar] “Out of my league? Sara. I thought I was out of yours.” He said, laughing a little. He took both her hands in his and looked at her. “Maybe we they saw it before us, but that doesn’t mean it’s not true. I know that what I’m feeling right now is genuine. Maybe we’re both just oblivious to our surroundings, but at least we can do that one together, huh?” That sudden jolt of electricity finally hit him as he looked into her eyes. Those eyes he would love to look into and get lost in of he could. The world faded around him, until it was just them and the table they were sitting at. (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 09:23 PM
"Well.. If there was anyone I'd truly be comfortable being out of my depth with..it would be you." She confessed finally, gripping her hands more firmly within his own, thumbing over his knuckles affectionately as she soaked in the moment. This was such a rare, lovely moment. Who knew when she would get this chance again- she doubted guards would let anyone have too good of a time here, but for now, they were alone by their selves, and could blissfully enjoy the soft, quiet moment between them. "Interesting..that it took being thrown into a labor camp to get this out of us, ja Bjørn?" She smiled, squeezing his hands once more. (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 09:38 PM
[Oskar] He smiled as well. This. This is what he had desired. Someone close. “Jeg vil si det, mus.” Of all the times and in all the places for this to happen, here and now seemed like a decent enough time for these revelations to come to light. This moment would last with him forever, the way he felt right now would never come again. This moment, was all he needed. This is all he wanted. “Maybe we can act on this further...when we leave.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 10:13 PM
"Maybe.. maybe we could act on it a little.. just a little. A small treat to stave us over." It was pretty clear what she was hoping for, her words were shy, but her expression very hopeful as she gave him an almost impish smile. (edited)
Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 10:24 PM
[Oskar] Oskar leaned in closer, a few inches away from her face. “I think we can manage that.” He said quietly and moved one gif his hands to her chin, lifting it up to level with his mouth. He kissed her gently on the lips. (edited)
