Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 10:36 PM
Sara eagerly leaned into him, wrapping arms around his neck and all but jerking him towards her, bordering on aggressively. But despite being alone in canteen.. she needed to reel it in..anyone could walk in at any moment.. and she didn't want guards to use him or her as leverage on the other. She pulled away after a moment, eyes glazed and half-lidded, but definitely quite pleased. "Sorry, almost devoured you just then-" She whispered, having not realized just how long she'd been waiting for that.
Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 11:06 PM
[Oskar] Oskar had wrapped his arms around her waist, and blushed a bit deeper when she pulled him in. When she pulled away, he did as well. “It’s been a long time coming. Why shouldn’t we enjoy it a bit, huh?” He laughed a bit and smiled. “You think people will notice that we did this? Plus uh...what should we call this? I’d hate to give them the wrong impression.” (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 06-Apr-21 11:23 PM
She nodded as he spoke, her own cheeks lit up like a tomato. This was real, they'd really just.. gone and kissed like that in the middle of a labor prison. Adrenaline rushed her despite her seemingly still appearance, even though she felt she could probably run a marathon. "Wh- well.. I mean, I hope to not treat you too terribly different from before? And there's little reason to lie about what this is.. if someone calls us out. I don't think anyone will though. We have denied it and each other long enough.. I am not sure anyone would bat an eye if I yanked you down for another kiss in the middle of a crowded room. I think we have immunity at this point.. What's a bit of kissing between best friends?" She chuckled, the smile reaching her eyes as she leaned in to kiss his temple once more. Just as she done before upon their reunion. "I like clarity, don't you? So..in no uncertain terms, we are in a relationship, yes?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 06-Apr-21 11:30 PM
[Oskar] Internally, he was giddy. He didn’t yet realize it, but a large smile came across his face as she informed him of the clarity of the situation. “In a relationship, aye. I think that works for me.” He chuckled as well, his settling in a deep red blush. “What’s a bit of kissing between friends?”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 07-Apr-21 12:01 AM
Sara's expression mirrored his own, a smile spreading across her lips. As much as she wanted this- and as much as she wanted to spend the rest of the evening embracing him- she knew she had duties to attend to, a shift to muck around with, but even though the recon was nerve-wracking, he'd given her something sweet to reminisce about during it all. "Truly~ But..as much as I hate to cut short..I have shift to attend to, can we meet again later tonight?"
Commander Yllescas Itesh 07-Apr-21 12:05 AM
[Oskar] “If my shift doesn’t run over, of course. I have a long one today. Processing helps build the muscles, though. That scrap is heavy after five hours.” He said, kissing her forehead and standing up. “When this is all over, it’s chocolate popcorn and movie night every night for a week.” (edited)
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 07-Apr-21 12:25 AM
She brushed a quick hand over his shoulder as she pulled away from the hug, he standing tall in front of her as she took a quick appreciative glance. "I can tell. You were already burgeoning on 'muscle milk' before we got captured." She smiled once more, she standing up as well in order to leave. "Pasta and garlic bread too, I'm begging."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 07-Apr-21 12:27 AM
[Oskar] “I’ll cook it fresh, just for you. I’ll make the damn pasta myself.” He said, now he was thinking of food. Real food. Food that tastes like food. “You’ll have to make the garlic bread though. I’m not good at it.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 07-Apr-21 12:32 AM
"I am definitely down for tag teaming~ and now with our shore leave plans set into stone with each other, all that's left to do is to get out of this place.. And I'll make you all the cheese filled garlic bread and you can eat."
Commander Yllescas Itesh 07-Apr-21 12:56 AM
[Oskar] “You make it sound like you can make it fast enough. I guarantee you can’t. You know I’ve a bottomless pit for a stomach.”
Lieutenant Sara Bjørge 07-Apr-21 01:02 AM
"Guess I'll be kept busy then, huh? But we'll see, I've got tricks, you know. Big families eat lots of food, I think I could surprise you. Think about it while on shift.. something to look forward to. We will be out of here soon, promise." One way or another..she thought quietly to herself. "See you soon Oskar-" And she soon left the canteen, all smiles and giddiness.
Cadet Edward Smith 07-Apr-21 06:12 AM
He got some "food". And sat down to eat, about halfway through. He dozed off and was snoring quietly fork still in hand.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 07-Apr-21 06:21 AM
S'Kiv was standing at the entrance of the canteen and looking around. He saw someone sleeping in a chair and decided it was best to wake him. He walked slowly over and woke Edward. "I wouldn't sleep here. It can be dangerous. I don't think the guards want you sleeping all over the place."
Cadet Edward Smith 07-Apr-21 06:23 AM
"Hmm." He jolted awake and resumed eating his meal. "Was just... resting my eyes. How is S'Kiv since our last talk?"
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 07-Apr-21 06:26 AM
"I am well, but how are you? He was concerned about Edward. Someday this guy was going to get in real trouble.
Cadet Edward Smith 07-Apr-21 06:30 AM
"Mmm. Tired mostly. Get an hour or two of sleep here and there. Work twelve odd hours in between." Edward chuckled. "The floor does wonders to the muscles and back. Truly rejuvenating." He added sarcastically while finishing the last of his meal.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 07-Apr-21 06:36 AM
"I didn't sleep much myself but I can withstand that for some time. I have to go working after this. You should get some more sleep. It won't help you if you die from exhaustion."
Cadet Edward Smith 07-Apr-21 06:43 AM
"Perhaps, I am quite stubborn however. Maybe I'll get more sleep when I lay on the floor today when I get back to my cell." Edward scratched his chin in thought.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 07-Apr-21 06:44 AM
"Perhaps. What have you done since we last talked?"
Cadet Edward Smith 07-Apr-21 06:45 AM
"Sorting and conveyer work mostly. Nothing interesting. Yourself?"
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 07-Apr-21 06:49 AM
"Working on High Level Deconstruction.Eating. Sleeping. That's all someone can do around here."
Cadet Edward Smith 07-Apr-21 06:54 AM
"True." He nodded. "Well I'm gonna go attempt to sleep again. See you later, Mr. S'Kiv." He said standing to leave.
Lt. JG. S'Kiv 07-Apr-21 06:55 AM
S'Kiv nodded. "We will do so, I am sure of it. I hope you get some sleep." S'Kiv was standing and started walking towards the airlocks.
Lt. JG. Lihne Carter 07-Apr-21 02:26 PM
Lihne walked into the canteen, waiting her turn for the communal food being offered. Slowly she turned and moved to a seat, sitting down with a sigh and looking for anyone whom she knew.
Yallis Kress BOT 07-Apr-21 09:38 PM
The lady was basically thrown into the Canteen, her legs skidding across the floor with a squeak. The floor seemed to be visibly stained with other substainces. A product of a floor left uncleaned. The older woman paused for a moment to catch her breath, looking at the ground like it was some sort of broken mirror. Her hair was knocked back into the front of her face, losing its folded braid during the impact. With a chuckle the lady looked around, seeing the ghostly eyes of others staring at her. Her brows furrowed as she pushed herself onto her feet, wiping the soot and grime off her coat and pants before taking a set at a broken, worn down table in the corner. She loved seclusion, separation, it made her feel cold and distanced from others almost as if she was a rogue in the night. The lighting was null, giving off a eerie backdrop for her to look at. Walls seemingly stained with moss colored substances that complimented the brown stained corner of the table. One might consider the sight to be revolting.. but to the Denobulan, it was the only thing that made people scared to go near her. The spot gave her more time to plan, eat and scheme without being disturbed and that put a smile on her face.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 07-Apr-21 10:17 PM
The canteen, perhaps by way of some morbid irony, seemed to be her best bet. Its less horrendous equivalent had always been the Phoenix's own hub of activity, and Blanche found herself almost remorseful for avoiding the place so. Any recollection of the ship now brought nothing but melancholy, and she only hoped the phenomenon would fade in due time. She paused in the entryway, taking in the scene before her. Admittedly, Blanche was looking for someone she didn't recognise, neither by face nor medical record. As such, she scoured the canteen for a good moment, only to be drawn to one figure who seemed to have ostracised themselves rather explicitly. Perhaps she had struck gold. Or the means to land herself in a highly questionable social scenario. This was prison, after all; why not make the most of whimsical decisions? Sporting her best dazzling smile, the doctor forged a path to Yallis' table, opting to be encouraged by the Denobulan's own grin rather than perturbed by it. "Forgive me if I'm imposin'," she cooed, stopping just short of the questionably stained wall, "but I was wonderin' whether you might care for some company?" (edited)
Yallis Kress BOT 07-Apr-21 10:27 PM
Suprised by the rather sudden approach of the woman, seemingly as old as her. Yallis swiftly turned her head towards the direction of the voice, quite welcomed by her calm and optimistic tone that carried a sense of home. The Denobulan was known to start rumors about people, but until now she has never met a person who she directed a rumor to... theres a first time for everything she supposed. Her eyes started from the top of the womans figure, and dropped all the way to the bottom to look at her feet. At this point her stare seemed awkward and uncomfortable to some, just the like the place she was seated in. "Forgive me for the long pause. I just had to... look. Its not often that I am greeted by a person such as yourself. Judging by your character, your tone. I assume they placed you in a medical position of some sorts. Doctors usually carry a calm, welcoming tone which I quite admire." She said with a wide smile trying to match the same smile of the lady before her. However, the grin didnt last long before she dropped it, catching the eyes of the few onlookers passed. "You might want to sit down before something, unpleasent happens to you. The men in here can be pretty ravanous. But dont worry, the new folk are pleasant, its just the older ones that have succumbed to the prison life that you have to look out for dear." She stated, fluffing up her jacket to cover her appearance so that those people would stop looking their way.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 07-Apr-21 10:43 PM
Feeling suitably scrutinised, it was habitually that Blanche reached up to poof her hair. The notion of ravenous men left her more faraway than she'd have liked, wondering if her new acquaintance was referring to the likes of Jed. If that was the implication of ravenous, then—. No, the woman's want for discretion alluded to something much darker. Blanche followed her gaze, regarding the onlookers in question with wary eyes. Upon sitting as instructed, the conclusion was promptly reached that she'd struck gold. In a sense, at least. No use counting chickens, after all. Or was it eggs? Regardless, the woman's demeanour was as welcoming as she'd declared Blanche's to be, and as such, she was met with an appreciative smile from the medic once she'd settled. "Well, fancy that. I am a doctor, yes. Blanche Carlisle, ah—." She faltered, moving to preen her hair in that same ritualistic manner. "Well, I'm from the Phoenix, which is why I don't believe we've met thus far. Mind, I don't come in here much, but I don't suppose I need to explain why. It is rather unnervin', all these eyes. I've never much been one for food-halls, or the likes . . " she trailed off, self-aware just enough to warrant a sheepish gleam in pale blue eyes. "Thank you for the advice, it won't go amiss. I'm afraid you'll have to forgive me again; I went off ramblin' without even askin' for your name." (edited)
Yallis Kress BOT 07-Apr-21 11:19 PM
The woman placed her metal arm on the cheap fork beside her and began to shovel food into her mouth. Of course, this is the only meal of the day that the woman decides to eat. Everyday rations are the meals around these parts for breakfast, lunch and desert. But for dinner, its the real deal... The one time in the day where the food is at least prepared and replicated. "Yallis... but people just call me Kress I guess. I arrived here months ago and my ship was pitted when I stepped foot into this prison... I never saw it again, same goes for my Starfleet uniform and my personality for that matter." The woman's hair would always fall straight into her face. With every blow or shake of her head, it never seemed to move away, which made the Denobulan grumble. Her leather fur coat, seemingly designed for a man, would shed into her food. However the older woman did not mind that fact and blew the strands away from her meal before eating. After the meal was done, she turned her attention towards her arm, its metal coating showing through the thin case of sealent that was put on in the morning. "What happened to your crew was terrible miss Carlisle. Your ship, if you were wondering, crashed down just east of here.. I don't know how many survivors came here, but judging by the damage reports, i'd say your lucky."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 07-Apr-21 11:44 PM
Blanche eyed the woman's arm for a moment, pondering its coating. The same intrigue arose in her food, watched similarly for its contamination by way of Kress' coat. She shook her head gently, as if to dispel preconceptions — Yallis said she had been here for months. Blanche felt as though her stint of incarceration was beginning to take its toll already. The Denobulan's finalising sentiment was met with a solemn look of acknowledgement from the medic, who felt inclined to agree. Who had agreed, only earlier in the day. Luck had become a sorely relative phenomenon as of late, hadn't it? "I'd say so too, as . . uncomfortable as it feels. I'm awful sorry to hear you've been here so long," she tried, well aware of how insincere the notion might sound, despite being starkly the opposite. Blanche truly was sorry, and figured the woman's time here might render their woes all the more resonant. "I wonder—. Well, I take it you've spoken with other members of the crew. I suppose you've reached the conclusion that we're . . " It was then that she tried a knowing sort of look, hesitant to verbalise the sentiment outright. "Mildly restless here, to put it delicately." (edited)
Yallis Kress BOT 07-Apr-21 11:54 PM
"To be honest.. last time I saw a crew so desperate to escape, most of them died. I advise you to be careful with what you and your crew plan to do, or else you will wind up with a metal arm." She looked into the commander's eyes, reading her like a book but not understanding any of the words that were inside it. Her tone turned sincere as well as her facial expressions. Part of her wanted to talk more to this woman, she was so intruiged by the doctor's willingness to come by and sit down.. to have a chat. But Kress dismissed that thought right when it entered her brain. "A person named "Verne" came to my placement a few days ago asking for information, much like yourself. I assumed she told you about me, thats why you are here correct?" The woman said proudly, before looking at the doctor, her expressions unchanged. Embarrased, the Denobulans face flushed as she covered it with her leather glove. Eyes widened to its furthest extent, almost as if she saw a ghost. "If not, thats okay... I um, just assume that she would tell people about me.. Frankly, around here, people think of me as a bloodhound. But to be completely honest, I'm all bark and no bite if you catch my drift." She stated. (edited)
Commander Blanche Carlisle 08-Apr-21 12:13 AM
"Maggie?" Carlisle's head inclined to one side, and a look of bewilderment glazed over her features. Processing Kress' implication, and loath to cause the woman further reason for embarrassment, Blanche righted the expression almost as promptly as it had appeared. "Oh, no! I haven't spoken with Lieutenant Verne since arrivin' here, as a matter of fact. I . . well, in all honesty, I felt you might be able to help me." That sheepish air had come to tinge Blanche's demeanour yet again, refined enough to be demure. To combat the Denobulan's alarm, she allowed herself another smile, this one faintly apologetic. "I can assure you, you've hardly given me reason to think you a bloodhound. Like I said, I am tryin' to . . get my bearings, as it were, but I seem to have landed myself in good company in the process." Blanche's expression welcomed a shade of its usual warmth, paired with the soft lilt her voice had returned to. Again, the words spoken carried an unbridled sincerity; something about Yallis had set her at ease, even with the aforementioned eyes. "Truly, I appreciate your hospitality more than you could know. "
1
1
Yallis Kress BOT 08-Apr-21 12:27 AM
"Well I'm glad that I could offer it. Most people that need my help have to pay me first, its how the prison life works around here. But there is something about you, I can't really put my finger on it. You are just, different... theres no desparation, no plea from you. You come here asking for help without a speck of beg in your voice, like your wavering on the edge." The Denobulan admired the doctor for a moment, still day dreaming about the exact moments that they met.. Like it was some fantasy. Nobody had the urge to go to the lady with a metal arm, except her. She felt welcomed, but part of her did not want to hold on to that memory for long.. the thought of hope that this lady would come to her seat again and again could be destructive to the old womands brain. She chuckled for a moment, not letting her own stubborness block the thoughts out. Instead, releasing a smile for a moment before speaking out. "You need my help yeah? I can help you with whatever you need... I know people, who know people and if you need a hyperspanner I can get it for you. It will just take some time of course, that is if I dont get distracted by the fashionable merchandise along the way you see." She said jokingly, holding back a chuckle.
1
Commander Blanche Carlisle 08-Apr-21 12:53 AM
As if a weight of unimaginable description was lifted from her shoulders, Blanche heaved a sigh. Relieved, grateful, delighted beyond verbal comprehension. Whatever she felt, it was certainly refreshing. Comparably dreamy to the day's earlier desolation. The doctor's face didn't waste any time catching up to her actions; Yallis' offer earned her a suitably dazzling smile, and it took a lot for Blanche not to reach out and grasp Kress' hands in a warm display of gratitude. "Thank you, darlin'. From the bottom of my heart. Even if you don't have any answers for me, it means the world that you're willin' to listen regardless. I—." An airy bout of laughter disjointed the woman's speech, who subsequently shook her head. "I'm afraid I wouldn't have a hope in hell of makin' use of a hyperspanner. No, I was wonderin' whether . . well—." The laughter was no more, subsiding for a solemnity in pale eyes that was met in her newly hushed tone, however subdued. "We had children on board, Yallis, and they were separated from us when we arrived here. If there's anythin' you know about where they could be, what might've happened to them . . " (edited)
2
Yallis Kress BOT 08-Apr-21 01:09 AM
"The Iconians have a way of keeping information from the newbies. They want to keep the children a surprise almost. Usually, if one or more of them survive, they are put in this nursing facility and nurse them back to health. I'm not sure where that place is exactly, as I have never had a child myself... I can't really. But I can guarantee you that its around this area." She spoke, bowing her head at the mention of children. Poor things left without their parents to care for them.. its more horrible than death or inprisonment. The Iconians wanted them to live, for the sole reason of them finding out that their parents wont be for them anymore because they are either dead or stuck. "A Klingon couple arrived here a month ago. They had 5 children rumored to be in the nursing center but, the couple got themselves into trouble and wound up in a random solitary cell together, they have not gotten out since. Those children still believe that their parents are doing fine, still out there looking for them. Its what gives them hope." She shook her head opening up her coat for a moment to see what she had stored in there. Then the woman looked at Blanche with hope. "You want to get them out of there as soon as possible dont you?" She said with the cheesiest smile on her face.. like a kid who opened up their present on christmas day to find a toy that they wanted for so long.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 08-Apr-21 01:29 AM
“Why—,” at first, she sat there blinking. Astounded, with little reason to be. Given what they’d all seen, heard? Something so perversely sinister shouldn’t have come as a surprise. Still, Blanche’s countenance betrayed her inner turmoil, brows drawn to a furrow, lips poised in a pout. The Iconians’ motives were thoroughly obscure to Blanche, and posed a number of questions she wasn’t all too sure she could endure the answers of. One answer she had obtained, it seemed, was that they were alright. To the most basic, physical degree, the children were alright. Even healthier, perhaps, than they’d been upon arrival, if what Kress was saying was true. The effects of conditioning were a moot point if they were out of reach. As such, her look of puzzlement melted away, slowly but surely subsiding; relief took precedence, and it was than that the woman leant forward over the table in an ardent display of enthused determination. “Yes,” Blanche nodded firmly, opting to remain indifferent to the grin rather than query its implications. “More than anythin’. Is it doable?” (edited)
Yallis Kress BOT 08-Apr-21 01:41 AM
The woman hesitated for a moment. The sudden movement of the doctor caught her off guard as she leant in towards the Denobulan... Not knowing how to react, Yallis froze for a moment, confused as to why she was leaning in yet not whispering. Besides that point, there was nothing else that the woman could think of until she asked the question. "Anything is doable with the right supplies.." The Denobulan looked around the room, seeing the crowd form infront of her very eyes. This was high noon standards for dinner time.... where everyone came to crow around the tables like hogs. Too many people made Kress uncomfortable, but it benefited her because the guards from the Courtyards would often leave their posts to guard the canteen for a short period of time. "Why don't we take this "outside", I am not a huge fan of crowds. Especially when some people want to eat out up for dinner, if you know what I mean." The Denobulan said, tapping the table in a nervous flutter.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 08-Apr-21 02:17 PM
Had she been less caught up in the revelation, Blanche might've refrained from lunging forward in such a manner. She couldn't help herself; the news had conjured in her a glimmer of hope. Something so recently scarce, the doctor felt it only right to seize with both hands. She hadn't meant to startle Yallis, though, not by any means, and offered the Denobulan another apologetic iteration of a smile to compensate. "That might be better." It would, most definitely. Blanche bobbed her head, concurring. She too had noted the amassing crowd, even in her windswept state of enthusiasm. As such, her expression became thankful once again, and Carlisle rose from the table as inconspicuously as she could manage. "They don't seem to pay much mind to the courtyard durin' mealtimes," she observed, recalling Jedaiah's tour.
Yallis Kress BOT 08-Apr-21 04:48 PM
She looked at the doctor, returning the same apologetic smile back towards her. Her flush still lingered on her face, like a scar that never faded however her eyes receeded back to a cool and calm look. Her face was hot, she could feel her cheeks pulsating and the heat radiating off of it like a road on a hot summers day. One might consider her to be starstruck, but with her stubborness she choses to hide that factor. Making her self believe that she is calm and cool, given the situation they were currently in. The Denobulan woman stood up as well, looking around her, watching the crowd plow in like a stampede. It was not long before the whole place bursted into riot, making everything unseeable. But Yallis trained herself to memorize every entry way to another room. She extended her metal arm out, opting to refrain from giving the doctor a passing glance. Her focuse was lead elsewhere. "You might want to hold onto my arm. You can get lost in these kinds of riots." She stated.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 08-Apr-21 05:10 PM
That was slightly less than ideal. Or perhaps it wasn’t, allowing the pair the latitude to slip away unnoticed. Either way, it certainly made for an interesting shift in atmosphere. Blanche grimaced some, but felt confident enough in Yallis’ dexterity that she would emerge from the canteen in one piece. That said, she couldn’t help but notice Kress’ behavioural shift; the woman had become somewhat flustered, it seemed, and Carlisle found herself at a loss in regards to why. Had nobody felt inclined to approach the woman as she had, save for Maggie? Querying the notion only led to a feeling of indignation on the Denobulan’s part; an emotion that was unlikely to aid their departure from the canteen. Without hesitation, Blanche took the arm offered to her. Blue eyes scoured the space once again, less appeased by their findings this time around. “Thank you,” she chimed, barely audible over the raucous, “I’ll be right behind you.” Or that was the plan, at least.
1
Yallis Kress BOT 08-Apr-21 05:22 PM
Upon seeing that the woman had latched onto her arm, Yallis did not hesitate to barrel through the crowd. It was the only way, her body weaved through the stacks of men and women and people alike that placed themselves in the canteen like obstacles. The entrance to the courtyard was a few clicks away, which was convenient enough. Her fur coat tussled and tangled with every push that the Denobulan made. She often looked behind her to see if the doctor was okay... hoping that her, reckless behavior in this circumstance was understandable enough. Upon making it to the door, Yallis flung the entire thing open, smacking a huge, bulky Nausican in the face, who was currently being trampled on by other people wanting to get their food. She felt sympathy for the man, however that sympathy quickly faded when she realized that the Nausican was a person who didnt hold his end of the deal during a trade 2 months ago. With that change of thought, Yallis hid a chuckle before exiting the Canteen with the doctor.
Maladar Derf BOT 08-Apr-21 08:49 PM
[D] Maladar Derf was here now, crouched on top one of the tables, somehow managing to slurp nutrient paste, eyes darting around the room analytically.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 08-Apr-21 08:50 PM
Maggie walked into the room and smiled as she took her pips out of her jumpsuit. Before walking towards Derf. “Derf! I have items to trade!”
Maladar Derf BOT 08-Apr-21 09:04 PM

Maggie smiled as she walked towards a smaller more secluded area of the prison. “I have power cells to go along with that too.” She said with a small smirk. “Looks like...Tricorder ones?”￼

Maladar Derf BOT 08-Apr-21 09:09 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 08-Apr-21 09:14 PM

Maladar Derf BOT 08-Apr-21 10:08 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 08-Apr-21 10:17 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 08-Apr-21 10:27 PM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 08-Apr-21 10:29 PM

Maladar Derf BOT 08-Apr-21 10:45 PM
Derf leapt off the table and into an actual seat so he could tap his fingers on the table thoughtfully. "What kind?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 08-Apr-21 10:47 PM
Maggie looked at him just as thoughtfully. “A rifle of some sorts preferably.”￼
Maladar Derf BOT 08-Apr-21 11:41 PM
Derf thought that over for a weirdly long time, letting out a very elongated hum. "Phaser. Someone still needs to fix it. It won't go."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 08-Apr-21 11:54 PM
“I have someone I know that can do that. Just, keep it with you for now. Then I’ll bring someone to you to fix it.”
Maladar Derf BOT 09-Apr-21 12:08 AM
"Ehehehe." He did an evil twiddling motion with his hands that his writer doesn't know the name of. "And what do I get?"
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 09-Apr-21 12:09 AM
Maggie looked at Derf with a sigh. “Starfleet pips, Starfleet uniform once I get that phaser, power cells with the pips right now.”
Maladar Derf BOT 09-Apr-21 12:09 AM
Derf looked both ways, then reached into one pocket. Something clattered faintly. "Pips first."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 09-Apr-21 12:10 AM
Maggie reached out the pips to him with a sigh. “Here.”
Maladar Derf BOT 09-Apr-21 12:13 AM
Derf snatched the pips and slid two power cells over in a blindingly fast motion. "Starfleet items." He said mischievously. "I will make them go."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 09-Apr-21 12:14 AM
Maggie smiled as she looked at him. “I don’t want the cells. I meant I’m giving you these.” She said as she handed over two power cells. Placing them discretely in front of him. “This covers Maleb’s healthcare, and the tanks.”
Maladar Derf BOT 09-Apr-21 12:37 AM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 09-Apr-21 12:38 AM

Maladar Derf BOT 09-Apr-21 12:49 AM
"Eeeeeeeeegh." He said in what was definitely disgruntlement, before gleefully counting the pips with deep satisfaction.
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 04:07 AM
[D] Having gone back and gotten some sleep, Joe came for some ‘breakfast’ if you could even call it that. He sat in a more secluded part of the canteen to hopefully not draw too much attention to himself from the guards.
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 04:11 AM
[D] T'Svai arrived soon after, resolutely ignoring the ferengi-pakled perched on a table counting pips to himself and instead making a beeline for the ensign she'd spoken to earlier. She sat down with her tray of 'food'. "Ensign Tan."
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 04:15 AM
He looked up to see T’Svai and he immediately stood at attention. “Commander. Please, have a seat.” He motioned to the seat opposite of him.
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 04:16 AM
"At ease. We are not on duty." That was easily the worst possible euphemism for 'we are in prison' one could have possibly used. She sat anyway and started eating. "Have there been any developments?"
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 04:24 AM
He sat down and nodded. "Yes sir. I've acquired the Borg mobile regeneration unit and even a medical tricorder for the medics. I have also acquired information that Oharr has in his possesion 'the good medical supplies' that we can trade for in the future."
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 04:25 AM
Hm. Ensign Tan certainly worked fast. She made note of that and leaned foward. "Are you presently in possession of the mobile regeneration unit, and have you learned more about the tunnel system?"
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 04:27 AM
"Yes. It and the tricorder are with me right now. Regarding the tunnel systems, I have yet to truly explore them and Oharr was a bit too engrossed in the item I traded him to divulge any info regarding it. I'll see if I can learn more about it the next time I see him." (edited)
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 04:28 AM
T'Svai nodded firmly. "May I have it?" She asked in a hushed, intent voice, having already made the determination that she was going to track Amanda down at the earliest opportunity to hand it over.
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 04:31 AM
He nodded as he made sure the guards weren't looking before quickly handing both the device and the tricorder over to T'Svai. "I heard that Lieutenant Maleb was quite badly hurt. Lieutenant Verne asked me to get some painkillers for him."
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 04:42 AM
T'Svai somehow managed to slip the tricorder into her pocket and the regeneration device into her jumpsuit in one blindingly fast motion. "You have heard correctly. He is in low security, cell fifteen, block two." She really had been listening to everything. "Lieutenant Valar or Commander Yllescas may be able to assist in getting the medication to him."
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 04:44 AM
"Yes sir. but do you by chance know what kind of medication or equipment would he need ?"
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 04:46 AM
"I am uncertain. To my knowledge he was injured by an antiproton weapon and has experienced a certain degree of blood loss, likely exacerbated by present conditions. Analgesics, tri-ox compounds, and any form of rapid rehydration would likely prove beneficial, but it would be logical to consult a medic." She speculated, continuing to eat. "Oharr has evidently developed an extensive stash."
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 05:00 AM
He nodded yet again. "I'll see if I consult any of the medics regarding this. And yes, it would seem so. I've spotted improvised weapons among his possessions among other things that may prove useful to us." (edited)
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 01:11 PM
"I think it unlikely that improvised weapons will be truly effective against anyone other than the non-Herald overseers." T'Svai admitted. "There is a rumor that someone attempted to stab a guard, and if that had been successful, it appears likely that rumor would be spreading somewhat faster." She continued, thinking. "The tunnel system is a greater priority - though if anyone is able to convert improvised weapons into something useful, evidence suggests it would be you."

Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 01:22 PM
"Well that's quite risky, to say the least." If not suicide. He nodded and beamed proudly. "I'm honored that you still place so much confidence in my abilities even after the Phoenix's destruction, sir. It means a lot to me. I'll see what I can find out about the tunnels and if those improvised weapons will be of any potential use to us."
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 01:24 PM
"Primarily the tunnels." T'Svai emphasized. She did not, when all was said and done, enjoy weapons or the prospect of losing more crew to suicidal acts of would-be heroism. It simply helped to have options. She finished eating. "I believe I must report to my shift shortly."
Ensign Joseph Tan 09-Apr-21 01:31 PM

Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 09-Apr-21 07:30 PM

Maggie nodded as she looked at the party. “Right. We need to get people to scout the tunnels before we really do anything.￼”
Lt. JG. Lithop Howard 09-Apr-21 07:34 PM
"That sounds like a good idea. Not sure how much I'll be able to help with that, or even get to the ship when we find it though." Lithop added, sighing. "I'm kinda stuck in processing."
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 07:35 PM
"Additionally-" - and here she turned to make eye contact with Verne - "It would be unwise to take any actions that might endanger one's life. Lack of caution could prevent others from gathering information at a later time, and could compromise existing resources."
Ensign Cas Yardi 09-Apr-21 07:35 PM
She nodded. "I'm stuck in processing as well. But- there's something I was curious about." She said. "The prison is made of duranium, which is common in starship construction. I was talking with Karta and Ota about how there might be some sort of construction area here. If they melt down ships, they might use them to construct things." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 09-Apr-21 07:36 PM
Maggie softly sighed as she looked at T’Svai. “I’m aware sir, and I’m not going to make another mistake like it.”
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 07:37 PM
"It was a general statement." She held eye contact for another split second, then looked around at the others.
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 09-Apr-21 07:38 PM
"I volunteer to scout the tunnels I have the access to most places in the prison as a Mechanic." Malcolm piped up. "I believe they might use the raw materials for making new ships we do it often in the Federation though I bet they have their own citizens to make their ships. Prison workers are often saboteurs much easier to harm the enemy and get away with it if you are constructing something rather than disabling it."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 09-Apr-21 07:40 PM
"I volunteer to not go in the tunnels, because as much as I think I'm good at scouting, I have a promise to keep." They said quietly before forcing themselves to eat some of their 'food'. (edited)
5
Ensign Cas Yardi 09-Apr-21 07:42 PM
"I'd go in the tunnels if I could, but I don't think I can get away from processing." She added, sticking both hands in her pockets. She turned to Malcolm. "I'm not very well versed in engineering things, is there anything I should be looking for? I might be able to get some fuel from the incinerator, but I'm not sure."
Lt. JG. Dayton Finn 09-Apr-21 07:44 PM
"I volunteer to scout the tunnels, as well. But as Ensign Yardi stated, I have the same predicament." He piped up again, scratching his head a little bit.
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 09-Apr-21 07:45 PM
Maggie shook her head with a sigh. “I can try and get power cells for trading on my end. Otherwise, I can’t get into the tunnels.”
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 07:57 PM
T'Svai nodded. "We do not control our schedules. I will not organize patrols, nor encourage or discourage specific individuals from investigating. All I ask is that you be discreet, be cautious, and report your findings when possible. As for the processors and inventory workers - we will need food, water, and medical supplies. The specific type is up to your discretion. Improvised weaponry or power cells are acceptable. A tricorder would be ideal, if unlikely." She listed offhand. "Communication will be our largest obstacle."
Ensign Cas Yardi 09-Apr-21 08:18 PM
She nodded. "Right. I'll see what I can get my hands on." She replied, before a metaphorical light bulb went off in her head. "Oh, and- there are no cameras in the shower. That and the mattresses are good places for... our purposes."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 09-Apr-21 08:23 PM
Maggie nodded as she looked at Cas. “I’ll try and get power cells and what not though trade. Copy Cas, thank you for the intel.” She said with a small smile.
Lieutenant Malcolm Parsons 09-Apr-21 10:19 PM
"I have a few ideas where I can get my hands on such items. Also, lights would be good for scouting out the ship Since they most likely attempted to shut off the power to curtail the plant growth. We could set up a system similar to what the Pheonix had...the group chat. If I can get a few ops people to help with that also we will need power cells and a small transmitter it doesn't need to send it far heck even a Padd would have the transmitting power to send a signal a few feet." Malcolm suggested he knew given the time the Engineering and OPs team could figure it out.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 09-Apr-21 10:35 PM

Ensign Cas Yardi 09-Apr-21 10:36 PM

Ensign Nedras 09-Apr-21 11:09 PM
Over at his table on the other side of the canteen Nedras smiled into his nutrient paste, having heard the mention of a signal getting out, but otherwise continued to passively listen. (edited)
Commander T'Svai 09-Apr-21 11:12 PM
T'Svai nodded. "We will merely have to rely on word of mouth. pending Ensign Tan's findings, I propose we set the time and date of our escape to lunchtime in two days." She guessed. "If we decide on a time in advance, there will be no need to signal the start of the plan. With that in mind, has anyone been able to locate the children?"
Lt. Cdr. Amanda Higgins 09-Apr-21 11:55 PM
[D] Amanda dragged herself into the canteen. She was really having a rough time, and it showed, as cybernetics had started to shit down slowly. At the moment, her left eye was all but useless, her vision blurry and causing a massive headache. She didn't even bother going to a replicator. She just sat down at a table and put her forehead on it, face down. She hadn't really wanted to die, but it seemed like that was going to be the case sooner rather than later.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 10-Apr-21 12:06 AM
Blanche entered tailing Amanda, her arrival coinciding with T'Svai's mention of the nursery. How delightfully convenient! Her hair had since been righted after the mob, and it was evident the doctor was feeling a little less averse to being perceived in orange — perhaps it had something to do with her recent findings. She approached the gathered group, supposing that lingering at its edge would only look all the more unnatural. "Afternoon, everybody. I, ah, hope I'm not interruptin' anythin'."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 10-Apr-21 12:10 AM
Maggie shook her head as she looked at Blanche entering with a smile. “You aren’t Blan-Commander Carlisle. We were just uh..planing.”
Commander T'Svai 10-Apr-21 12:11 AM
T'Svai held up a ta'al and nodded. "We were discussing where to find the children."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 10-Apr-21 12:22 AM
"Oh?" Maggie's smile was duly matched, although Blanche had yet to rid her expression of concern entirely. "I believe I might be able to help with that," her voice dropped considerably, then. "An inmate provided me with a PADD after I enquired as to the children's whereabouts. It's full of directions — admittedly a little convoluted, but one set in particular is supposed to lead to a nursery of sorts. The inmate who gave me the PADD believes it's likely the children are bein' kept there, and ought to be in perfect physical condition." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 10-Apr-21 12:23 AM
Maggie nodded as she watched Blanche, returning the smile. “Right. Okay, that’s good to know. Is there a way in they highlighted?”
Commander Blanche Carlisle 10-Apr-21 12:28 AM
She nodded, sending her ponytail swinging. "Followin' a step-based pattern, yes. It's a little vague for my likin', but I suppose I can appreciate why. There was nothin' much else noted except that entry would require medical clearance; I'm unsure as to whether it's guarded, unfortunately. I'd like to hope it wouldn't be, given its location isn't supposed to be common knowledge amongst inmates, but that may just be wishful thinkin' on my part."
Ensign Cas Yardi 10-Apr-21 12:42 AM
She flicked her eyes between Maggie, T'Svai, and Blanche, who she had never actually seen before. "Surely someone can't just... walk right out with the children." She turned and addressed Blanche. "Do you have any sort of protection if there are guards... ma'am?" The 'ma'am' felt a bit tacky, but she didn't know how high this woman's rank was. It was most definitely higher than hers.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 10-Apr-21 12:58 AM
Cas' enquiry earned her a warmly dry smile from Blanche, preceded by a sigh that suggested no, she did not. "I'm afraid the chances of me holdin' my own against an Iconian guard are rather . . slim. I won't lie and claim I'd be comfortable facin' a regular one, for that matter. Any backup in that regard would be greatly appreciated; even if we're only able to scout the facility out, it would be more manageable as a team effort."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 10-Apr-21 01:01 AM
Maggie nodded as she looked at Blanche. Putting her hands in her lap before looking to T’Svai. “Perhaps we could get you another medical officer? Because even though I would love to help protect Blanche. Not many of us have the luxury of even having the potential opportunity￼ to go in that room.”
Commander T'Svai 10-Apr-21 01:02 AM
T'Svai gave it some thought, then nodded. "Lieutenant Ramat'iklan is capable of shrouding for a period of six minutes and forty-eight seconds. He is capable of combat and has medical clearance. It would be logical for him to accompany you." She suggested.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 10-Apr-21 01:09 AM
At that, Blanche nodded curtly, smile intact. It certainly would be logical, her prior grievances with the officer notwithstanding. Carlisle was, ironically, well aware of Ramat'iklan's aptitude for combat. Who would've thought she'd come to seek comfort in such knowledge. "Agreed, I'd be more than happy with the Lieutenant's assistance. I'll present him with the plan as soon as possible, and see if he's able to discern anything from the directions I might've missed." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 10-Apr-21 01:11 AM
Maggie nodded as she sat back a bit. Rolling her shoulders with a soft sigh. She still needed to give him a good talking to from The Entity. “Right, okay good. Once Joe-Ensign Tan gets back. We might hopefully be able to get a plan then.”

The scrapes had a pattern to them, if anyone was watching - two short, pause, one long, one short, pause, three short, one long. INV. If anywhere had tricorders, it would no doubt be storage, where the inventory clerks worked. (edited)
Commander T'Svai 10-Apr-21 01:22 AM

She opened her mouth to speak before closing it again. She swallowed any words she was thinking of saying, her throat thick with guilt about pushing Maggie about it in the rec room. We all- you know we all care about you and will support whatever decision you- and Shar- make."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 11-Apr-21 01:26 AM

Ensign Cas Yardi 11-Apr-21 01:30 AM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 11-Apr-21 01:32 AM

Ensign Cas Yardi 11-Apr-21 01:51 AM

"I really am sorry." She repeated, not entirely sure what to say otherwise. "I'm sure you can still talk about it with Sara, she'll probably have great advice for you. Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 11-Apr-21 02:07 AM

4
Ensign Cas Yardi 11-Apr-21 02:28 AM

Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 11-Apr-21 02:33 AM
Maggie nodded softly as she looked at Cas. All but clinging to Cas’s body as she just sat on the floor. “Right, and I still want to be there for her. I just...I don’t think we were cut out for marriage together.”
Ensign Cas Yardi 11-Apr-21 02:57 AM
She took a deep breath and felt her cheeks growing warm- not with delight, but more convoluted mixture of shame and helplessness. She didn't know what to do to help Maggie, not really, but she had to try. "And that's okay. Really. Sometimes things just... don't work out, and sometimes it takes something like this to help you realize that. You can still be in her life."
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 11-Apr-21 03:00 AM

Ensign Cas Yardi 11-Apr-21 03:18 AM
She tried not to focus on that, because by that logic all of her other friends and her dad thought she was dead, and that was not... an ideal concept. Another emotion for the bottle. "That's why we're going to get out, right? Our plan is good, we're going to pull it off and be out of here in no time. I promise." (edited)
Lt. JG. Copernicus King "Oh you can hardly tell the difference. A lot of them taste and have the texture of meat. It's really not that bad." He looked around again and sighed, "I wonder if anyone could give us an update of the plans." He said quietly.
Ensign Jack Kane 11-Apr-21 08:50 AM
