Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 11-Apr-21 10:12 AM
Maggie laughed quietly as she looked at Cas. Hugging her close. “Yeah. And I’m sure they’re going to split the crew up. Send us to other ships.”￼
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 11:40 AM
She entered, quick to seat herself at a table so as to avoid lingering. Blanche folded her hands neatly atop its surface, declining to ponder the hygiene in doing so. Figuring Ramat would appear sooner rather than later, the doctor awaited his arrival.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 11:42 AM
Was it any surprising that Rams right on schedule? Er, the rudimentary schedule that exists in a place like this for the endeavor they were about to undertake. He acknowledged her with a simple nod upon approaching her table. "The directions lead outward from here, sir?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 11:46 AM
On the very verge of cringing, it was by some miracle that the doctor managed to refrain. He'd meant no harm, of course, but 'sir' felt entirely foreign given their circumstances. Instead, Blanche met Ramat with her usual warm smile, which faltered only momentarily as she paused to recall the directions in question. "Mornin'. Yes, they do, hold on—," she closed her eyes briefly, envisioning the sequence. "Canteen, ten steps forward, one step left. Open the door, twelve steps forward, two steps right . . . open the door. Slightly archaic, I'm aware."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 11:51 AM
Ramar blinked in surprise. Ten steps forward, one step left, open the door...? Were they being sent on a very high-stakes, convoluted treasure hunt with the risk of certain death by antiproton fire? Well... yeah, they were. Kind of. "Archaic is one way to put it, I believe. Nonetheless if the directions serve the purpose they were intended for I have no complaints. Shall we get started on... tracing the route? We both know time is of the essence." That was the term, right? Tracing the route? (edited)
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 11:59 AM
Her initial answer came in the form of a curt nod, and Blanche rose from the table. "It might serve us well savin' any complaints for later," she mused dryly, brushing down her jumpsuit. "I'm afraid those directions are all we've got to go by, alongside the fact medical clearance is required to enter. Supposedly, the Iconians are set on nursin' any children captured back to physical health; frankly, I dread to imagine their motives for doin' so. As such, we'll have to be incredibly careful."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 12:03 PM
"Indeed we must be. In the same thread I believe pondering the Iconians' intentions for keeping them in good health is also best saved for when we have secured their safety and well-being - though with context I believe they can only be sinister." Ramat said plainly, turning and beginning to make his way to the exit. The sooner the two of them got this operation over with the easier the rest of the plan would be afterwards. (edited)
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 12:10 PM
The Jem'hadar's finalising comment left Blanche with a poorly veiled grimace. Nonetheless, she was hot on Ramat's heels, newly aware of her footsteps. Thoroughly aware, actually, and to such an extent that she had to remind herself to look where she was going. That in itself was somewhat of an enigma, wasn't it? This entire ordeal was bordering on a morbid goose chase. "That was about ten steps, wasn't it?" She enquired, voice low and considerably dubious.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 12:13 PM
"Yes. One to the left and open the door." Ramat walked ahead of her, opening the metal door in front of him. "Twelve more forward?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 12:20 PM
"Twelve more forward," she affirmed quietly, casting a brief glance backwards into the canteen. Hopefully, the general flow of inmates passing through the area would make for a less . . noticeable departure.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 12:28 PM
Twelve forward. Ramat walked forward and looked to the right, spying yet another door. "Two right and open the door?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 12:32 PM
"That's right." She couldn't help the slight frown that had settled upon her features, still following closely behind the lieutenant. "At least, accordin' to the directions it is. I suppose there's only one way of findin' out."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 12:33 PM
One way of finding out. One way of finding out if the information was accurate - or if they'd been hoodwinked. Ramat placed a hand against the door and stepped through.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 11-Apr-21 12:35 PM
[D]Ramat faceplanted into the stiff door. It was clear that it hadn't been opened for a long time.
5
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 12:38 PM
Ignoring the brief sting that was slowly spreading up his nose, Ramat stared at the door in disbelief, looking around for a control panel of some kind.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 11-Apr-21 12:40 PM
[D]There was no control panel, not even a handle, but when Ramat collided with it it had moved ever so slightly. (edited)
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 12:43 PM
"Are you alright?!" She had flinched upon the collision, and subsequently cast the officer a look of concern. "It budged a little," Blanche noted quietly, "but I don't advise headbuttin' it again. I'd prefer you remained conscious, Lieutenant."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 12:45 PM
"Yes, sir." Had he felt the door give a little when he (accidentally) collided with it? Yeah. He had. He pushed on the door like one might a regular wooden door on hinges as an experiment.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 11-Apr-21 12:51 PM
[D]The heavy metal door started to grind open.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 12:55 PM
Although she probably possessed less than ten percent of Ramat's physical strength, Blanche stepped forward so as to help him in pushing the door further. If she ended up needing another rhinoplasty afterwards, so be it.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 12:56 PM
Ramat looked back at Blanche with a slightly concerned expression. Only slightly. Being unafraid of horrible death probably helped with the look. "The door seeems to be long unused, Commander. Perhaps the children were transported directly inside the room. Or perhaps..." He didn't need to say the rest. There was no time. He pushed on the door with more strength.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 11-Apr-21 01:03 PM
[D]The door finally swung open, revealing the #nursery behind it.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 01:10 PM
Blanche didn't allow herself to ponder the thought, eyes widening as the door finally submitted to their efforts. "Speculatin' won't do us any good," she noted quietly, retrieving the tricorder from her pocket. Voice still barely above a whisper, Blanche set to starting it up. "I'm goin' to try to scan for lifesigns, give us some idea of what we're walkin' into. Can you see anythin' in there?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 01:15 PM
Ramat peered through the crack they'd opened.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 11-Apr-21 01:17 PM
[D]There was no light in the room at all. Anyone's best guess would be that it was bedtime.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 01:17 PM
"No." Ramat replied. "The lights seem to be off. If there are children in there I would expect that they have been made to go to bed."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 01:27 PM
"The last thing we want is to alarm them," Blanche initiated a scan for lifesigns, glancing briefly up from her tricorder only to be met with the darkness described. "Establishin' the children's physical condition is only one hurdle. Young as they are, they're highly impressionable, and I expect the Iconians will have exploited that in one way or another." (edited)
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 01:28 PM
"No doubt." Ramat squinted, attempting to see if he could spot anything at all in the dark.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 11-Apr-21 01:30 PM
[D]Nothing, the room was totally pitch black, save for a dim night light in the corner.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 01:33 PM
"There is a night light, dimly lit, in the corner." He reported further. "Perhaps I could shroud and enter the room to turn the lights back on?" (edited)
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 01:41 PM
"Perhaps, but we risk startlin' the children and potentially alertin' the guards of our presence. You might be better leavin' the lights for now and just takin' a look as is."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 01:43 PM
"Six minutes and forty three seconds." Ramat answered. "That is the longest time I can stay shrouded. They will notice nothing, not even a shadow, as I move about the room. I believe it will be enough?"
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 01:51 PM
"It's our best bet," she tried a reassuring smile, the result mildly strained. "I'll be right here. Perhaps you ought to take the tricorder with you, unless it would remain visible? I'm afraid my knowledge on the logistics of shroudin' leaves a lot to be desired." (edited)
Lt. JG. Maggie Verne 11-Apr-21 01:58 PM
[D] Maggie had slipped out of the canteen.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 02:01 PM
"As your people say, commander, in and out. I will be careful." Ramat nodded. "I believe that would be wise as well. The tricorder will also remain hidden - a Jem'hadar's shroud conceals even objects he is direct contact with. Of course if I let go of it it will become visible again. Which shall not happen." Or if I have to fight, he didn't add. Jem'hadar unfortunately could not fight shrouded. (edited)
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 11-Apr-21 02:11 PM
[D]The tricorder scans showed twenty young life signs, in a range of species along with a couple of animal lifesigns thrown in as well.
8
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 02:15 PM
Blanche nodded, and looking down at the tricorder, became wide-eyed all over again. "Twenty life signs," she recounted, "and it looks as though they're keepin' some of the pets here, too." Returning her gaze to Ramat, she handed the device over as promised. "You've got this, Lieutenant. Just don't go hurtlin' into any more doors and you'll be perfectly fine."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 02:26 PM
Pets? The crew's surviving pets were being kept inside, too? For a brief moment his scaly face lit up in pleased surprise as he accepted the tricorder. Matr. His cockatiel. Could he be alive? Oh, the bird must have been so stressed or contact calling non stop if he was. Nonetheless he was forced to put the feeling aside. His priority was the children's wellbeing. His fingers closed tight around the device. Time to get to work. He hadn't shrouded in... eleven years. Performing the act should've been like flexing a finger that'd gone slightly stiff, easy but not too easy - but owing to years of nonusage he had to take a few seconds to try and remember how - but the familiar buzzing feeling of the organ in his side working to cover his body in the di'teh was soon evident. From somewhere below his upper chest ripples of light seemed to spread, radiating throughout his body, painting his form away bit by bit, leaving nothing but the wall behind him visible save a barely perceptible distortion surrounded by a vaguely humanoid hazy line. Then the distortion moved, slinking into the nursery - and was gone. (edited)
4
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 02:33 PM
It was an absurd phenomenon, and Blanche felt the irrational urge to blink as though she had imagined it. Not dissimilar to the past two weeks, it remained very much tangible. Casting the occasional glance backward, wary of surveillance, Blanche remained at the nursery's entrance.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 03:02 PM
Ramat's shroud expired just as he exited the nursery and closed the door - and the familiar lurching in his stomach came. He stumbled forward, now fully visible, taking a large gasp of air. His limbs felt like sacks of stone attached to his body...
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 03:06 PM
Alarmed by the officer's sudden reappearance, Blanche leapt into action. She surged forwards in the hopes of supporting Ramat, lest he fall properly and injure himself. That, and it may well render all his earlier sneaking around redundant. "Are you alright?" Was Blanche's first enquiry, who'd taken a gentle hold of his shoulder.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 03:09 PM
"The... side effects... of shrouding without dependency on ketracel." He growled back weakly. Mostly because it took some effort. "The children are alive and well - the oldest is asleep nearest to the door and the youngest at the furthest end. Also, the crew's pets are alive and well. Including my cockatiel."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 03:19 PM
The news elicited a sigh of relief from the doctor who, once certain Ramat could support himself, stepped backwards to allow him some space. "Thank god. We ought to let the others know as soon as possible. Of course, there is still the question of the children's mental condition, but confirmation that they're physically sound is a step forward nonetheless. Good work, Lieutenant." (edited)
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 03:29 PM
"Indeed." Ramat steadied himself against the wall with a short gasp. "The canteen or courtyard? I expect that they will be meeting there to discuss..."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 03:35 PM
"I'm sure we'll come across them one way or another in retracin' our steps," Blanche offered, unable to keep from regarding Ramat with concern. "We need to get you sat down, too. Six minutes is deceivingly long."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 03:37 PM
"Agreed." Ramat struggled to his feet and began slowly retracing their steps. Ten forward, one left. Open. Twelve forward, two right, open. Okay. He could remember that...
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 03:48 PM
"I'm glad to hear about your cockatiel," Blanche chimed, adjusting her speed to match that of Ramat's. She continued to ramble on, in the hopes it might relieve the Jem'hadar's focus from his discomfort. "It's odd, isn't it? The idea of a parrot in prison."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 03:50 PM
Ramat smiled. Tired, slightly pained, but whatever, he wasn't going to hide the fact that he'd been glad to see his pet again and the world would probably explode before he did. "In a sense. He is in good health, however. Also with him were a frog, lieutenant Jex's lizard and a cat. I'll- I'll be sure to inform her the next time I see her."
Commander Blanche Carlisle 11-Apr-21 03:53 PM
The mention of a cat piqued Blanche's interest, but she promptly dispelled her excitement. One cat out of potential hundreds did not bode well for Dolly, and now was not the time for dwelling on such dreary matters. "Oh? I'm sure she'll be delighted," she smiled in turn, and it wasn't long before they were back where they started. "It looks as though you might've been right about the courtyard."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 11-Apr-21 03:57 PM
"Indeed." Ramat nodded to her and went on ahead, albeit somewhat unsteadily.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 06:48 PM
[D] Hesria had moved back to the canteen after the meeting had ended, since eating was not, in fact, optional.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 06:50 PM
[D] Alyx, although having previously eaten, joined Hesria at her table. They still had a bit of rec time left so they wanted to take the oppertunity to be with someone they knew.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 06:51 PM
"I'm glad we have something more concrete in place now," she whispered to Alyx as they sat down next to her, "I'm sorry I didn't get a chance to tell you about the... personal accessibility of my cell. I promise I'll stay just as safe the second time around, okay?"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 06:58 PM
They nodded in agreement. "It's fine, really." They said reassuringly. "Life is kinda hectic right now so I don't expect you to keep me constantly updated. I have to admit I did get anxious when I heard that you had done what you did, but I mean... What I guess I want to say is that I trust you to do what you need to do, both because you're a member of Starfleet like the rest of us, but also because I know you care about everyone here. I trust you to do the right thing-- I just don't trust the guards enough to know you're safe." They said quietly. "We're in a prison, not a cushy Starfleet ship, so there's constant threats and I just can't ever assume you're safe, or anyone else is safe, so the only time I know you're safe is when I can actually see you, you know? I'm sorry, I'm probably going on way too much right now..." They said quietly, getting quieter near the end. "My anxiety hasn't calmed down at all since this all started."
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 07:05 PM
"Hey, don't apologize, I'm always happy to listen to your concerns, promise. Honestly, I'd be shocked if you said your anxiety was getting better in here; I don't think anyone's mental health has been helped by present circumstances. I know it's all a bit of a gamble right now, but I'm doing everything I can to get us out of here safely and I don't intend to change that anytime soon," she said warmly, hoping to be as comforting as possible.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 07:15 PM
They reached their hand out and gently took Hesria's empty one before responding, giving her a slight smile as they did. "I know you are, and I appreciate it so much. I hope everyone else appreciates it too. Without your skills what we want to do might not be as easy to accomplish." They said quietly. "I was actually thinking briefly about promotions and commendations that might happen when we get out, and honestly if you don't get something I'm gonna be very confused."
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 07:19 PM
"Oh, gosh, I don't need anything. Anyone with my skillset would do the exact same thing in my position; it's not bravery, it's common sense." She shook her head softly and smiled. "I appreciate it, though. Your approval means more to me than an extra pip on my collar. Besides, it would be weird to out-rank my department head!"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 07:44 PM
"Yeah that's true... But if this works everyone involved will have technically saved a lot of lives. No recognition would seem kinda off to me is all. Like I might have saved your life in the Ops Hub by getting you beamed out during the attack, and other people probably did the same throughout the ship, but that's so minor in comparison with you and the others getting us out of a war prison, you know? Even if you just get a 'well done' I'll be happy because that means you work will have been acknowledged." They said quietly and honestly.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 07:54 PM
"Maybe they can give me a nice, shiny medal and we'll call it a day, yeah?" She grinned broadly, putting one arm around them in what was becoming a familiar and comfortable hug. Was this what it was like to be a parent? She'd always considered herself not made for such things, but honestly, this was... nice. Apparently prison is the ideal place to think about major life changes and goals. "I don't like to be the center of attention anyway. Besides, you definitely deserve a medal for keeping a clear head in the ops hub!"
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 08:11 PM
Alyx smiled again when Hesria hugged them, and once again it reassured and comforted them in what was a very stressful environment. "If by keeping a clear head you mean swearing a lot of and trying to stab an intruder to death, then yeah, I did." They said with a slight chuckle, trying not to dwell too much on that day. "But honestly I just did my job. As much as I'm the Quartermaster, I also took other Ops training and that included being backup security." They said simply, before pausing for a moment to think of what they wanted to say next. "I was on the bridge soon after the drill started, and-- I have to admit, I had a heads up about it, so I wasn't worried, at least not to start with... I took it seriously, and I ended up going down to clear the classroom of the holographic intruders and make sure no kids were in there during the drill, and to reassure them if they weres scared. But then I was called to the hub-- And then the Iconians boarded during the drill, so we didn't realise in time..." The longer they talked, the quieter they got. "Why did that drill have to happen..." They said, almost at a whisper now.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 08:29 PM
"I know. The timing... it was horrible. I don't think I've fully allowed myself to process everything yet-- I've been pushing all my feelings aside in order to deal with the present. Post-escape, well. Shore leave will help, but I think also some therapy sessions will be self-mandated. What about you? What's the first thing you want to do when we get out of here? First on my list is calling my parents. Then my siblings. Then, like, two friends from the Academy-- assuming nothing has happened to them," her face darkened for a moment, "And then... shore leave. Although I'm sure we'll all be getting shore leave after this."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 08:43 PM
"Honestly-- I'm going home. It's all I want to do right now. Go home, be with my parents, be with Þuríður. I'll probably end up visiting my old hometown counsellor if Starfleet's are busy. If you want to go on shore leave to earth I can recommend a few places. And hey, my parents' have a spare bedroom if you wanna stay with us for a bit." They said, simply wanting to be as supportive as possible for Hesria. They could tell this was probably gonna hit her hard once it was all over. "Although Iceland might be a little colder than you might be used to." They added, letting out a slight chuckle after they did.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 10:10 PM
"With a name like 'Iceland', I'm already shivering!" she joked, laughing, "But I might take you up on that at some point. I do want to visit home, too, but not for the whole shore leave. I'll want some time to myself, I think. I need to... sort out some things. A lot of things, I guess. Trauma from this, of course, but... Other things, as well." Unbidden, the memory of Nedras kissing her in processing surfaced, which she immediately dismissed with a shake of her head. Maybe she would ask for a ship transfer after this-- it would be so awkward to be on the same crew as him, knowing what she knew about Vorta. But then she'd be leaving Alyx... and she didn't want to do that, either.
5
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 10:37 PM
They nodded, completely understanding everything she said. “Yeah— I’m sure a lot of people are gonna have some form of trauma or another from this... But whatever these ‘other things’ are, I’m sure you’ll be able to figure it all out, even if it takes a while. And you know you can always talk to me or a counsellor about it, whatever it is.” They said, giving her hand a gentle squeeze to try and reassure her. Alyx didn’t need to be an empath to know that Hesria had a lot of emotions flowing through her, and almost none of them were actually positive. She tried to remain positive but they knew she was only doing it as a coping mechanism, and to try and reassure them. It was obvious. It might be time for them to start being the ultra-supportive half of this friendship.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 10:55 PM
"I don't want to burden you with all my problems, hun," she said softly, squeezing their hand back. "I appreciate the offer, but... I just know some of it really is going to take a counsellor. QItlha died in my arms, I just... That's heavy stuff to process, you know? And I'm having to deal with my brain being... I don't know how to put this, but I'm having emotional thoughts and feelings that are totally inappropriate given the circumstances. I wonder if it's stress-motivated..." (edited)
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 11:01 PM
They nodded understandingly as she spoke, before responding quietly. “You’ve been helping me so much with mine, It’s only fair that I help you with yours. Even if you don’t talk to me about them I can still help by just being here for you...” They paused for a moment before continuing. “I don’t know how you’re feeling because I’ve never experienced what you have, and I hope I never do, but I can guess and yeah, it is heavy— But you don’t have to carry all of it by yourself. And— I think I might know what these emotions and feelings you’re referring to are, and all I can say is that you shouldn’t jump to any conclusions about them.” They said, all the while looking Hesria directly in the eyes.
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 11:03 PM
She raised an eyebrow at that. "Do you now?" This was certainly an easier topic of conversation than the bundle of emotions she'd bottled up in the wake of their ship's destruction and the crew's subsequent capture. Besides, she hadn't properly talked to anyone about Nedras yet, not really. Maybe it would help her sort through the feelings. "What am I referring to, then? Just so we're on the same page." She smiled to make sure they knew she didn't mind this line of thought.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 11-Apr-21 11:47 PM
“The tension between you and that Vorta. Either I’m wrong, or...” They paused for a second, figuring out how to word what they wanted to say. “...Well let’s just say that even though I’m single, I’m not blind to certain kinds of potentially awkward emotions.” They said, trying to not force anything out of Hesria that she didn’t want to talk about. “There’s clearly something between you to, but I don’t quite know to what level.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 11-Apr-21 11:55 PM
Well, that was pretty straightforward. More than she expected from Alyx, to be sure. Aaaaaand there was the heat in her cheeks again, dammit. She poked at the bowl of gruel in front of her while she attempted to organize her thoughts into something coherent. "I wouldn't say there's anything between us. He's... well, he's a Vorta, and from... what little research I've done-- and yes I did some, before, on the Phoenix-- he's not capable of, well, anything. Love, romance, attraction. He said as much to me as well, that he doesn't find anything attractive or have a concept of anything being aesthetically pleasing. So, I thought okay, there's a spark but I can just... ignore it, right? Well, then he smuggled this PADD to me and... and in order to prevent the guards from seeing him pass it, he... he kissed me." She buried her face in her hands and sighed. "So all my emotions just tumbled right back out into the open and they won't go away and it's horrible timing and even if we weren't stuck in an Iconian prison there's nothing I could do about it."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Apr-21 12:07 AM
“Well honestly... I’m not entirely sure you’re right, or him. I think, being as he’s a Vorta, he doesn’t actually realise what he feels. I mean, he could feel something, or nothing, or just not feel something yet. He might not know, and you certainly don’t because you’re not an empath.” They said simply. “All I can really say is that yes, this is frankly shit timing for anything of the sort, but you’ll have more than enough time to figure all of this out when we’re where we belong, and he will as well, even if he takes longer. You might be right, he might not feel anything, but that also might change. I haven’t studied Vortas, but whatI do know is that most study material is probably overly bias with one perspective and opinion. No one expected Jem’Hadar to live normal, modern lives, and yet they now can and do. I think you, and him, just need to be honest, and open with eachother. Patience, and communication, is the key to any relationship, even friendship.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 12-Apr-21 12:25 AM
"It's a lot of what ifs to put my heart on the line like that, though. I've never done a serious relationship-- everything has been flings and one night stands. I don't like to be tied down, I like freedom. It's a relic of my childhood, I know, but... Now I'm forty five and I start thinking maybe I want something long term and my heart... does this? It'd be easy to, you know, one and done, right? But now that I want something like a real relationship and my heart settles on a freaking Vorta? Are you kidding me?" Hesria shook her head and laughed. "It would be just my luck, I suppose."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Apr-21 12:33 AM
They chuckled a little when Hesria did, having previously just been nodding along with what she had been saying. “Nothing is impossible in this day and age. But— I think you need to just take your time with how you’re feeling. It could change, it could just be this prison crap messing with you. You need to give yourself time to think in a safe and calming environment, one where you’re free to take as much time as you like to do whatever you want to do; Not here. You’ll figure it out in time, and he will as well— whatever it is to him, anyway. Change is a part of life, and so is sometimes accepting that what you want can’t be a thing.” They said honestly, before chuckling slightly. “You know what’s kinda funny? In a good way, that is... I’m twenty two and I’m giving you life advice. You think it’d be the other way around.” They said light-heartedly, smiling a bit as they did. “I mean, not that I mind it, of course.” (edited)
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 12-Apr-21 12:48 AM
She smiled at that and hugged them again. "No, something I've always been a firm believer in is that life advice can come from anyone at any time, and it's foolish to not seek it from someone just because they're a different age or race or whatever. You won't always get the advice that you want, or need, and sometimes it won't be applicable at all, but it's never going to hurt you to listen to it. I think a lot of folks, as they get older, they sort of just forget about being young and assume the next generation doesn't know anything, but that's not true. Being young doesn't mean you can't give good advice. All of that to say, I do agree with you about prison messing with my head. That seems to be the most likely, most logical answer to this. It's not like I know Nedras very well. Just because he's... you know, generally attractive-- to me, at any rate. I mean, and we had a spark when we talked, on the Phoenix. I think. Anyway, none of that necessarily means anything, you know? It could all be heightened by this incredibly stressful situation and I'll probably go back to normal Hesria once we're out of here."
4
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Apr-21 01:17 AM
They smiled when Hesria hugged them again, before yet again nodding along with what she said. “People can find other people attractive without being in love with them... And that spark could quite easily have been you two getting along very well. I had a spark of sorts when I first met Þuríður. It could all just be your emotions colliding and mashing together because of the stress and trauma you’ve been through and are still going through... There could still be something neither of you have properly realised exists, and to what extent, but only time will tell.” They said gently and honestly. “Everything will make sense in the end, I can guarantee you that.”
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 12-Apr-21 01:48 AM
"I sure hope so. I guess we'll find out-- and I do intend to make it out of here to see what happens," she said confidently, her brightest smile plastered across her face. "I'm going to head to my shift but it was lovely talking with you. Stay safe, okay?" Hesria hugged them once again and pressed a quick kiss to the top of their head before standing. "Be ready."
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Apr-21 01:57 AM
They nodded in agreement, glad to see her smiling again, as they stood up as well and hugged her back. “I’ve enjoyed talking with you too. You stay safe as well, and you better damn well believe I’ll be ready.” They said confidently, trying to ignore their anxiety.
4
Lieutenant Hesria Valar 12-Apr-21 02:11 AM
Hesria was escorted from the canteen to processing to begin her next shift.
Ensign Alyx Morgan 12-Apr-21 01:11 PM
They were also escorted out, but they went back to their cell briefly before working.
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 02:30 PM
Fifth Talor'etan sat in the canteen, in the corner, facing the door. Usually he wouldn't be concerned about tactically advantageous seating, but those Starfleet officers had been gathering in conspicuous groups and muttering things lately and he didn't like the look of it. He started eating.
3
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 02:42 PM
Ramat, actually eating whatever the hell it was that the Iconians came up with to help keep him alive? Weirrrrrd! Well, that was what was happening indeed with him as he walked past his 'brother'. Well, that and he looked fit to keel over and faint, no thanks to not shrouding for 11 whole yerars. "Have you heard the rumors?" He asked as he paused at the other's side.
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 02:48 PM
Talor'etan stopped eating and looked up at the other soldier of the Dominion. Well, ex-soldier. As if that ever really stopped. "I have the feeling I'm about to." He grunted. "Sit down at least."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 02:51 PM
Gladly. He dropped into the seat across from him. He glanced left and right once each, ascertaining that no one else was listening too close - and said, in Jem'hadar, "We are leaving."
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 02:54 PM
Talor huffed. "We." He ate another sporkful of mystery substance, then raised the empty utensil in a celebratory gesture. "Victory is life." There was something distinctly sarcastic about the motion, because he fully anticipated this guy was going to get himself killed.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 02:56 PM
"Yes. Victory is life. You join us." Once again in Jem'hadar - a short language, mostly commands and orders rather than full sentences. "You can be free. Help us?" (edited)
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 03:00 PM
"You have the optimism of a yearling." Talor said flatly and without affect, which was how he said most things. Still, he figured, he might as well hear the plan out. "What help?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 03:07 PM
"Help to evacuate others." He answered flatly. He could tell that perhaps the other thought he was being overoptimistic purely from his tone of voice. Whatever. Let him think that way if he so wished. "A signal will come. When it does we must run for the lower levels. We will need you to help to move the injured or very young."
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 03:10 PM
Talor blinked once and stared Ramat down for a few moments. "What do I gain from helping to move the weak?" Weak wasn't a pejorative per se, he meant it completely matter-of-factly. "Other than death."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 03:11 PM
"The chance to reclaim your life in battle once more." Ramat's icy blue eyes fixed firmly on his blood brother. Was Talor even his blood brother? Bleh, dunno.
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 03:14 PM
Talor laughed. This was a rarity. "Will I be battling your young and injured? Will I be able to punch your Vorta?" He replied, faintly amused. "I do not see how helping Starfleet will help me reclaim my life. I have long been dead." In this case metaphorically.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 03:19 PM
"Not our bloody young and injured, or our Vorta, of course! The guards if need be. We can return you to your company. So you have long been dead without battle. So stand up, reach out and reclaim your life in the heat of battle once more!" He argued back. "Is that not what you want? To have the chance to fulfill the purpose you and I were bred for?"
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 03:24 PM
"Unless the Dominion and Federation have both had a change of heart, and are now one, I was not bred to help you." He replied, unbothered. "Where will I go from here?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 03:26 PM
"The Federation can find a way to return you to your unit. Or to Dominion space. Or elsewhere. Whichever is your choice. You say your unit awaits you at Deep Space Nine, did you not? So we can return you to them if you so wish."
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 03:30 PM
"I will return disgraced." He said this too matter-of-factly. He didnt seem to particularly care. "But I will not be aiding the enemy, and that is better. Where do you need me?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 03:33 PM
"Await the signal when it comes - a Vulcan ta'al greeting. Find the injured or very young and help to move them however you can. If you require assistance hold up a closed fist." Ramat answered. "Victory is life. We will attain victory, all of us. For now, however, we wait."
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 03:42 PM
He cleared his throat, a low rumble. "Where can they be found and where will I be moving them?"
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 03:49 PM
"Follow us. The young - I can lead you to them. I think they might like you." Ramat's lips quirked upward in an amused smile. The idea of the children clambering all over his poor brother was somehow rather amusing to him - oh, the suffering. "To them you would likely be a dragon on two feet. They will likely grow rather attached to you..."
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 03:52 PM
"I do not know what a dragon is." Talor'etan replied flatly. "And I dislike the young. They are fragile and unlikely to be useful. But I will assist."
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 03:58 PM
"Giant lizards of Terran legend. They may or may not be able to exhale flames from their jaws at will." Ramat answered, shaking his head. Honestly, humans had the strangest customs and folktales. "I advise that you do not waste time considering the notion. Simply go along with their imaginations. They will stay calm and happy that way." (edited)
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 04:03 PM
Talor shook his head. "The opinions of your young and injured do not concern me. I will move them." He said, not particularly interested in silly legends or how averse the children might be to being carried off to the evacuation point.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 04:08 PM
"That's all I really ask." Still, however, the thought of Talor'etan carrying screaming or squealing children to the tunnels was absolutely hilarious to imagine. Not that it was a bad thing at all, mind. It made him chuckle darkly. "Until then. I should be going to my next shift."
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 04:09 PM
Talor nodded gruffly, wondering what in the name of the Founders he'd gotten himself into. "Yes." He replied, sitting back again.
Lt. JG. Ramat'iklan 12-Apr-21 04:24 PM
Rams merely smiled and walked off with his empty plate.
Commander Blanche Carlisle 12-Apr-21 05:55 PM
Arriving at the canteen, Blanche retraced her steps to the nursery's entrance as discretely as she could, lingering there in anticipation of Ramat's arrival.
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 05:55 PM
Talor looked up at the medic, then looked down again. Founders' spit, people were moving conspicuously. Must be about time.
Lt. JG. Drevas Kniel 12-Apr-21 05:58 PM
[Rams]Indeed. Rams followed behind her soon after. There was a momentary glance cast backward at his fellow countryman as he disappeared through the entrance. The message was simple: follow.
Fifth Talor'etan BOT 12-Apr-21 05:59 PM
He knew a silent signal when he saw one. He followed.
Lt. JG. Aaron Miller 12-Apr-21 06:41 PM
[D]Some of the more sympathetic inmates who had heard about the plan began to assemble in the canteen, causing a fuss for the guards and distracting them from the crew's escape. (edited)
